Review: we were lucky enough to meet and share a chilled tea with agung rai the ownerinspiration behind this beautiful haven in amongst the traditional rice fields apparently thats the sort of man he is one who delights in his own culture and loves to show it off to foreigners while learning about theirs he is widely travelled philanthropist who does what he does because he loves doing it he and his wife dreamed of and developed this amazing integrated space where nature culture and art are inter changeable and in complete harmonythrough their mainly private collection you can gain an understanding of the development of indonesian art and how religion and culture are inter changeable the exhibition traces the development of indonesian art from traditional to moderna must see if you like art and culture
Name: Agung Rai Museum of Art (ARMA)

Review: we have visited all the major wellknown art museums in and around ubud  and this is our favouriteit is poetry the way all the architectural and landscaping elements of three restaurants a luxury resort cultural centre educational facility and art museum are harmonically juxtaposed together as a delightful work of artthis particular art museum is actually more than just a museumit is part of a much greater whole a much broader encompassing vision by agung rai  a surprisingly humble  gentle man whom we had the privilege to personally meet during our visit therethe man himself  a local legend in the making  can be found frequently strolling around the immensely delightful surroundings smiling and greeting guests visitors and staff  making himself available a work of art himselfbe prepared to spend more time here  its worth every valuable minuteenjoy
Name: Agung Rai Museum of Art (ARMA)

Review: there are  museums inside  one traditional and one modern art the area is surrounded with lush green gardens and very cool we were given booklets about the museum and free coffee  drink coupons after we bought the ticketsthe paintings were very beautiful some kids were having music lessons there that time and overall its a pleasant experience to learn more about bali history  beliefs and how it has evolved with time
Name: Agung Rai Museum of Art (ARMA)

Review: if you are interested in art and learning some history about ubud through art this is the place to go nice grounds a coffee shop make sure you visit the artists painting and carving in the garden
Name: Agung Rai Museum of Art (ARMA)

Review: the agung rai museum was one of my highlights when i was in ubud you can spend a lot of time watching the nice art and the architecture but you also have a nice time watching the beauftiful garden the water garden and the rice fields when you come in the afternoon at  pm little girls start to practice their traditional balinese dancing which is really nice to watch also you can watch little boys practicing some kind of traditional xylophone also the locals working there were super nice and shared there pineapple with me underneath a nice palmtree i really enjoyed the agung rai museum and love to come back some day
Name: Agung Rai Museum of Art (ARMA)

Review: i came to the museum by accident which turned out to be one of the happiest accidents of my bali trip amazingly beautiful and peaceful gardens with very few people where onr can sit and enjoy the nature and cool spacious halls with paintingswhat more can one ask for you can also watch local artists at work in the gardens or a kids dance classyou just have to check in advance when it is taking place be sure to go to the cafe near the museum entrance and enjoy your free drink while sitting in the shade near the rice terraces
Name: Agung Rai Museum of Art (ARMA)

Review: if you really want to understand the culture of the balinese i have found no better place on the island for cooking classes balinese painting batik or cultural heritage theyre often performances most nights at either of the stages on site
Name: Agung Rai Museum of Art (ARMA)

Review: girlfriend and i went here on a rainy afternoon a lot of the artwork is inside buildings but the grounds outside are really nice but we couldnt enjoy it to the fullest due to the rain the artwork itself is great and give you a lot of context to the culture of bali they also offer a free drink when you want to rest your feet
Name: Agung Rai Museum of Art (ARMA)

Review: at first i thought k was a bit steep for the entrance price but included in that price is an informative book about the museum and a tea or coffee at the museum cafe so all things considered the price is fairthe collection is somewhat interesting there are many fine works but unfortunately there is little information about why the works are grouped together as they areinterps panels are in english chinese and japanese which is great but where extensive interps are included they are in english only only one section  on the life of walter spies  includes information in bahasathe other disappointing aspect to the collection and the reason it lost a star from me was the lack of any signage on the sculptures costumes and furniture come on curators lift your game
Name: Agung Rai Museum of Art (ARMA)

Review: if you love art and want to see authentic work visit here great break from the busier streets nice garden area to relax in
Name: Agung Rai Museum of Art (ARMA)

Review: the art displays were interesting and we were able to talk to artists completing paintings and carving the gardens are very peaceful the entry includes a drink in the cafe
Name: Agung Rai Museum of Art (ARMA)

Review: a great place to visit to enjoy not just art but also beautiful balinese architecture the estate and buildings are very pretty and the art is locally relevent and engaging worth a visit
Name: Agung Rai Museum of Art (ARMA)

Review: set in a lovely park area with a caferestaurant and a mini outdoor theatre where balinese dancing is performed there are two buildings housing the paintings with one mainly devoted to balinese artists and the other to foreign artists who found bali totally facinating excellent value for money with only a small entrance fee
Name: Agung Rai Museum of Art (ARMA)

Review: i went to this museum last week with my friends and it was nothing special about this museum their service was bad  no once guide us during our visit in this museum this considered as a gallery rather than a museum not recommended to visit
Name: Agung Rai Museum of Art (ARMA)

Review: a little removed from the busyness of ubud this museum is definitely worth a visit beautiful groundsgardens great art collection delightful coffee shop we had been before and were not disappointed by a return visit
Name: Agung Rai Museum of Art (ARMA)

Review: a must see place if you are art lover the amenities are great  and after the tour you can enjoy complementary tea or coffee on their terrace the rice pudding is great
Name: Agung Rai Museum of Art (ARMA)

Review: there are two locations one is with a water garden and that is the one we have been to very nice spot to visit if you based somewhere nearby allow a coup hours at least to enjoy their grounds as well
Name: Agung Rai Museum of Art (ARMA)

Review: this is not just a centre for visual but performing arts as well it is established to help the local people get a platform to learn and develop their skills in different forms of arts like painting sculpture dance and music excited visitors could surely optimise the visit in the museum as it offers many services like viewing of paintings and special exhibitions enjoying theatre recitals and watching dance or music performances
Name: Agung Rai Museum of Art (ARMA)

Review: beautiful examples of different styled balinese art i learnt a lot about the balinese culture through the art presented and the meanings behind them its an  aud entry or  idr entry and which included either a hotcold tea or coffee at the arma cafe definitely worth it though
Name: Agung Rai Museum of Art (ARMA)

Review: we must have spent a good couple of hours touring this lovely space set just off busy ubud town center there are two halls one for con temporary art and the other for traditional you can see a lot of the countrys culture and history through the works
Name: Agung Rai Museum of Art (ARMA)

Review: we spent several hours looking through the different exhibits and having a walk through the adjacent hotel gardens its a peaceful space and gives you a break from the hustle and bustle in ubuds streets staff were very friendly and informative
Name: Agung Rai Museum of Art (ARMA)

Review: set in beautiful grounds the history of balinese art is laid out in two large exhibition halls with many fascinating pictures
Name: Agung Rai Museum of Art (ARMA)

Review: loved returning again to spend a quiet few hours looking at the art enjoying iced coffee and later having lunch
Name: Agung Rai Museum of Art (ARMA)

Review: beautiful and best museum in ubud the buildings are beautiful and paintings beautiful definitely worth a visit
Name: Agung Rai Museum of Art (ARMA)

Review: nice visit am not really an arty person but very interesting of the layout and the actual art itself wasnt to impressed as we were followed about all the time and being asked if we wanted to buy some of the pictures and felt that we couldnt have time to ourselves to have a good look around i would go again but with a party of us we only stayed for about  minutes
Name: Agung Rai Museum of Art (ARMA)

Review: if you want to experience the technique of indonesian artists and also learn about the many stories then this musuem is very good i found the style very repetative myself but could appreciate the talent that goes in to many of the paintingsthe best thing we did though was book for the cak rina dance the full moon kecak and fire dance in the grounds of the arma gallerybest cultural show ive ver seen hypnotic chanting culminating in crazy fire throwing and fire balls being kicked around on stage i was so engrossed when the fire tossing started and the chanting reached the peak i shouted out whats going on like the teenager from poltergeist  my partner found this amusing great show well worth the visit back there are others in ubud but this cak rina dance company is awesome
Name: Agung Rai Museum of Art (ARMA)

Review: really a must if you want to see examples of edward spies work as well as modern and traditional balinese artsetting is fabulous under huge treesbeware the walkways can be slipperythere are local artists working on the grounds
Name: Agung Rai Museum of Art (ARMA)

Review: the largest museum in ubud the arma is a great place to get a taste for the range of artistic styles and artists that have come from or been influenced by bali we particularly enjoyed the arma for helping us understand a bit more about the different traditions within contemporary balinese art your admission includes a complimentary tea which makes it a good value and nice experience to escape from the busy streets of ubud
Name: Agung Rai Museum of Art (ARMA)

Review: lovely museum where the owner has labelled even the trees in the garden an interesting collection of well displayed and documented paintings housed in a spectacular building set within lush gardens the owner often stops by and shows visitors around himself it has won many awards over the years
Name: Agung Rai Museum of Art (ARMA)

Review: this is actually a small city with gardens multiple restaurants performance areas a hotel villas and museum galleriesthe museum collection is of a rather high quality and the inclusion of non indonesian artists just adds to the enjoyment of the local art there are a few buildings so use the map to get around i really enjoyed strolling the gardens between galleries to refresh my senses the batik collection is outstanding and reason alone to visit heretheres a coffee shop near the main entrance theres also a thai restaurant at the bottom of the complex at the back entrance i loved taking a break on the outside terrace of the thai restaurant with the view of the paddies coconut palms and the stone maidens pouring water into the canalyou could also do the elephant cave before or after since its sorta in the same direction however the museum requires much more time
Name: Agung Rai Museum of Art (ARMA)

Review: beautiful surrounds and gardens a wonderful hidden gemhighly recommend a visit after lunch at arma restaurant delicious food
Name: Agung Rai Museum of Art (ARMA)

Review: im never tired of visiting this great museum  here you may view some of the best paintings of bali as well as talk to the owner agung rai a most pleasant man plus a font of knowledge
Name: Agung Rai Museum of Art (ARMA)

Review: really interesting to see both traditional and modern art on display in large galleries got an education about art history of bali and there are some exceptional pieces i would like to go again to view at a more leisurely pace the water garden was a real bonus
Name: Agung Rai Museum of Art (ARMA)

Review: this remarkable museum contains not only treasures of the best of balinese paintings but also the whole historical backgroundset in stunning gardens the ornate and generous buildings impart a sense of grandeur yet have a sensitive touch meet artists see children playing and enjoy the dances and music of bali
Name: Agung Rai Museum of Art (ARMA)

Review: the ticket price of k comes with a drink i especially enjoyed the garden of the museum the paintings are interesting too we took an hour to view all the collections and enjoy our cold drinks with free wifi
Name: Agung Rai Museum of Art (ARMA)

Review: it is a good place to get familiar with balinese art but overall there is a lack of love and care the hanging is poor and the art looks lost in this massive building some art work is not worth being there at all whilst you can read a lot about walter spies in one section that looks like a spies memorial the paintings on display are cheap reproductions how can you do this to spies and to yourself the only real spies painting is a little tableau hanging in an inner sanctum like room and it is dirty and looks really poorly displayed i felt just sorry
Name: Agung Rai Museum of Art (ARMA)

Review: we loved the grounds of this museum very much the complimentary coffee at the restaurant was also well appreciated the buildings and surroundings are very beautiful the paintings as such are not spectacular theyre worth seeing if you have an idle hour but i wouldnt say that theyre a mustsee in ubud
Name: Agung Rai Museum of Art (ARMA)

Review: allow a half the day to see all the indonesian art and the paintings of expats who spent a lot of time in balithere is a lot of information provided near the displays which really helps a highlight was watching the children learning indonesian traditional dance
Name: Agung Rai Museum of Art (ARMA)

Review: agung rai museum of art is set in beautiful gardens and offers an outstanding collection of balinese art it houses also the most comprehensive collection of the works of one of balis greatest traditional artists gusti lempadits well worth a visit if you are a lover of asian art also the restaurantcafe is a relaxing space to take a break  the museum also often exhibits traveling collections and has balinese trafitional dance pergormancestheir gift shop has treasures from which to buy yourself or friends and family a gift
Name: Agung Rai Museum of Art (ARMA)

Review: this museum is close to the palace and its worth going because of its beautiful buildings and gardens exhibits are not that many to see but some lovely paintings
Name: Agung Rai Museum of Art (ARMA)

Review: the wonderful things about arma museum aside from their huge arts collection on every form was their huge  beautiful landscape it like you were transported on different time were you could enjoy the beautiful taste of arts with its own style
Name: Agung Rai Museum of Art (ARMA)

Review: we decided to see one of their night performances legong classic and were absolutely blown away by the talent we saw and best of all it was so cheapthe musicians do a great job of setting and controlling the mood throughout the performances the dancers do an amazing job of captivating you through there eye contact facial expressions and intricate dance movesplease if you are in ubud make sure you check out one of their night shows it is a experience you do not what to miss such truly talented performers wish we had the time to see more
Name: Agung Rai Museum of Art (ARMA)

Review: rather big collection of art in well kept buildings after the ticketstand go straight through the court yard and then keep to your right and youll come to two the two buildings with makes the art gallery to the left is a cafe with bad tasting coffee and staff that doesnt speak the best english
Name: Agung Rai Museum of Art (ARMA)

Review: great foresight shown by the agung rai family a wonderful historical collection of all art forms need at least  hours to absorb it all
Name: Agung Rai Museum of Art (ARMA)

Review: it was one of our best visits in ubud the museum is a complex of gardens and balinese style buildings which makes it a great visit also for kids the exhibitions are comprehensive and showcase both traditional and modern eras of balinese painting the gardens are a small piece of paradise with water running through them and with other facilities like restaurant and guest houses we also enjoyed a complimentary drink in the museums restaurant after our visit
Name: Agung Rai Museum of Art (ARMA)

Review: you cannot take pictures of the art in the gallerys but it was quite nice the grounds of the museum are really wonderful too with nicely placed statues ponds and courtyards really nice place to stroll around there is a cafe and a shop the shop has some very nice and expensive items for sale they have an outdoor stage for traditional dance check for the schedule if you want to include that in a visit
Name: Agung Rai Museum of Art (ARMA)

Review: arma is more than a museum it is an all encompassing experience it has all the elements of a traditional balinese village and compound with a good history of balinese art as well as contmeporary pieces present in a magnificent setting
Name: Agung Rai Museum of Art (ARMA)

Review: lovely place we booked a woodcarving course at the last minute our teacher took an hour to arrive so we walked around the museum while waiting lovely buildings interesting art the woodcarving course was great fun
Name: Agung Rai Museum of Art (ARMA)

Review: if you want to visit only one museum in ubud go to neka art museum see my review if you want see two then the agung rai museum of art arma must be on your listthis is really just a review of the museum exhibits and the grounds i know arma is also a performance art museum with lot of traditional balinese dance performances but i didnt see those so i cant review it the museum is located on really nice grounds with a lush garden excellent coffee shop is on the premises where you can enjoy your complimentary drink included in the price of admission idr  plenty of shaded areas and benches to relax and rest very peaceful local artists are here painting or carving artwork for salethe actual exhibitions are housed in two buildings lots of contemporary balinese and indonesian artists and some foreigns too while i was there there was a gallery dedicated to walter spies paintings beautiful and yes dont miss the huge made kedol artwork called golden rice very unique technique dimensional oil canvas paintinggreatly recommended combine it with the monkey forest sanctuary visit as it is an easy walk away
Name: Agung Rai Museum of Art (ARMA)

Review: the founder began his collection decades ago and the museum displays a range of work from quite old up through recent the details in traditional balinese art are mindstaggering and i really liked the comparatively few contemporary pieces which manage to meld traditional with creative exploration
Name: Agung Rai Museum of Art (ARMA)

Review: interesting exhibition lovely gardens and an oasis of peace by indonesian standards the entrance price is expensive but you do get a coffee or tea in excellent surroundings the restaurant at the entrance is a bit pricey
Name: Agung Rai Museum of Art (ARMA)

Review: we walked  slowly with a coffee break from market end of ubud to museum loved the art galleries two separate buildings beautiful grounds cafe enjoyed the visit
Name: Agung Rai Museum of Art (ARMA)

Review: what a well curated museum mr agung rai is a man that lives for the balinese culture and is eager to share this heritage with the world taking some time off to step into this wonderful little museum is an enriching experience for everyone who wants to dwelve deeper into balinese culture a mustdo when in ubud
Name: Agung Rai Museum of Art (ARMA)

Review: ive always baulked at the ticket cost which frankly isnt worth it  that said if you can get in for less or better still free its a fantastic look at balinese art the way it used to be  the local stuff in the shops now is rubbish
Name: Agung Rai Museum of Art (ARMA)

Review: beautiful artwork in lovely gardens not overcrowded which was a pleasant change the owner chatted with us about the gallery and the gardens which was wonderful the meal at thethai restaurant was delicious well worth the
Name: Agung Rai Museum of Art (ARMA)

Review: well worth a visit lots of local and international artists work didnt realise how much dutch influence there was here ticket includes free tea or coffee at the end the site is really beautiful with some great rice terraces to see too definitely go have a look and allow  hours
Name: Agung Rai Museum of Art (ARMA)

Review: an excellent range of paintings from a wide range of styles  from traditional balinese art to pictures you would see in the goma allow time if youre interested in art as you will need it
Name: Agung Rai Museum of Art (ARMA)

Review: what a huge museum but i felt so comfortable there entrance ticket includes a coffee or tea grounds are huge extraordinary pieces of art probably more exhibits than one can view seriously within one single day worth a second visit i had a short break in the caf they offer good food
Name: Agung Rai Museum of Art (ARMA)

Review: conveniently located in ubud this stop provided us with a twohour excursion in the heart of the city the paintings were incredible while still others were not so much the paintings depicting the traditional balinese lifestyle were particularly interesting to us some very beautiful pieces may not be around to view in another  years maybe even in the next  yearsthe balinese coffee here had a lot of coffee grind in it so we passed on our cups and headed for the rice paddies located on the side of the property this was a nice little walk and the paddies were green too but will probably be harvested this week or next dont forget your mosquito repellent
Name: Agung Rai Museum of Art (ARMA)

Review: nice gallery particularly enjoyed he traditional art grounds are pretty you get an interesting booklet about the gallery and a free teacoffee entrance fee is about a min walk from the centre
Name: Agung Rai Museum of Art (ARMA)

Review: if you are going to just one museum in ubud choose the neka if two then add arma nice gardens and a range of art and their are painters working in the garden you get a free coffee id recommend the iced coffee with your entrance ticket and get to sit in a nice open cafe to consume it the attached shop has some lovely things in it dont miss the huge textured rice fields painting in a central room of the lower left hand building
Name: Agung Rai Museum of Art (ARMA)

Review: i have been here many times and always bring visiting family and friends to experience this beautiful settingthe art gallery is amazing in itself  both the building and the art works displayed but it is the overall concept including the expansive grounds designed for environment people culture and beliefs which are truly exceptional
Name: Agung Rai Museum of Art (ARMA)

Review: this is an amazing property with a very interesting history the project was fuelled by the passion of one man for art the grounds are beautiful and there is a lot of art on display you can also see artists at work there is also a great deal of interesting information in the gallery the entrance fee includes coffee or tea and a snack at the cafe all round it is a great place to spend a couple of peaceful hours particularly if you are interested in balinese art my husband isnt a real art fan but he came with me and still enjoyed it he particularly liked some of the historical information on display in the gallery
Name: Agung Rai Museum of Art (ARMA)

Review: looking at the beautiful painting collection and enjoying their beautiful garden just make your perfect day
Name: Agung Rai Museum of Art (ARMA)

Review: the art was a bit overpriced but you can haggle theres modern traditional and local art its worth seeing
Name: Agung Rai Museum of Art (ARMA)

Review: lovely gardens and beautiful tradition paintings sunday morning is a treat since you can watch young balinese children learn traditional dance
Name: Agung Rai Museum of Art (ARMA)

Review: we have visited ubud many times since the early s but cannot remember ever entering arma what a delight to leave the noisy commercialism of central ubud behind when entering the grounds yes a little bedraggled but also a lovely green oasis the two large galleries contain some very good balinese art collected by the founder agung rai in two traditional styled galleries there are often dance lessons going on to the side of one of the galleries free lessons for young girls funded by the founder out the back are some rice paddies and in the grounds a number of water features this museum and its  hectares of grounds are a panacea to the commercialism that dominates the main streets of ubud these days
Name: Agung Rai Museum of Art (ARMA)

Review: i didnt get the culture sense its more like a resort showing its private collection and charging k for it
Name: Agung Rai Museum of Art (ARMA)

Review: we were looking for a bit of a break from the tourist madness of ubud and wanted to see some of the culture of indonesiathis tool is to the agung rai museum of art it was easy to find and entrance was cheap kperson and included a free coffee or tea at one of the cafes on the museum groundsthe entire museum was nearly empty we saw less than  other people there whole time we were therethey had many nice paintings and it was nice to see some of the cultural side offer indonesia its not one of the best museums ive been to its selection is pretty small and things are poorly organized the small map they handed out hard to call a map buildings seemed to be labeled different from the map and there wasnt a simple and clear description of what each building containedsome rooms had paintings on the floors this is good and bad bad that they werent properly displayed but good that there appears to be no shortage of art to displayall in all happy we went and this museum definitely has potential but dont expect to see a top or even nd tier museum
Name: Agung Rai Museum of Art (ARMA)

Review: very good museum and gallery for classical balinese art and some moderncontemporary selections in the gallery its something that you visit once and enough unless they are having an exhibitions and then you can see more selections
Name: Agung Rai Museum of Art (ARMA)

Review: make sure you allocate enough time to visit this site an hour in not enough to take in all of the architecture art and activities we took a balinese dance class  highly recommended then walked the grounds there is a pavilion with balinese instruments that some young boys happened to be playing around on  even without structure the sounds are incredible camera worthy spots abound and there are also a number of quiet areas for reflection there were several painters around the property as well wish i had more time to explore and will definitely come back when i return
Name: Agung Rai Museum of Art (ARMA)

Review: this museum is really a collection of buildings around a garden and a tea room you can also see current artists in residence who are creating inside the property i had no idea what constituted balinese art and this is a good introduction  history lesson the modern art was wonderful as well your ticket gets you a free drink at the tea room which is nice to use after you walk through the many buildings
Name: Agung Rai Museum of Art (ARMA)

Review: beautiful place to visit the art museum in the garden with different sort of plantsnice pictures in three buildings cafeteria with wifi and fine meal you can find very inspired story about years old bali artist there
Name: Agung Rai Museum of Art (ARMA)

Review: we came here to watch a balinese dance but sadly they werent doing one that night fortunately we had a lovely time anyway great museum in beautiful grounds there are a couple of buildings showing traditional balinese paintings an open air theatre pretty gardens and various places to get fooddrink you get a free drink with your ticket too the museum is on the same site as a hotel which has even more restaurant choices so we stuck around for dinner and had a delicious meal at the thai restaurant would highly recommend a visit
Name: Agung Rai Museum of Art (ARMA)

Review: its a very nice big museum full of paintings and its excellent  its all well presented and worth seeing  the garden and the place is so beautiful  its not crowded when we went there  i really recommend people to come and see this specially if you like paintings and arts
Name: Agung Rai Museum of Art (ARMA)

Review: we went on a weekday evening and the place was completely dead which meant we could really work at our own place it was absolutely stunning and interesting to see the art periods in bali highly recommend visiting
Name: Agung Rai Museum of Art (ARMA)

Review: blissfully free of tour buses and crowds this museum will expose you to styles of art not seen in european or north american museums and each piece is explained which is helpful if you cannot recite the ramayana this is a delightful way to spend a few hours in ubud
Name: Agung Rai Museum of Art (ARMA)

Review: excellent museum on indonesian art underrated in guide books i was already many times here  the coffeeshop is fun too very good quality coffee
Name: Agung Rai Museum of Art (ARMA)

Review: very nice art collection i was especially pleased to see a original painting from walter spies magnificent to see up closethe collection is a mix between some beautiful contemporary art artwork form the pita maha period several european artist as hofker bonnet meier and some stunning pieces form javanese raden salehthe information about a piece of art is very minimal only the title is translated that is a shamethe grounds are beautiful very green and lushthe museum is adjacent to the arms resort hotel you can have a look around the grounds some views of rice fields not very spectacular though
Name: Agung Rai Museum of Art (ARMA)

Review: the compound is huge and has  buildings to showcase its vast paintings from different artists worth the visit
Name: Agung Rai Museum of Art (ARMA)

Review: this museum has permanent exhibitions of paintings ranging from traditional to contemporary they also give a portal for native painters and woodcarvers to demonstrate the genuine balis everyday life as showcased on their designs
Name: Agung Rai Museum of Art (ARMA)

Review: arma has a numerous art collection that mostly is paintings the themes of those paintings are various from local to international artists the location of the museum itself is in the heart of ubud easily reach by any transportation i love the blissful nuance the time i stepped the entrance of the museum i paid rp  for the entrance fee for domestic visitors
Name: Agung Rai Museum of Art (ARMA)

Review: this updated art museum contains important but accessible paintings and wood sculptures  admission includes coffee or tea and access to extensive grounds
Name: Agung Rai Museum of Art (ARMA)

Review: we only had an hour and a half we could easily have spent a whole afternoon or even a day exploring the grounds and all the different galleries the art covers a surprising range of traditional and some great modern works they also have concerts and other events id love to go back for something like that
Name: Agung Rai Museum of Art (ARMA)

Review: entering arma you feel a sense of calm we visited in the late afternoon and it was very quiet wondering around the different rooms to see both modern and traditional works was very fascinating we met a local artist and spent a few hours talking with him about the importance of balinese art and how it links to the culture the locals very very friendly and are a fountain of knowledge if you give them your time beautiful spot
Name: Agung Rai Museum of Art (ARMA)

Review: walk amongst the massive traditional balinese grounds have a traditional balinese meal at the cafe soak in the exquisite ambience  architecture really peaceful zone in the heart of ubud small entrance fee which goes back into the foundation
Name: Agung Rai Museum of Art (ARMA)

Review: we only had time to visit the part of the museum which houses the modern pieces i so enjoyed it especially the portraits and landscapeswe took a break in the warung kopi to get a free cup of coffee and discovered they had so much more delicious things to eat and drinkthats when we discovered that agung rai did the sunrise golden hour tour personallywe managed to squeeze the tour in the next morning such a charming man with so much knowledge of balinese culture art and life it was a highlight of our trip
Name: Agung Rai Museum of Art (ARMA)

Review: one enters this museum through a garden and sees some sculptures woodcuts and lots of interesting trees there are a few buildings housing paintings by some of balis well known artists on the second floor there are some very interesting modern paintings this museum is very nice but definitely not on the same level as the neka museum
Name: Agung Rai Museum of Art (ARMA)

Review: it is a large gallery ubud has many galleries and ranges from modern art on block mount to master painters see artists paintings of the rice fields and much more traditional gardens outside simply stunning and of course a place to get out of the sun and heat as well
Name: Agung Rai Museum of Art (ARMA)

Review: if you like looking at art and like enjoying nature as well youll enjoy this museum you can walk around the manicured grounds and indonesian style architecture to view the paintings in different buildings there were even barong kris dance costumes displayed as well we were also offered a complimentary ice tea or coffee at their outdoor cafe it was such a great relaxing way to end our day
Name: Agung Rai Museum of Art (ARMA)

Review: a pleasant enough place to while away an hour or two nice spacious grounds the art collection has a strong emphasis on balinese painters personally i preferred the neka art museum which displays more of the works of european artists who spent time in bali also the captions at neka explain more about what makes the pictures appealing the grounds at neka are more compact but in my opinion are even more beautiful in the way they harmonise the buildings and nature signs steer you from gallery to gallery at neka but here i found it more difficult to get my bearings
Name: Agung Rai Museum of Art (ARMA)

Review: a great place to visit to avoid the heat for a few hours it was empty when we visited and we were left to wander around and explore by ourselves the art exhibits themselves are fascinating and well curated plus the grounds are fabulous there is private accommodation for guests within the grounds which i would definitely investigate if i return to ubud the dances held there every evening are supposedly of a high quality we enjoyed one show and really appreciated receiving a synopsis of what we were about to see which we did not get at other venues
Name: Agung Rai Museum of Art (ARMA)

Review: agung rai displays his impressive collection of traditional and contemporary art in a stunning airy palace of art balinese culture is unique in all the world and this collection lets you understand why and agung rai is often on hand to graciously answer your questions the museum is within the beautiful gardens of arma resort an oasis worth seeing near ubud
Name: Agung Rai Museum of Art (ARMA)

Review: i loved spending the afternoon here todayinteresting pieces of art housed in beautiful balinese buildings followed by relaxing in the gardens going for a walk at the back of the museum to the rice field and river and just being in an oasis of calmchoice of two cafes and a restaurantwill definitely return to check out the art workshops and evening dancesrecommendedayesha
Name: Agung Rai Museum of Art (ARMA)

Review: a mix of original style balinese art and european inspired balinese art encompassed in lovely gardens
Name: Agung Rai Museum of Art (ARMA)

Review: nice museum specially garden and to have an idea about indonesian art quite place to visitif you are around you have to see
Name: Agung Rai Museum of Art (ARMA)

Review: nothing much to say about this as its just on the way to ubud centre hardly took  minutes to check out whole museum its good and traditional but we didnt liked it much no tickets for this
Name: Agung Rai Museum of Art (ARMA)

Review: i visited and found the artwork to be a compilation of mediums and styles that must be seen as ubud is known for art and craft this is one destination to ensure you see what has influenced and continues to influence the artists of bali and in particular ubud
Name: Agung Rai Museum of Art (ARMA)

Review: while all the exhibition is about paintings i also enjoy the natural surroundings with a lots of trees and tranquil ambiance i suggest you should spend at least  and a half hours to discover all things ticket is k rp including a tea or coffee and a brochure
Name: Agung Rai Museum of Art (ARMA)

Review: there is always something going on here if you love art it is well worth a visit the gardens are also very beautiful
Name: Agung Rai Museum of Art (ARMA)

Review: everything at this place is art  the architecture the gardens the paintings the traditional but also the modern pieces of arta beautiful place to visit calm and also restful for the heart and the mindthe rooms are vast and the space is also a contribution of the beauty of the museum
Name: Agung Rai Museum of Art (ARMA)

Review: although the museum is quite small but it is great to see local baliness collection we were amazed by the work that was exhibited  not cheap but worth it for the experience
Name: Agung Rai Museum of Art (ARMA)

Review: the museum building and also resort is amazing itself big and beautiful garden with a lot of charm the museum offers presentation of local dance and culture almost every night for very small prices if it is not raining you can even see the presentation in an open air stage worthy the visit
Name: Agung Rai Museum of Art (ARMA)

Review: its located in a beautiful park which invites for a relaxing day to stroll around this is a really impressive collection of bali artwork through the years amazing art work
Name: Agung Rai Museum of Art (ARMA)

Review: beautiful art and beautiful grounds a must half day visit if you are in ubud lots of nice shady spot to sit and rest too
Name: Agung Rai Museum of Art (ARMA)

Review: this place has a high entry fee idr but is really good one gets a good understanding of various styles of art development in indonesia from monochrome to modern theres a beautiful depiction of scenes from the ramayana and mahabharata and a lot of wonderful modern art they give you a free tea or coffee at their cafe after youve walked across the various galleries there are three and the area is quite big you can also walk to the rice fields from this place for a nice view
Name: Agung Rai Museum of Art (ARMA)

Review: this place is truly exquisite they have luxurious villas but i opted for a simple room which was really excellent very very beautiful grounds and so secluded from the hustle and bustle of ubud the swimming pool is amazing
Name: Agung Rai Museum of Art (ARMA)

Review: great art museum showing some really interesting work just as good as things ive seen in new york or london
Name: Agung Rai Museum of Art (ARMA)

Review: its a nice place with very nice paintings the grounds are nice lovely paintings definitely recommend for art lovers
Name: Agung Rai Museum of Art (ARMA)

Review: we went for an evening performance there were at least  guys in the gong orchestra all ages the orchestra has been together since  there were fathers and sons in it together we learned after and there were half a dozen dance performances it was nice we might go again to one of the others ones there is a different one each night
Name: Agung Rai Museum of Art (ARMA)

Review: tourists often associate bali with beaches surfing cheap booze and highend resorts the agung rai museum of art arma provides a portal into another dimension of bali walk through the entrance gates and youre transported to old bali complete with natural and serene surroundingsbalinese art was all around us from the stone carvings to the gardenscape there were artists illustrating daily life in bali on canvas and etches by woodcarvers we could also hear the gongs and clings of gamelans and the laughter of young children practising legong dancethe collection of artworks was housed in two large buildings one featuring the evolution of balinese art from monochromatic black and white to color and the other documenting early western influences on balinese art and some contemporary works beyond the galleries we could also engage in painting wood carving music dance workshops and tour of ancient ubudit was amazing to learn that this living museum was the vision and continued effort of one local man agung rai and not the indonesian government there was just so much arts and culture to experience in this cultural epicentre that we decided to stay the night and continue our exploration of traditional bali and old ubud
Name: Agung Rai Museum of Art (ARMA)

Review: the older balinese art is definitely not my thing it is too much black for my taste the museum itself is set into a nice garden like environment which is nice
Name: Agung Rai Museum of Art (ARMA)

Review: the grounds are pretty the galleries her interestingi found it a bit offputting to be walked through the gallery spaces by an attendant
Name: Agung Rai Museum of Art (ARMA)

Review: this is a really special place and apart from the artworks which are beautifully displayed there is also a cafe gift shop area for artists to paint and performance hall i enjoyed both the modern and traditional balinese art on display it was also a pleasure to walk around the grounds of the museum and resort and enjoy the interplay of water and gardens the entry ticket also included a complimentary drink and snack
Name: Agung Rai Museum of Art (ARMA)

Review: wen you come to this amazing port of the world there is one please very worth will visiting agung rai museum of art and yt gallery on jlray mas the art is amazing as the pleas good food to lovely worm staff gardens to loveall ubud and bali ar fun and moorrom yaari
Name: Agung Rai Museum of Art (ARMA)

Review: it is a great modern museum and also have tradicional paint and scultures you can see the artist working at his painting and with wood i take a two our class painting and i lear with the professor the balinese tecnique have wonderfull garden and caf
Name: Agung Rai Museum of Art (ARMA)

Review: incredible art works and super relaxing grounds ended up spending the whole day enjoying the beauty of life in this tranquille gem of a place
Name: Agung Rai Museum of Art (ARMA)

Review: i totally loved this museum that was surrounded by one of the most beautiful gardens i have ever seen it is a wonderful experience the area includes a caf aswell and teacoffe is included in the ticket price if you would like some stillness art and beautiful nature this is the place to go
Name: Agung Rai Museum of Art (ARMA)

Review: interesting modern and traditional art gorgeous grounds and gardens relaxed vibe ticket includes tea or coffee
Name: Agung Rai Museum of Art (ARMA)

Review: since we stayed at the resort we enjoyed the beautiful paintings and sculptures every day mr agung rai has been a serious art collector for decades even travelling around the world to bring authentic important balinese art pieces back to bali do not miss this art museum
Name: Agung Rai Museum of Art (ARMA)

Review: we visited three museums and the arma was the final and what a finale it is set in traditional balinese style it is the perfect mix of beautiful art in a transformative space the works are displayed beautifully by period and has a mix of classical and contemporary the grounds are just as impressive as the art work and it is refreshing to complete your visit with the complimentary drink be sure to visit the water garden too a nice escape from the tourists and a picture of balinese life and culture
Name: Agung Rai Museum of Art (ARMA)

Review: who would expect to find a large art museum in the middle of ubudmragung rai the founder creator and owner of this museum in the middle of the arma resort is a very successful art dealer with a passion for all things balinesethere is an extensive collection of exquisite balinese and indonesian art along with some spectacular contemporary art
Name: Agung Rai Museum of Art (ARMA)

Review: upon arrival to the art museum i did not plan to purchase a painting however upon leaving i found myself enamored with one particular piece and purchased this lovely painting it will always be a beautiful reminder of my experience there thank you to the exquisite artistry that has been imparted upon the balinese people by our maker namaste
Name: Agung Rai Museum of Art (ARMA)

Review: but no staff and no one to ask the whole museum felt derelict the garden was beautiful and is combined with arma resort which was a hotel and spa but no one in the park either a little bit spooky
Name: Agung Rai Museum of Art (ARMA)

Review: this museum hosts a great selection of balinese art at the same time its located in a beautiful park which invites for a relaxing day to stroll around theres also a nice cafe
Name: Agung Rai Museum of Art (ARMA)

Review: although the museum is quite small it houses some amazing art work it is great to see what local baliness artists can do
Name: Agung Rai Museum of Art (ARMA)

Review: we were amazed by the work that was exhibited it shows the beautiful and miraculous origins of balinese painting which you will never see anywhere on the world
Name: Agung Rai Museum of Art (ARMA)

Review: this is a really impressive collection of indonesian artwork through the years arma museum seems to be on large grounds with accommodation and a coffee shop etc the museum building is on  levels once you paid your k rp for entry there were no staff in the museum or guides so if you want a bit more information on the art you will have to google it your ticket gets you a free coffee from their coffee shop
Name: Agung Rai Museum of Art (ARMA)

Review: for a long time the leading museum in bali great collection of paintingsabsolutely worth a visit
Name: Agung Rai Museum of Art (ARMA)

Review: very intriguing museum founded by one of the most respected royals in bali has interesting department for dutch
Name: Agung Rai Museum of Art (ARMA)

Review: note  there is an admission fee   rp the grounds is huge n spacious by ubud city standard it is relatively near monkey forest but still a distance if you try to walk and its about a  hr walk fr the ubud palace which was where i started from lesson learntpaintings on show seem to be all from the private collection of the agung rai family they r extensive however do note its all about paintings n sculptures here came in midday when everything is a bit sleepy  no dance not much going on at restaurant free drinks at cafe w admission tickets
Name: Agung Rai Museum of Art (ARMA)

Review: the sprawling grounds here merit a good solid couple of hours to go through lovely works of art placed in buildings with lovely architecture took a workshop on making ceremonial offerings canggan sari and it was informative  not cheap but worth it for the experience arma was also the site of the nightly performances of the annual bali spirit festival so it was a nice treat to see it in both instances recommend
Name: Agung Rai Museum of Art (ARMA)

Review: close and really worth a visit the spies pictures amongst others are stunning picturesque setting and the little coffee shop serves good coffee and light eats do not miss this as such a reprieve from the ubud mayhem piece and solitude combined with truly interesting art make this a worthwhile part of your itinerary
Name: Agung Rai Museum of Art (ARMA)

Review: we went for the dance show only it was really good only  people in the crowd musicians were great and dancers were so captivating it goes on for just over an hour
Name: Agung Rai Museum of Art (ARMA)

Review: we enjoyed working our way through this manicured garden area and home to local art work well done for presenting and preserving art history of bali
Name: Agung Rai Museum of Art (ARMA)

Review: this is the most spectacular property in ubud the museums the wonderfullylandscaped grounds spa restaurants live events of all kinds cultural center etc its absolutely beautiful it also has hotel bungalows and a beautiful pool for guests it is amazingmy wife and i have experienced almost every aspect of arma we love it
Name: Agung Rai Museum of Art (ARMA)

Review: a real surprise just off the main road enormous and magnificent building with chandeliers exhibitions from famous painters in both water and oil and sculptors from around the world  do not take photographs the grounds and gardens are lovely to walk through down to the hotel and restaurant
Name: Agung Rai Museum of Art (ARMA)

Review: a visit to this museum is a must when you go to bali for more than just surfing and partying on the beach huge art and painting collection in a very attractive setting of park and balinese buildings also you can see here how much balinese people with influence do to preserve balinese culture and dont miss a visit to their coffee shop warung kopi when you are lucky you can see the founder of the museum and he will tell you some fascinating things about the museum and about bali history and culture
Name: Agung Rai Museum of Art (ARMA)

Review: my partner and i caught the legong telek performance and it was quite amazing it was our first experience watching a traditional balinese dance performance and we were simply wowed pity the museum was closed when we reached at  for the pm performance do be prepared with a raincoat or an umbrella as it is an outdoor performance insect repellent too if you tend to attract them the performance lasted an hour and it cost us rp i believe they have performances every night except thursdays and on special occasions definitely worth a visit
Name: Agung Rai Museum of Art (ARMA)

Review: the museum is about  km from ubud centre there is a resort shop and a cafe on the museum grounds the collection includes traditional and modern balian art the ticket price includes coffee or tea at the museum cafe
Name: Agung Rai Museum of Art (ARMA)

Review: its a lazy thursday afternoon when there are no performances unlike the other days where they have performances for the ticket price of k you get access to the  main gallery of many artistes the other days are going to give you better value for your money still its a quieter day and there arent too many people around to block or choke up the views of the paintings and water colouristthere are  entrances and they both are quite imposing and grand set in an balinese garden complete with pura of temples and rooms for the gamelan its very traditional and classic and you get to learn the history of how it came to become in the late afternoon and bring dinner along if you dont want to miss the mostly evening performances
Name: Agung Rai Museum of Art (ARMA)

Review: agung rai art museum is more then just a museumin a typical balinese setting and culture there is art displayed in the gardens its lovely walking through the gardens and interacting with the artist thereon top of that we were also fortunate to be there when there was a troupe of kids being taught the balinese dance routine we spent quite a bit of time admiring the lesson and getting some photos of themreally great experience of bali in a museum
Name: Agung Rai Museum of Art (ARMA)

Review: i hve been to this museum more than once the first time to see tbe art collection which is well presented in a beautiful garden setting the second time was on a sunday morning to watch some of the local children have a dance lesson in the various balinese dances this was a highlight and if you find yourself in ubud on a sunday do make tbe effort to go and see this it was both adorable and highly entertaining
Name: Agung Rai Museum of Art (ARMA)

Review: this is a very nice museum of balinese culture and art i is housed in several buildings depicting balinese architecture great place to get away from the heat outside of the high afternoon heat do visit and will certainly add to your bali experience visited in
Name: Agung Rai Museum of Art (ARMA)

Review: what a great art gallery and more to stumble upon i had heard about it but didnt venture further im so glad i walked past it i love art galleries and this did not disappoint i learned through the art so much more about the balinese culture even though ive read a fair bit about it the building itself is imoressive as is the surroundings i was lucky enough to watch the children precise their dancing and gamelan there were artists and guests painting and drawing a portrait of a live model really a great find
Name: Agung Rai Museum of Art (ARMA)

Review: i liked this place its a nice area not only a museum some artists are painting and carving there and explain their work to you museum is quite small but i liked the buildings ran into a traditional dancing class for balinesian girls which was lovely to watchif you are looking for some peace and quiet go to arma its worth it
Name: Agung Rai Museum of Art (ARMA)

Review: arma is a very quiet and very interesting place for art lovers where art is everywhere sculpturesplantationstone carvingwaterfallseatingsreading placecafewe stayed in hotel sapodila in ubud and while walking on the street i found arma and on that day they organised international mask making festival children from local school were busy in competition in the morning session organised art haa for locals to exhibit and sale their product and kept food stalls to enjoy balinese foodthey have huge collection of traditional and modern balinese paintings i appreciate efforts made by family to preserve and promote art and also help to gift the art to the new generation i wish to come to bali again stay and enjoy the resort and spa
Name: Agung Rai Museum of Art (ARMA)

Review: excellent range of paintings magnificent grounds good foodalso visit the agung rai gallery nearby and buy a painting
Name: Agung Rai Museum of Art (ARMA)

Review: this is a vast collection of art mostly owned by the museum owner and his wifewe first visited in  before it was opened to the public on the occasion of a world bamboo conference where the opening and closing ceremonies and the sessions were held and were interested to see what it had become well the open rice paddies next door have gone as the accommodation boom in ubud closes in but the array of buildings is all very good although a struggle on a very hot and humid day to see around all of the various rooms of good quality art by local and visiting artists
Name: Agung Rai Museum of Art (ARMA)

Review: visited the museum and groundsexcellent experience sauntering through the grounds was a pleasant break from noisy ubud also nice to see several artists at work admission price included a drink in one of the restosenjoyed a bonus as agung rai joined us for a few minutes and we had a pleasant chatincluding a tip on how to get back to our hotel via some ricefields at the backside of the propertythis would a great venue to watch a dance performance
Name: Agung Rai Museum of Art (ARMA)

Review: large collection and especially loved the contemporary exhibit the grounds merited a longer visit than we had tie for the acfe was delightful but not super strong in the western foods
Name: Agung Rai Museum of Art (ARMA)

Review: this was such a beautiful art museum  a tranquil oasis in the middle of busy ubud the collection is beautiful and varied and the museum building and gardens are so lovely visit the nice cafe for lunch or coffee or watch one of the fantastic dance performances in the evening
Name: Agung Rai Museum of Art (ARMA)

Review: a lot of great art here and its also a nice glimpse into both traditional and modern balinese culture that a casual visitor will never see eg paintings of cremation ceremonies i only wish the rooms were air conditioned i was hoping it would be respite from the heat outside but not so much plus the heat and humidity is not good for the art dont forget to get your included drink i was surprised at how nice my iced latte was it came in a tall glass with a mini crepe alongside it and the cafe was a pleasant place to sit and rest in between art pavilions
Name: Agung Rai Museum of Art (ARMA)

Review: absolutely loved the arma i dont think a trip to ubud is complete without it enjoy a great collection of pieces from artists with very different styles from all over the world in one building and traditional balinese style painting in the other all of the traditional pieces have really well written descriptions to give you an understanding of what you are looking at the grounds are a work of art in and of themselves beautiful gardens and big tall trees that shade them its such a peaceful place you can watch artists at work painting in the garden or children practicing balinese dance on the grounds we were really lucky to see a performance art piece as well this was a highlight of my time in ubud and i think it is a must do for any ubud itinerary
Name: Agung Rai Museum of Art (ARMA)

Review: nice way to spend a few hours viewing local art and architecture dont forget to stop at the onsite thai restaurant for a great meal
Name: Agung Rai Museum of Art (ARMA)

Review: the museum is huge lots of art and the opportunity to speak to traditional artists there are plenty of places to sit and admire the artwork beautiful gardens or just chill out it wasnt busy when we went so it was very relaxed the free cup of iced coffee was delicious and refreshing after walking the grounds definitely worth a visit
Name: Agung Rai Museum of Art (ARMA)

Review: this was a good museum but navigating around the property was kind of confusing wasnt any signs directing you to building but there were some great contemporary and traditional art inside the building once you located them
Name: Agung Rai Museum of Art (ARMA)

Review: we spent the afternoon looking at the art had a snack at the cafe had a wonderful foot massage and finally a drink overlooking the water gardens a great afternoon
Name: Agung Rai Museum of Art (ARMA)

Review: the arma is a large resort with the art galleries a hotel and two restaurants besides the interesting local art there are beautiful grounds to check out the restaurant in front of the museum is quite good too
Name: Agung Rai Museum of Art (ARMA)

Review: we had limited time in ubud and had to do one museum and picked this one as it is in middle of the cityvenue is a private villa with  building displaying art work would say it is more modern in terms of era  early to mid  and has good collectionit had few visitors the day we visited and hence enjoyed the experience
Name: Agung Rai Museum of Art (ARMA)

Review: the museum is two buildings with numerous rooms the art is easily viewed in an hour or two plan to spend more time on the grounds we thoroughly enjoyed being able to watch the childrens dance lessons and the adult balinese musicians practising it was a real cultural experience and subject to their schedulenot part of every days events take time to wander through the hotel grounds which are attached they are magicalif you have time plan to sit relax and linger while you drink the free beverage included with your ticket and enjoy the peace and serenity of the rice paddy
Name: Agung Rai Museum of Art (ARMA)

Review: understanding bali paintings from different area village and eralike lempad spies and lot othersentry ticket is above average but not too pricey you get well preserved art work several others are good quality repro
Name: Agung Rai Museum of Art (ARMA)

Review: you will not have seen anything like this place i guarantee its like stepping back in time but with all the amenities youd need for a full day take your time and walk slow as the grounds go on foreverhidden pools and places to sit and chill rice paddy fields surround this oasis right in the centre of ubudyou could be somewhere completely different as its so peaceful and large enough to find your own spacethe art is very authentic and will give you a better idea of the culture and story of baliyou can even get a massage looking out onto a river all private but oh so relaxing and very cheap
Name: Agung Rai Museum of Art (ARMA)

Review: wish i had more time to spend here  did find the modern section very interesting but it is quite sprawling and spread out so difficult to really enjoy in a short period of time i found the deka museum more to my liking but this museum does have quite a bit of history
Name: Agung Rai Museum of Art (ARMA)

Review: certainly worth taking the time guided tours yes they will try to get you to buy pretty cues vary and some are well worth haggling over
Name: Agung Rai Museum of Art (ARMA)

Review: many people buy the cheap paintings from the many art shops in balithe agung rai museum of art gives you an opportunity to see and touch the real balinese art and traditionsset in few pavilions surrounded with a lavish garden the place is peaceful and relaxingmost of all we enjoyed the room with the musical instruments and the museum staff were very patient and friendly and allowed us to create our own musicit is a good place to visit while you are in ubud
Name: Agung Rai Museum of Art (ARMA)

Review: wonderful museum consisting of two buildings a nice mixture of pieces a nice place to stroll and wander while taking some culture in and escaping the heat
Name: Agung Rai Museum of Art (ARMA)

Review: the garden is majestic it is such a pleasure to discover the balinese arts in such a setting i like the way they blend commercial activity and culture in a unique model that should inspire other countries the resort is open so you can stroll through the beautiful villas and enjoy the rich parc and surroundings inside the museum there is plenty to uncover about how bali became what it is now and about peoples who inspired its development by fostering local artist and creative spirit i loved it
Name: Agung Rai Museum of Art (ARMA)

Review: a must see attraction in ubud located close to the monkey forest sanctuary just little more than  km away from city center  ubud palace it has  sections  offers a chance to view some of the best balinese artworks the entry ticket of  rp also offers a complimentary teacoffee with a balinese sweet to savour in their warung located next to rice fields one can enjoy the views of green landscape of ubud from here visitors can also visit antonio blanco arts museum in the city center  meters away from palace for another worthwhile attraction in the arts zone also once these are experienced  it is better to avoid the museum lukisan as it is not worth the tickets charged  also becoms repeatitive
Name: Agung Rai Museum of Art (ARMA)

Review: we have stayed in the attached resort which gives you free access to the museum and the benefit of the lush balinese gardens and rice paddies stretching over several ha balinese dance shows are also organized almost nightly on site and there is also an excellent modern thai restaurant
Name: Agung Rai Museum of Art (ARMA)

Review: the place is pretty big and had some sections to explore the small collection of modern art is good the meat of the collection is in its balinese collection though very detailed if i had more time i would have stayed for the stage performances good attraction
Name: Agung Rai Museum of Art (ARMA)

Review: wide variety of paintings from last century showcasing local and visiting artists nicely presented and displayed over several buildings be sure to check out the gardens too
Name: Agung Rai Museum of Art (ARMA)

Review: we visited this museum which is just past one of the palaces in ubud its a beautiful complex with  building the artwork is very interesting and a wide variety of artistic styles periods etc it was one of my favorite stops in ubud
Name: Agung Rai Museum of Art (ARMA)

Review: the decadence of the building the wild life and of course the art you can only imagine living there in the age
Name: Agung Rai Museum of Art (ARMA)

Review: many pictures of local artist this museum is a must for ubud visitors the garden is also nice for a walk the restaurant is superexpensive but some like to dine out on nice tables will find good service
Name: Agung Rai Museum of Art (ARMA)

Review: very nice art collection from private collection of balinese artists some old some new all typically balinese in colour and style the grounds are beautiful and well kept and well worth the walk around
Name: Agung Rai Museum of Art (ARMA)

Review: the grounds are beautiful to walk we visited the cafe the shop and the indonesian art museum all worth it beautiful but pricey items in the shop much of the artwork in the museum is stunning
Name: Agung Rai Museum of Art (ARMA)

Review: it was for me a wonderful surprise te arma museum and the gardens i had the honour and pleasure of a guided visit of the arma museum by the mr agung ray himself the job this man does with this foundation is remarkable and deserves to be supported by everyone visiting bali the museum is really a nice surprise with all the paintings where we can see the evolution of balinese paintings through the years the traditional dances performed by the children and te adults are absolutely remarkable the garden and all the environment of this arma foundation is really a must visit place in bali
Name: Agung Rai Museum of Art (ARMA)

Review: if you are interested in art  paintings this is a must see place in bali we were not sure what to expect but ended up spending a lot of time here and buying a few art works the display here is great and the place is very neat and clean
Name: Agung Rai Museum of Art (ARMA)

Review: the museum which contain a rich collection of paintings dating all the way back to the th century is made up of  main buildings the works on display were painted by both local and foreign artists thereby offering us a view of the lens which they looked at life in bali and the world perhaps reflecting the importance of religion to balinese many paintings have a spiritual connotation to them while the more recent artists make use of their work to reflect on lifeimpact of tourism on modern baliand yes the museum has a cafe and the entrance ticket of rp  per person comes with one complimentary free drink at the cafe there is also a rice field at the back of the museum overall this is a nice place with aplenty of activities to spend the day i certainly enjoyed this visit more than walking senselessly along the endless rows of shops in ubud selling more or less the same things
Name: Agung Rai Museum of Art (ARMA)

Review: its a good place to spend few hours environment is relaxing you dont feel rushed and not many tourist theremuseum has some interesting collections and take time to read and see it there are  buildings and surrounding is very nice typical balinese environmentalso arma is a good hidden surprise your ticket includes free tea or coffee and they give you complimentary pancakes also we didnt had time to have lunch there would love toa must see while in ubud
Name: Agung Rai Museum of Art (ARMA)

Review: i visited arma with my two kids ages  and  and we all enjoyed the museum not only are there separate buildings for balinese contemporary and modern art but the grounds of the museum are absolutely beautiful and wonderful for the kids to explore my kids found something in each building that they enjoyed and they didnt feel like the collection was too overwhelming the variety of art styles and natural surrounding that we saw were great enough to keep the kids engaged a free coffee or tea at their lovely cafe is included in the price of the ticket and it was a perfect finish to our afternoon at the arma
Name: Agung Rai Museum of Art (ARMA)

Review: i loved this place you can spend couple of ours wondering around the museums the surrounding gardens have refreshments at the back of this wonderful place
Name: Agung Rai Museum of Art (ARMA)

Review: for  you get to see manynot a lot art walk around their villa and enjoy a free cup of coffee or tea theres a chair and gazebo for you to rest and chill i came at around  finish at  definitely money well spend the sad thing is when im exiting their staff told me there is barong dance at  want to go but i already miss my lunch not gonna miss my dinner too
Name: Agung Rai Museum of Art (ARMA)

Review: we came here in the hopes of seeing modern balinese art but everything was very traditional and old looking half of the museum is spent on a marketing exhibit where they talk about the ceos or founders of major us companies such as amazon facebook google etc this wasnt art but more a printed out wikipedia page next to their photo maybe we were thinking modern had a different definition but this was not our favorite ubud memoryon the bright side the free lemonade that came with the ticket was great
Name: Agung Rai Museum of Art (ARMA)

Review: if youre into art you will love this place we spent a good couple of hours looking at the artwork then strolled through the grounds of the resort which is located in the grounds the entry fee includes a complimentary cold or hot drink at the cafe all in all a nice afternoon
Name: Agung Rai Museum of Art (ARMA)

Review: cant recommend highly enough probably the best attraction visited in ubud some really beautiful art pieces and well curated collections that bring to life the richness of balinese and indonesian culture  there are traditional sections as well as contemporarydefinitely allow yourself an extra hour to explore the beautiful grounds full of stunning plants and flowers fruit trees ponds and a flowing riverthe k entrance fee is well worth it especially as it includes a voucher for a free teacoffee at the cafe
Name: Agung Rai Museum of Art (ARMA)

Review: after visiting lempuyang temple we had planned on stopping by here to see a different sort of tourist attraction located around  minutes from the temple this water palace is a one stop location to get some unique pictures as well as eat and buy souvenirs as well if you
Name: Tirta Angga

Review: the lake setting just adds a special touch to this wonderful temple usually it is full of people but due to the virus it was fairly empty
Name: Tirta Angga

Review: i visited in dec  for the first time on the way back to kuta from tulamben entrance fee of k per person but clothing restrictions werent as strict as for a temple quite busy when we were there but still possible to get some decent photographs
Name: Tirta Angga

Review: well worth the visit it was quite a drive from kuta but its worth it when you get there you can feed the fish while stepping through one of the ponds there are a couple of pools you can swim in we didnt but we did notice a few people swimming the restaurant is very nice
Name: Tirta Angga

Review: the name tirta gangga literally means water from the ganges the holy river in india it was built by the last king of karangasem regency in  and is now open to the public it features a labyrinth of pools ponds and fountains surrounded by neatly cut lawns adorned with
Name: Tirta Angga

Review: kpax entrance fee its not a temple so no need to dress decent but dont come half naked it was drizzling slightly when we arrived so we had some food first at warung rika before that it was raining heavily i read that people wait in line for a long time just to take pictures i was lucky when i got there i waited less than  mins and i could take pictures already there werent many people aroundi think its because of the rain and covid scare that there are not many people when the rain stops i can see more people comingthe pictures on instagram were fantastic makes you want to immediately fly there but when i was actually there it wasnt that pretty darn instagram always make everything looks so goodits not that bad but you would probably be slightly disappointed if you hope to see the same dreamy pictures as you did online i didnt feed the fishes i think they are fat enough from all the tourist that feeds them to get nice pictures probably the reason why my pics look sad cause no fishy wants to come to me my hair is a mess from the rain sweat and sunblock spray theres also an area for swimmingsoaking but only passed by either than that it feels like a very big garden
Name: Tirta Angga

Review: this is a palace from the kingdom days it is beautiful and fun to visit you can feed the giant koi in the ponds or walk out on the stones to get your picture taken
Name: Tirta Angga

Review: this was one of the nicest places we visited while in bali true history and art so take your time and walk through the property there are some true hidden gems our local guide made sure we made the rounds and he explained everything try and get there early or in the eve to avoid the heat
Name: Tirta Angga

Review: it was a public holiday the day we visited so was busy with lots of families having a wonderful time feeding the fish and splashing about in the swimming pool although not a mustsee it was a very pleasant little stop on our way south
Name: Tirta Angga

Review: rupiah entrance fee and since its a garden and not a temple no sarongs required people wait in line to take pictures of themselves feeding the fish and these fish are big and fat wellfed with no predators to eat them really nice garden construction is going on to improve the area surrounding the tiered fountain a few places to sit eat and peoplewatch thats it tirta gangga became popular when tourists started going to lempuyang temple not a must visit but still pleasant
Name: Tirta Angga

Review: what a beautiful and relaxing place to visiteventhough it was scorching hot the waters made me feel cooler
Name: Tirta Angga

Review: visited as part of a day tour rained cats and dogs but still enjoyed ourselves youll probably feel like jumping in the water on a hot day or use the natural pool was reasonably busy probably a lot worse in high session but would recommend
Name: Tirta Angga

Review: one of the attractions in tirta gangga is feeding the fishif you want a perfect shot wait for your turn alsobefore going to the temple buy fish foodsyou can bring your own photographervideographer if you wantput on sunscreenbottled waterbring umbrella or hatmake sure your phone is fully charged
Name: Tirta Angga

Review: this was my favourite place it was at a higher elevation and a bit cooler and it was so peaceful ponds of water surround temples and stepping stones allow you to feel like you are walking across the surface of the water fish food is sold at the entrance and the fish would swarm around us as we sprinkled it into the water
Name: Tirta Angga

Review: not a must visit for me but if your near by you can try it once its a temple with much water bodies a lot of fishes in itfor me best thing was to feed fishes there and nothing much to do here
Name: Tirta Angga

Review: beautiful pools garden but always crowded there is a walk on the stepping stones through the pond which everyone seems to want to do for the best photo very slow as most seem to want to take a selfie every step of the way you can buy some cheap fish food at the access and feed and play with the fishes behind the pools is an amazing round with hindu gods a quiet garden and the former royal villas today a hotel nice view aroundaccess fee k idr inclsarong a must visit h away from ubud before lempuyang temple amed beach taman ujung
Name: Tirta Angga

Review: my second visit to tirta gangga last year was pretty much the same beautiful gardens with crowds of tourists milling around everywhere there is a walk you can do on the stepping stones through the pond which everyone seems to want to do consequently you can see the tourists queuing up to hop onto the stones like frogs however progress is slow as most seem to want to take a selfie every step of the way the carp in the pool are impressive both in size and number and the statues add to the atmosphere however there are other water temples and if crowds are not you thing avoid
Name: Tirta Angga

Review: its small but beautiful and not crowded its a great place to relax and take in the beautiful scenery its a bit out of the way more than  hours drive from ubud but getting there is also scenic its close to lempuyang temple so you can do both in the same day if you get to lempuyang early enough theres also places to get beverages and food so i stopped and had lunch here as well highly recommend
Name: Tirta Angga

Review: visited as part of my one day instagram tour beautiful place with water gardens lots of nice fish and plants many interesting statues also
Name: Tirta Angga

Review: we reached the place around  in the afternoon it is very close to pura lempuyang on the foothills of mount lempuyang therefore the trip to both these places can be done together there are many restaurants outside tirta gangga for taking a lunch breakit was teeming with people enjoying themselves in the garden when we reached the place there are loads and loads of fishes in the ponds in this garden palace and fish feeding is really fun you can buy some readytoeat cheap fish food outside the entry gates and feed the fishesthe main pond also has cement stumps kind of a thing arranged like a path amid the pond for fun you can jump from one stump to the other and get to the other corner of the pond you can also take some good clicks in this area
Name: Tirta Angga

Review: the walk on the round stones through the pond  queue is quite long if you skip that the rest of the garden is worth a visit the sculptures are nice
Name: Tirta Angga

Review: this place gets heaving so go early too many people posing for social media pics  actually laughable as they did not really seem interested in the place at all  just getting a posed photo then off
Name: Tirta Angga

Review: first time here and we did enjoyed it the fishes seems like used to human so they instantly come very close to you very crowded since it is a very popular spot for instagram pictures so we need to be a long queue
Name: Tirta Angga

Review: amazing ponds and not too busy fun to feed the fish and just take in the history of the location  there isnt a lot of shade though so make sure youre wearing suncream
Name: Tirta Angga
