Review: we visited uluwatu temple on our last day right before we headed to the airport since this was our last day we were indecisive whether we should go im so glad we did out of all places we visited in bali i liked uluwatu most the temple itself is not very spectacular but the whole area is absolutely breathtaking gorgeous views colorful flowers everywhere around  absolutely stunning a must see when in bali
Name: Uluwatu Temple

Review: a tourist attraction and you need it view it like that if you are staying in uluwatu then you would have anyways seen such views and sunset this is a temple in which you dont enter the temple but you see the surroundings of it there is a kecak dance in the evening which also is quite crowded with uncomfortable seating if you are coming from that part of the world where you have not seen temples and not seen religious dances then it might interesting otherwise this is just an average touristy place tip  gets crowded after the dance performance so watch out for timely exit  also monkeys are in abundance so be safe
Name: Uluwatu Temple

Review: this temple is built on the mountain i guess or its a cliff be careful of monkeys it may steal ur sunglassesit would be better if public are allowed to pray inside the templeliked it very much because of cleanliness and they have maintained calmmust visit place in bali
Name: Uluwatu Temple

Review: this is a must do in balivisit the temple for sunset but get there early as you want to also see the kecak dance sunset monkey dancethe temple is very relaxing and all of a sudden at about  people plus appear all jostling trying to get into the dance there are limited seats so make sure you not only buy your temple ticket that gets you a sarong but go straight to the dance tickets and get one or better off buy it onlinesitting high up you get magnificent views of the sunset over the indian ocean and of the dancers sitting low down or even on the flat concrete you feel part of the show all the seating is on concrete steps apart from half a dozen plastic chairs we got told we were vips and wete permitted on the chairs not sure who they got us confused withthe dance contains fire so understand that we did have an incident while we watched when one of the silk robes of a dancer caught fire many people were upset mainly asians no one was hurtfinally as you go around the temple watch for the monkeys they like glasses bags hats and dangly ear rings there are monkey monitors but they are fasti highly recommend here enjoy
Name: Uluwatu Temple

Review: amazing traditional performances and well kept temple grounds it was a perfect spot to catch sunsetthe monies could learn some respect though thank goodness there is a monkey detail designated to keep those rascals in line
Name: Uluwatu Temple

Review: one of the highlights of trip to bali uluwatu temple is situated on top of a hill which means loads of steps you must wear long pants or use a skirt of cloth to cover your legs provided at the gate to enter the temple as a sign of respect once at the top though the views over the cliff and out over the sea are amazing there are monkeys so beware and make sure you dont have food or loose items like sunglassesgo just before sunset and enjoy the changing view before heading for a performance of balinese fire dancing on site watching this at night with the sparks and flame just makes it spectacular
Name: Uluwatu Temple

Review: the uluwatu temple is a must tourist site to see if you visited bali you can see the beautiful temple that located above the cliff and side by side with the seayou can also see the kecak dance the famous traditional balinese dance i suggest that come here around  pm so you can see the sunset
Name: Uluwatu Temple

Review: lovely views over the indian ocean which was made special as we visited at sunset our guide was very useful as he knew how to get tickets so we got into the amphitheatre for the show and took us round the temple and explained tall the details dance lasted about  hour and everyone was seated very popular so essential to be there early to get a seat
Name: Uluwatu Temple

Review: we have visited the temple in the late afternoon great view on the sunsetthe kecak dance is a must seek per person but be really in time to buy tickets in advance and get then a good place to watch it it is very crowded
Name: Uluwatu Temple

Review: after being in a bali for over a week  you can find better sunsets else where as well as better temples  it is also extremely touristy and the pictures i found are much better then the reality  can be very crowded
Name: Uluwatu Temple

Review: always keep hold of your tickets herethe temple itself is fantastic  amazing views over the cliff face and plenty spots to take photographs and appreciate the architecturehowever i want to warn of the imposed tours that we were unfortunate enough to experienceupon paying entry at the temple gates usually you are provided with sarongs to enter we had been to temples prior and people had been kind in handing them out and assisting tying the sarong etcon this occasion at uluwatu temple the people handing out sarongs proceeded to take our tickets guide us in the temple and impose a tour on us of which i expect they would have demanded payment for laterluckily we did not have to pay as looking round many others were not being guided and we quickly identified something was not rightwe were part of an unfortunate few however it really made us feel on edge and uncomfortable and tainted our experience of the templewe wanted to advise others so they dont have the samealways keep hold of your tickets here once bought at the ticket booth if you have to get a sarong be careful of those providing them you can always get your own sarong from the standif offered any tours try to kindly decline unless of course you would like one
Name: Uluwatu Temple

Review: steep and high stepped stairs at times so may not be good if you have difficulty with mobility went with tour guide which guaranteed our tickets had to get seats and waited  mins in seat prior to show otherwise you sit on floor cross legged show was a bit slow  repetitive for first  mins but got more interesting the costumes of main characters were fantastic interesting for a cultural perspective though bring a towel to sit on as seats are hard sunset was wonderful
Name: Uluwatu Temple

Review: the temple was a great place to visit to view the sunset we had a nice walk around there were monkeys around too on the look out for tourists possessions luckily we were warned
Name: Uluwatu Temple

Review: stayed at novotel nusa dua and visited this restaurant with family of  being  adults and  kids  agefirst time to bali and nusa dua and picked this place on trip advisor scores  reviews its exceptional a  year old temple sitting on the cliffs of balimake sure you get a guide k it makes it all far more enjoyable and they are very knowledgeable about the temple but also the monkeys they will provide feed and guidance around the monkeys which if you have kids made it great funthe views are spectacular must do
Name: Uluwatu Temple

Review: im glad i visited as seeing the views of the ocean are wonderful temple itself was a little underwhelming what you get to see if youre in the area go but dont make a special trip
Name: Uluwatu Temple

Review: large area bring your walking shoes sarongs are supplied at the gate for dress regulations the views from the cliffs are nothing short of amazing the temples are built right on the cliff edge if your scared of heights you will find this pushing the boundaries of standing too close
Name: Uluwatu Temple

Review: this is a must see if going to bali the temple of spiritual and very sacred the view are the cliff and ocean is aweinspiring it sight felt more like a dream than realityi will give a headsup thats it pretty touristy though i recommend going in the morning if you can to beat most of the buses there also to beat the heat as theres very limited shade once youre walking along the water
Name: Uluwatu Temple

Review: dont forget to put this place on your list if you have a plan to visit balithis touristic place located in uluwatubesides tourists many local people coming for prayer in this templethey located on the cliff with beautiful ocean viewand while you strolling around you must see some monkeys too
Name: Uluwatu Temple

Review: entrance is k including the sarong you need to enter and you cant actually access the temple unless worshipping nonetheless the views are beautiful the cliffs with the flowering bushes and trees the water is so blue the carvings on the stone of the buildings so interesting and intricate and its a great walk along the cliffs beware of the monkeys we watched a women get a little too close to video and have her phone stolen lucky they threw it some fruit and it gave the phone back there is about  warungs out front with a good variety of food and fresh coconuts
Name: Uluwatu Temple

Review: a couple months ago me and my friends go to there we go there to watch kecak dance but in there have many beautiful spots before you watching the dance u can walking on the temple in there there are many monkey they wont harm us if we dont harm them for the price u buy twice tickets first you buy for enter the temple second you buy for watching the dance so if you just want to looking the temple u dont need to buy the ticket dance
Name: Uluwatu Temple

Review: the temple is a waste of time as you cant get inside unless youre worshipping the views of the cliffs are spectacular but tanah lot is much better be aware though there is no phone reception up there and their free wifi doesnt connect hence we had no way to get a cab out of there other than the scammers that hang around luckily a genuine bluebird was dropping someone off fortunately he used his meter and we didnt get ripped off but beware
Name: Uluwatu Temple

Review: with lanus from lanus tours arrived uluwatu temple grounds we walked the cliff walk while lanus bought our tickets at pm for sunset pm performance fabulous views and the show was an hour which was a good time beautiful place enjoyed the performance
Name: Uluwatu Temple

Review: paid  to enter and the woman said get the dance ticket below went below and its sold out nearly  people scammed out of  nothing to see there waste of time to drive that far to get scammed out of  for an opportunity to see the show so many cant see this is what is wrong with bali scam everywhere
Name: Uluwatu Temple

Review: this is one of balis oldest temples ad situated on the tip of a massive  foot cliff it is breathtaking the cliff and its views you can not go in the temple area itself but can walk around its grounds there are monkeys about there is a fire dancesunset experience at an adjacent outdoor amphitheaterwe took a tour ultimate uluwatu which was great we hit the three most popular beaches dreamland beach padang padang beach and sulubanuluwatu beach followed by temple tour and fire dancing  it was nice to have someone else drive you to each spot and see the best of uluwatu in one confined day
Name: Uluwatu Temple

Review: visited this temple for the kecak  fire dance and i was not disapointed this is a popular place with the tourists the fire dance was amazing and beautiful to watch set with the sunset as the backdropwatch out for the monkeyslolthey steal whatever they can get their hands onhand sanitiser includedloland prepare for a sore backside from sitting awkwardly after the arena was packed fulloverall enjoyed it
Name: Uluwatu Temple

Review: great to see you pay k in each about  and then if you want to watch the dance its another k the temple has monkeys and it is there home its a shame to see locals who have people on tours showing slingshots at themgood to see but wouldnt go back
Name: Uluwatu Temple

Review: located in the west of bali uluwatu temple gives you a great scenery me and my husband visited in the evening and we watched the sunset theres also a kecak dance show at pm
Name: Uluwatu Temple

Review: the uluwatu temple a located in shout west on top of cliff and its surrounded by an amazing indian ocean to making feel on a heaven also there are lots of monkeys around the temple
Name: Uluwatu Temple

Review: it is a very nice temple nothing to argue about that we had heard a lot about it on the internet but we did not find the place as amazing as it is said to bedont get me wrong its a beautiful place but if you have to make decisions about which places to visit i would skip this one and go to tanah lot
Name: Uluwatu Temple

Review: small temple i dont there is much history behind only thing i enjoyed is d view otherwise nothing much too much for rpk
Name: Uluwatu Temple

Review: overlooking the beach with cliffs to the water sunset was gorgeous recommend the kecak fire dance also very beautiful and funny towards the end have to be respectful and wear a sari to cover the knees men and women also try to wear a tshirt to cover your shoulders
Name: Uluwatu Temple

Review: i had the opportunity to visit uluwatu temple again after  years and boy has the place changed the major change youd notice now are the crowds in  there probably  people in august but now there easily more than a  people there the local authorities have built new and better facilities for the tourists nevertheless watching kecak didnt have the same feel as the place was so crowded that they allowed tourists to sit in the circle at least  layers deep which resulted in a very small circle for the performers to move and perform overall it was an enjoyable experience for my friends who were seeing it for the first time
Name: Uluwatu Temple

Review: this temple offers a breathtaking view of the sea on top of the amazing sunset you can see during the kecak dance performance the dance is really interesting and entertaining with the background sounds coming purely from the voices of a group of men it is truly amazing how the singers can continuously sing for almost an hour a must visit
Name: Uluwatu Temple

Review: a really lovely place with some amazing views along the quite rugged coastline gets quite busy beware of the monkeys saw one steal a cap from someone who had ventured too close
Name: Uluwatu Temple

Review: perched atop a  mts black coral cliff this temple is devoted to lord rudra its here at uluwatu temple that balinese hindus believe the divine powers brahma vishnu and siva unite making the temple a place of worship for the bali hindu deity rudra god of all aspects of life and all elements in the universeits making is unique such that it appears to float between realms of land  seathis temple lies in the southern most part of bali and some  mins drive from kutaapart from the magnificent temple one have photograph heavenlydreamy sunsets from two vantage points located adjacent to the templeaccording to balinese custom men and women must wear a sarong andor a sash when going into a temple at the entrance of uluwatu temple you will be handed a purple silk sarong to wear just wrap it around your waist over your regular clothing return the sarong after your visit it is not for you as to keep
Name: Uluwatu Temple

Review: uluwatu temple is one of balinese hindu temples most visted by tourist and located right on the petrifying hill with the crevasse exist in the right and left side because of its unique location visitors to the temple have to take a long stone stairway to reach it
Name: Uluwatu Temple

Review: the view of the place is amazing you can see the indian ocean which is beautiful the water is so clear best time to visit this place early evening so you can catch the sunset in all its glory and also see the bali kecak dance usually this dance happens in the backdrop of the sunset but since we went during the peak season the show was sold out luckily since there were so many people they decided to do a second show for us which apparently never happens as told by our driverguide so we were quite happy since we were quite excited to see the dance it was really fun to see a snippet of the ramayan being acted out by them also can i just mention the people of bali are really very very kind and polite which is so nice the temple is on a cliff so of course you have uphill climbs wear comfortable shoes take time out to walk till the end of the cliff before you see the sunset you will also spot lots of monkeys pretty harmless but still you are advised to not carry water bottles or shades since they are known to snatch them there are proper bathrooms and stalls available for quick bites the campus is also quite big also you wont be allowed to go inside the temple since only the local balinese people are allowed so that was a bummer all in all it was a beautiful place its a place for everyone
Name: Uluwatu Temple

Review: great temple walk ideally get their mid afternoon to see the various temples and then the evening performance please notebeautiful cliff landscapesparts of the temple walk surrounded by monkeysworth sticking around to see the sunset and cecak dance in the evening beware the horrendous traffic that follows as  people all exit the venue
Name: Uluwatu Temple

Review: the place was great if were talking about the view and scenery a perfect spot to take tons of wonderful pictures but just be careful when youre taking a picture that some naughty monkeys might steal your phone or camera i saw one tourist got her phone stolen by the monkey when she was taking a picture some local tried to exchange the phone with some food the monkey took the food and threw the phone fortunately the phone wasnt broken
Name: Uluwatu Temple

Review: dont waste your time they crowd soooo many ppl in the place and its  per person for the show and  to get into the temple the seats are on concrete and very uncomfortable the show isnt even that good spend your money else where
Name: Uluwatu Temple

Review: a beautiful place to visit and very picturesque i didnt like the unpredictable monkeys as they took thinks off tourists but then again it is their home and we are simply visiting would recommend visiting
Name: Uluwatu Temple

Review: its a great place with an amazing sunset view just be careful to hide the shiny things on you like sunglasses earrings necklace because monkeys are very often stealingi totally recommend it
Name: Uluwatu Temple

Review: spectacular ocean view and scenery view nice place for slow walktemple is not open for public but uprise could walk around the open areanice for photos taking and weather was shinning and windy sometime
Name: Uluwatu Temple

Review: it was ok we went at  just before the crowds which was worth the early morningprobably not worth the  rp entry fee to be honest
Name: Uluwatu Temple

Review: this temple is south wast of denpasar it is a good location for sunset in that temple you will see a lot of lazy monkeys sleep on the trees when you spend your holiday in bali you must go there
Name: Uluwatu Temple

Review: uluwatu temple can be visited in the evening which is built on top of the cliff where you can also enjoy the beautiful view of the sunset dont miss the kecak and fire dance here which is its usp the story is inspired from ramayana where hanumana sets fire to the kingdom of lanka click some snaps with these well dressed characters
Name: Uluwatu Temple

Review: located on the edge of a cliff above the sea this temple is one of the six key balinese hindu templethe temple is famous for beautiful sunset and the cultural show balinese kecak dance in the eveningappropriate way to enter the temple is to wear sarong or scarf to cover the lower part of the body one can get sarong at the entrance near ticket counterthe temple is locally known as pura luhur uluwatu  meaning ulu meaning lands end and watu meaning rockbest time to visit  june to augusthow to reach  it is located  kms away from kuta and one can visit by local cabs for around idr
Name: Uluwatu Temple

Review: the temple is on top of a beautiful hill which is very picturesque especially if you go at sunset their are many steps so if you are not found that then its not for you i would definitely say this is a must see and the views are incredible and also uluwatu temple is rich in history
Name: Uluwatu Temple

Review: this temple is stunning lots of walking there and back but worth every step famous also for its monkeys that will grab anything they can from sunglasses to purses once again there were thousands there all to see the sunset which was spectacular definitely a must when visiting bali
Name: Uluwatu Temple

Review: spectacular scenery and worthwhile timing your visit for the nightly show at pm where you will be treated to a display of traditional indonesian dancers as the sun sets over the ocean in the background
Name: Uluwatu Temple

Review: awesome sunset and fantastic view of the blue sea no wonder its a must see when in bali the kecak dance at the peak of the hill is also unique and interesting
Name: Uluwatu Temple

Review: i have three times in bali but it is the first to visit uluwatu temple firstly im not too interested but when i was inside i was just speechless with the beautiful of gods creation the blue half light blue ocean is too perfect for me especially the waves that hit the rocks
Name: Uluwatu Temple

Review: my second time to ullawatu temple and the dancing performance nearby the dancing is worth it unique experience in a beautiful setting prepare yourself for uncomfortable seating make sure you buy your ticket before they run out and get a seat early
Name: Uluwatu Temple

Review: our visit to the temple was so stunning we absolutely loved the views we went in the morning to avoid the crowds and even then it was busy but it was totally worth it but a reminder for people to hold onto their property tightly because we saw a monkey steal sunglasses from one man and a phone from a selfstick from another man we laughed but im sure they were not so be aware of thieving monkeys
Name: Uluwatu Temple

Review: my driver suggested this trip not far from nusa dua where i was stayingmagnificent views and many stunning photo opportunities water was the most brilliant bluerecommend to all
Name: Uluwatu Temple

Review: this is a pretty stunning temple built near a high cliff from where you can see the white surf hitting the shore the temple is located in a forest area and you need to buy a ticket that comes with a sarong the temple was closed when i visited in the evening perhaps only open to locals there a plenty of monkeys in the woods and they are pretty aggressive i saw one snatch a cell phone from a visitor who has trying to film the monkey beside the temple you pay to attend a amphitheater show at sunset this show features kecak performance which is mainly dancers in traditional costumes performing within a circle made of kecak performers who chant all during the show it is lovely to watch the show with a backdrop of the sunset and the cliffs come early to get a seat at the top for better viewing after the show go to a nice restaurant around the temple for a nice indonesian dinner
Name: Uluwatu Temple

Review: we went and was surprised to see the crowds the sunset was pretty and the kecak dance was very good
Name: Uluwatu Temple

Review: the temple is very unique in that it is at the top of a hill and from there the view of the sea is just spectacular
Name: Uluwatu Temple

Review: this was a must while in bali a great way to get a cultural lesson and catch one of the best sunsets at the same time the monkeys rome the temple freely so hold onto your hat and glasses because they will snatch them and run away then try to barter with you for you to get it back make sure you take a flashlight because once it gets dark after the sunset show you will not be able to see heading back out to the front where the cars are all you will hear are the monkeys and im not going to lie it is kind of creepy be sure to wear comfortable shoes and eat first bring water
Name: Uluwatu Temple

Review: we are not interested in visiting temples but we enjoyed this visit to this temple as it gave us a unique experience of balis tradition and culture through the sunset fire dance performance which was interesting my advice is to watch the performance till the end as it gets more interesting in its second part and also not to miss taking pictures with the actors by the end
Name: Uluwatu Temple

Review: truly one of the best sunsets in the world the dance is entertaining but twice as long as it should be especially when on concrete benchesyou have to get into the seated area at least  minutes early to have a chance to choose a seat which is not ideal in the blistering heat so bring lots of water sunscreen and a decent camera because the views are stunning
Name: Uluwatu Temple

Review: pura uluwatu tourist destinations that have their own charm  located in an altitude area makes this place has a natural beauty  the sunrise and sunset you can see in this place
Name: Uluwatu Temple

Review: the temple is in such an idyllic location go for a stroll along the cliff wall looking over the ocean or watch the nightly dancing get there before  in high season
Name: Uluwatu Temple

Review: that temple have a very special view standing m above the sea level it allows you to look at the ocean below directly worth a visit
Name: Uluwatu Temple

Review: very worth the visit beautiful views and scenery with views over the sea monkeys were great to see and nice walk which wasnt too long
Name: Uluwatu Temple

Review: uluwatu temple south of kuta a large complex that has stone steps walkways around the cliffs with great ocean and cliff views there are many monkeys around the parking area take photos from a distance entry fee is  rp
Name: Uluwatu Temple

Review: astonishing beauty of sea shore temple and cliffbest to visit in evening for the sun setbe aware the uluwatu monkeys are very aggressive i lost my sunglasses at uluwatu when i was posing to camera
Name: Uluwatu Temple

Review: nice view its not huge though and we can enter the temple area only the surrounding area but still worth going when you are around
Name: Uluwatu Temple

Review: after visiting benova beach nusa dua beach and water blow we went to uluwatu cliff temple i think it is about  meters higher than the beach you have to park the vehicles and walk and climb the steps to reach the temple very beautiful surrounding and very crowded toohowever there are monkeys so you must be careful since they might drag your camera sunglasses etc a must visit place if you are in bali
Name: Uluwatu Temple

Review: visited as part of a tour in beautiful surrounds but would have liked to have more chance to walk through the temple grounds dance was absolutely packed with people on the ground in the central arena part dance was really entertaining but the grounds of people took a little of the shine away
Name: Uluwatu Temple

Review: the beautiful cliffs are really amazing especially during sunset a temple sits on top of the hills wherein you can watch the hour traditional kecak dance at pm one can continue to gaze at the sunset inside the area where the dance takes placehowever you need to secure your tickets at the entrance of the temple at least half an hour before the start of the dance because they run out so fast and find a good seat beforehand since the place gets cramped already by  pm get there early or when the place is already opened we got there  minutes before  pm and the whole place was almost fullin addition to this when you have ample time to walk around and along the cliffs you can do so provided that you secure all your belongings from aggressive monkeys darting from post to post on the cliff fences they are really aggressive that whatever they see such as hats eyeglasses sunglasses purses cameras slippers even while you are wearing them or maybe because they were yellow like that of bananas small bags especially cellphones youd have to bid goodbye to these things as you may not see them anymore you may take it back but they can bite or attack you
Name: Uluwatu Temple

Review: years since we visited uluwatu and much has changed in the interim i guess its progress to cater for the hordes of tourists now visiting understandable that so many want to make the trek to the temple located spectacularly on the edge of the cliff overlooking the sea some m below we did not enter the temple too many people already there and yet more waiting impatiently great views  some great photos adjacent the parking areas you will find various outlets with some fairly pricey merchandise by bali standards i think that i prefer my memories of  and the kecak dance performed with a much smaller audience of worshippers and tourists attending and commencing just after we had witnessed a spectacular sunset
Name: Uluwatu Temple

Review: uluwatu temple is a misnomer for a tourist in my opinion its a perfect spot to watch a awe inspiring sunset couple it with kecak dance performance and youd get mesmerized with baligo to the top of the temple till you see exit sign also it gets cold after sunset so dress your toddlers accordinglythe kecask dance has unreserved seatingthe app based taxis might not pick you from the temple so better to take a round trip from your hoteltheres no cafe inside the temple there are few shops at the entrance but they sell overpriced carry your food and waterthere are toilets available insidemy overall rating
Name: Uluwatu Temple

Review: arranged with mr gusti bawana for a tour to nyang nyang beach and uluwatu temple our drive and tour guide bagus putra is very nice very friendly with good and safe driving skills we enjoyed our tour because putra knew the places well and we didnt need to worry and just very relaxed the monkey in uluwatu snatched my wifes glasses unexpectedly but putra got it back for her thank you putra we definitely will arrange another tour with mr gusti when we return to bali
Name: Uluwatu Temple

Review: nice view overlooking the ocean it gets super crowded in the evening as many gather to watch the sunset and a famous dance called god and fire we went for the view before sunset in jimbaran beach
Name: Uluwatu Temple

Review: when in uluwatu you have to go the temple itself is not special or anything but the location is  come at  and enjoy the kecak dance and a beautiful sunset seated high upon a rock overlooking the sea
Name: Uluwatu Temple

Review: once inside you will have stunning views of the cliffs and lots of fun watching the monkeys trying to harass the visitors
Name: Uluwatu Temple

Review: i expected a bit more than we have seen some places of the park are not yet finished the main huge statue is really stunning but there are no many other things to see dancing show was nice but all in all it was not much worth to visit i think on bali there are better places
Name: Garuda Wisnu Kencana Cultural Park

Review: i spotted this in the distance when we landed its a terrific site but is not finished and no one advise that you can only visit the base of this monument ill go back when completed in the future
Name: Garuda Wisnu Kencana Cultural Park

Review: great photo ops great to learn about culture specially for my teen age children lots of walking water readily available for purchase there is a shuttle for those who have trouble walking that takes to main statue for extra costi would definitely recommend a visit to this
Name: Garuda Wisnu Kencana Cultural Park

Review: we went to gwk for the first time in  and thought it was just wonderful now in  it is almost complete and boy was it fabulous we decided to go up into the huge statue the  rupah each we paid was worth every bit we paid you cannot take pictures your belongings
Name: Garuda Wisnu Kencana Cultural Park

Review: it started with a high price to get in then being told after we paid that there was no transport to take us up the top for another  hours so we had to drag our  children our youngest only  and  and walk up to the top to visit the statues then further up to get to the big
Name: Garuda Wisnu Kencana Cultural Park

Review: it is a place where you pay then find out once you have paid you have to pay another entrance fee and pay again its a complete scam to get money off you  just look from a distance and save your money
Name: Garuda Wisnu Kencana Cultural Park

Review: we cant take pictures from the top observatory due to no camera policy no package ticket at the entrance to approach the statue
Name: Garuda Wisnu Kencana Cultural Park

Review: approachin denpasar bali from the west side i knew that because on a previous cruise i knew where the port was in relation to the island my first view was the cliffs of ulawatu on the right that meant i was on the south side of the plane i thought as we approached the threshold that there was a fire in the distance  as i kept seeing through the haze some billowing looking column that seemed to change as we approached  landed  and actually walked off the planeon the drive to ubudi asked the fellow nyoman the driver from bali airoirt transfer  whom i had booked way back from montreal  what the smoke like thing was he informed me of this new sculpture which took  years to get completed which was on a hill in the new cultural park its well known as gwk or garuda their airline kencana wisnu a huge sculpture even more prominent as it is mounted on top of a building and on a hill my travels in ubud brought me one day to tanah lot the great water side temple on the west side slightly north of canggu to sanur beach on the east side where one can take a boat to nusa ppenida islands and then back again to berawa beach in canggu at la brisa i mention these three places because bali is sort of shaped like an stretched hourglass with the tiny part south of the airport  being jimbaran such that on every point on a beach north one can see this monstrous sculpture with the planes landing and taking off just in front of it so on my last day in bali i rehired this great driver who asked a previous night if i would call him because business had really slowed down due to the lack of asians  mostly because of the corona virus you wouldnt know that things were quiet just from the number of cars scooters and delays in travelling on our adventure to revisit ulawatu in the south west i kept my eye open for this sculpture and he asked do you want to go to gwk i said absolutely as it seemed to be haunting me since day any way approaching it and seeing it from the road one could understand whay it took  years besideds politics it is huge the approach is beautiful a shuttle bus takes you up to the ticket office and then you can walk the spread out grounds or take a golf cart shtlle  up to the base in the bali temperature of   spend the money it is very impressive to see and the monstrous cutou towering square blocks of rocks you pass on the way up make you thinkyou are approaching something like possibly stonehenge or the ppyramidsmy title above denotes a bit of disappointment that is because arriving at pm and paying for a ticket does not give you access to beyond the first floor of the buikding so you miss the high altitude photo of the entire bali region furthermore on walking through the main level there are depictions of what this is supposed to look like except for the fact that they must be at least  years behind what their proposlas are no waterpark acording to the diagram no water pools no grand courtyard in front center as depicted in fact  other than the building and the sculpture nothing else is startedbut it is worth going to because this sculpture is so prominent and the highes item in balithat you see it from all over and it sort of gave closure to my departing the island
Name: Garuda Wisnu Kencana Cultural Park

Review: so sad  we arrived with our driver and quickly were told to go back and pay for parking our driver was leaving a separate entrance fee we were willing to pay however telling the driver to pay for a drop off was unacceptable
Name: Garuda Wisnu Kencana Cultural Park

Review: enjoyed our time here lots of different points of interest the park is a work in progress you can easily spend half a day here you can go up into the statue for an extra charge but you have to leave phone in locker  so we have it a miss however we had a great rime you can pay to get a golf buggy up and down to the statue there are places to get food as well
Name: Garuda Wisnu Kencana Cultural Park

Review: the concept drawings look extremely impressive but for now they are still building out the park the statue is worth a quick visit
Name: Garuda Wisnu Kencana Cultural Park

Review: the statue was majestic the shows were amazing i think you need to experience the cultural park at least once i wont come back though unless theres something new
Name: Garuda Wisnu Kencana Cultural Park

Review: this was amazing to visit given that it took nearly  years to complete we paid the fee to enter and walk to the statue that was our choice we didnt get to do the tour as we had just missed the next set time but we saw enough information on how it all began and what is yet to come of the sitesome people focus on the costs to visit without thinking of the effort and the cost that went into creating this monument we felt that its well worth the money and we look forward to seeing the end result one day in the future
Name: Garuda Wisnu Kencana Cultural Park

Review: fourth tallest statue in the worldhighest hindu statue in the worldhighest statue in indonesiaas much as the hype is for this statue there are other statues and gardens in this place if you happen to go to this cultural park be ready to spend at least half a day or even full day to do justice to your ticket price the have an array of performances going on hourly which comes at no additional cost its going to be quite a steep walk but they do also have buggy services at additional costone things that is strange is that there is no much space in front of the main statue  garuda wishnu to take a proper photo however it looks different in aerial mapdesign compared in real there is no straight entranceleading directly to the main statue probably its part of the design and not accomplished yet so that is a bit of disappointment if you would like to get a good photo of the statue with yourself it is somewhere after you come down after plaza garuda on your left there are few tiny entrances and that is where the right spot isyou can go up to the main statue but you cant get a good photo unless you have some wide lens camera or drone they also do have a lot of commercial properties inside such as dining souvenir shop and etc you can probably spend a whole day or at least half a day there
Name: Garuda Wisnu Kencana Cultural Park

Review: too expensive for what you get and far away from seminyak cost  k plus shuttlebus  k and when you come to the statue you have to pay another  k to go up in the building a few statues to look at nothing else nice view from the restaurant though
Name: Garuda Wisnu Kencana Cultural Park

Review: wasnt going to go here after reading mixed reviews but glad i went on regard to pricing and hidden fees i paid  for my entry ticket and was asked at the ticket booth if i wanted to pay for a ride to the statue you have the option to walk this is  so  altogether at the statue you can then pay to do a tour i didnt choose to do this so cant comment the statue is very grand if you paid for the ride you are then taken to the entrance of the main park which has more statues ponds temples for you to walk around at leisure there is a theatre type place showing traditional balinese dancing at various times which i enjoyed watching food court starbucks a buffet restaurant cafe plenty of places to eat and toilets for  you can spent a couple hours  half day there i think it was worth it
Name: Garuda Wisnu Kencana Cultural Park

Review: these parks are very well maintained though like every place in bali has an entrance fee but thats worth the prize
Name: Garuda Wisnu Kencana Cultural Park

Review: this is a amazing place and very well maintained the property is well spread out and the statues are masterpeices
Name: Garuda Wisnu Kencana Cultural Park

Review: very cool statue in indonesian country the best art in bali i like this monument in indonesia and very recommended this place
Name: Garuda Wisnu Kencana Cultural Park

Review: this is worth a visit if only to admire the engineering feat that went into building the main statue take the lift to the rd floor inside the statue for the view but also the facts and figures on the buildtip  go late in the afternoon and stay for dinner at the restaurant that overlooks the island book a table on the balcony for the best view towards the airport and kuta the view is a winner but the food is a very close second and surprisingly reasonably priced the view in any other part of the world would double the price of the food but not in bali
Name: Garuda Wisnu Kencana Cultural Park

Review: a very elegant place because there are many trees and also towering stones highly recommended for a vacation here
Name: Garuda Wisnu Kencana Cultural Park

Review: this is a sad sellout of the hindu beliefs how can you sell your gods to a jakarta shopping magnate this is purely money making at its worst its expensive and disappointingthe statue is impressive but the tour is a ripoff their is nothing to see on the tour your taken up in a lift to a corridor with descriptions of the build on plaques which could have been issued as a pamphlet at the entrance and a few peepholes to view bali they try to make out its a religious thing its sad hopefully the gods will intervene and stop this rort
Name: Garuda Wisnu Kencana Cultural Park

Review: garuda wisnu kencana is a god from the hindu religion this statue was made in  until  im very recommended this place for the weekend vacation
Name: Garuda Wisnu Kencana Cultural Park

Review: this was our second time here because the previous time the lift inside the statue was not finished so we came today in the bucketing rain decided to pay extra to get the shuttle up the hill instead of walking like last time so idr each to get to statue and then  idr to go up the lift but you cannot take any camera or camera phone up the lift all must be put in a locker and you must wait for tour times every half hour not really worth it
Name: Garuda Wisnu Kencana Cultural Park

Review: this would have to be the worst rip off of any tourist trap in any county ive ever visited  to start you enter through the car parking area at the bottom of the hill  to enter the park which is a very large disused quarry with open grassed areas then you get on a bus to take you to an area with shops and restaurants unless you want a  minute walk up a very steep hill in the heatthey then charge another  to take you up the hill in a small electric cart this take you to a large square at the base of the statue at this stage im thinking this is impressive the entrance is up the steps in a large bare hall lined with pictures of politicians to very end where they charge you another  for the tourafter waiting half an hour the been asked to wait another half hour we started the tour firstly hand over phones cameras ect put them in a locker then put on shoe covers  up we go to the ninth floorthe lift opens out on to a narrow corridor with pictures on the walls of concept plans of the statueand the final design more pictures of politicians the guide explains the story of the three gods and then tells us the whole complex is privately owned by an indonesian shopping centre and apartment developer apart from two dustbin sized peep holes that was itup we go to the  floorsame crap two peep holes along a corridor  no viewing area  that was the tour once outside we decided weve had enough of this rubbish time to get the hell out of here easier said than done the cart driver wont take you back to where he picked you up he drops you at the othe side of the fing quarry  min walk in the heat so you have to past all the shop stalls and overpriced food and drink shopscouldnt wait to to get away from the place dont expect to get away with anything under  by the time you allow for driver entrance fees drinks more drinks light lunch valium so to finish my rantdont waste youre time money energy or sanitylove bali and its people much better places to visit than this hell hole
Name: Garuda Wisnu Kencana Cultural Park

Review: you can see the statue from all over bali the grounds and set up were all nice and the cultural dancing was impressive overall the experience felt like a money draining exercise with a hefty entrance fee followed by more fees for a shuttle service followed by more fees to enter the statue maybe ok at sunset or if youve run out of things to do and see but there are plenty of natural places and historical places to see in bali
Name: Garuda Wisnu Kencana Cultural Park

Review: i knew i had to go here after seeing the structure from the airport when i landed i was impressed by how massive the gwk statue is even when not completed yet seeing the statue up close is amazing the balinese performers traditional parade and kecak dance at  pm really made my visit even more exciting i am happy i visited this place
Name: Garuda Wisnu Kencana Cultural Park

Review: walked around the grounds that was ok the site is still being developed found some of the staff very helpful while others were vague just watching the day go by there does not seem to be a leadership that promotes a culture at this work place that wants to attract tourism the food at the dining was priced ok and was presented ok but the service was slow we did not go in the lift to the top because not only was it expensive but the staff confiscate all cameras and phones before guests enter the lift because the operators own the copy rights to any pictures taken from the tower i agree with the reviews that refer to this attraction being over rated a lot of walking poorly sign posted maps not accurate and of course the obligatory street stalls on the way out  over priced they get the difference between height and tall mixed up at  meters it is not all that high compared to brazils christ the redeemer at  meters some in india and himalayas are also very high enjoy from a distance eg airport or kuta beach
Name: Garuda Wisnu Kencana Cultural Park

Review: the price that you have to pay is not worth it we were recommended by our driver just to kill time before our flight back expensive ticket for a short visit
Name: Garuda Wisnu Kencana Cultural Park

Review: my daughter and i went here early around am perfect time for photos there were only a few people there and the car park was empty when we arrived but full when we left around am the statues are amazing and the park itself has large monolith type limestone cliffsthe gift shop is good too free shuttle bus to and from car park and free golf buggy to take you to main garuda statue
Name: Garuda Wisnu Kencana Cultural Park

Review: bad service at the first counter we needed information about some staff that we thought we could see inside but the lady was arrogant and didnt want to help us it really seemed exciting before entering insidethe prices they set for sightseeing are way high and basing on the prices you may think you going to get satisfied with something youll really about to see insidethey take the phones away for not taking pictures inside the statue hence its only history about how the statue came to exist nothing more than that is insideand then outside the place is very huge and theres nothing exciting to see  hopefully in the coming years they plan something more interesting around this place itll be amazing if the prices they charge are really worth every thing to see
Name: Garuda Wisnu Kencana Cultural Park

Review: we popped in for a quick visit as part of a journey to another destination it was easy to park there are regular transfer buses from the car park to the main entry and the whole ticket buying process as easyit wasnt expensive to get in and we opted for the buggy ride up to the monument itself at the top of a good hill and to walk back down through the rest of the park wear trainersrunners not thongsflip flops also there are quite a few steps in some of the other monuments and templesonce you are up at the monument you have the option to buy a ticket to up inside it but we didnt walking through the park there are also a number of spectacular smaller statues and temples great view points good photo ops as well as shops and restaurants you could easily spend a few hours in the parkit was well worth the visit even if only to know you have been to see it when you spot the statue from everywhere else on the island
Name: Garuda Wisnu Kencana Cultural Park

Review: you should expect nothing special it is a very spacious area with very large statutes the most fun elements were the traditional performances they do in the park and to visit the temple area which includes a nice overview on the island of bali it is also under construction still
Name: Garuda Wisnu Kencana Cultural Park

Review: we just drove there without any previous online bookings after buying tickets then youre asked if you want a shuttle so pay more off we go to the top theres a vast concrete area with no shade or landscaping and its very hot we walked inside the hall  what a disappointment a few photos and very poorly decorated it could be so much better with history art not a boring large hall theres another ride to the second story which leaves at set times another rp but its just looking out of small windows and there are no cameras or handbags etc allowed why no cameras its the very reason you would go up higher to take photos of the view we left got the shuttle which takes you half way or another  to go to the bottom the attraction is poorly presented and the extra costs are incredibly annoying surely this can all be sorted at the entrance and choices made which package to buy without finding out along the way we were disappointed we could not walk right around the statue as the back entrance is blocked off sort out the fee into packages at the beginning  landscape around the statue make the hall an informative place allow cameras on the higher floors and get better organised
Name: Garuda Wisnu Kencana Cultural Park

Review: a total scam they charge u  different places  of us was a total of  idr the park in front is just a plan look like a worksite on the way up
Name: Garuda Wisnu Kencana Cultural Park

Review: we been there for the biggest firework for nye how the promotion promised everywhere it was very poor you must line up very long for drinks and beforemidnight was soll out to view the firework from the partyspot was not possibleso all togethe never never again better on the beach next time
Name: Garuda Wisnu Kencana Cultural Park

Review: i wasnt a big fan of this place i must admit very over priced and so busy if you dont opted to take a private buggyapprox  aus per couple return you would have a long up hill walk to do take in consideration the heat  humidity then once you reach the statue there is another fee to go up to the top approx  aus per person and at selected times so plan your visit well to minimize waiting timesi wouldnt rush backsafe travels
Name: Garuda Wisnu Kencana Cultural Park

Review: flying into denpasar you can see this massive statue perched high on a hill so we were proper interested in going to see itit took a solid hour to get here from our villa in sanur and it was packedfirst you have to pay  ir approx aud to gain access to the status fine but they only shuttle you half way to the statue from here you need to pay an additional  ir per person to get a shuttle bus to the top of the statue and i tell you what on a  degree day you aint gonna walk it so you pay the money and go up to the statuewell its hugeso then you go into the building that the statue is on top of and we were all excited to get to know more about the statue only to find out that you need to pay and additional ir to go into the museumits literally a money spinner and i know people will pay it but its not worth it dont bother  honestlyoh and the staff have no idea what they are doing they do not tell you its extra to get on the shuttle so you have line up again to pay for the shuttle and then they put you under a gazebo which is like a sauna to wait for the shuttle which is a shonky golf cart which only carries  people at a timeyeah everyone dont bother
Name: Garuda Wisnu Kencana Cultural Park

Review: it was a good experiencethe status is sooooo huge not like the picturesu gotta visitand again everyone is so friendlyall bali people are so friendly
Name: Garuda Wisnu Kencana Cultural Park

Review: unless you have some spiritual or cultural connection with this place dont bother no one know what theyre doing the staff are no help at all and appear to not care to get a simple complimentary drink was like panning for gold in alaska in the winter you pay to get in you pay for a shuttle but only to the monument and half way down not all the way down to go just a few steps to get our complimentary drink we were directed around another monument in the rain when we were just a few meters away its a minus score from me
Name: Garuda Wisnu Kencana Cultural Park

Review: it is so big we could see it from the plane as we flew into bali look for the big black thing its actually green with gold black from a distance after asking a taxi driver what it was we rode bikes there for the day after parking a free shuttle bus takes you to the entrance once in we paid for our tickets to go to the ground level of monumentstatue and  more for a buggy ride there you can walk but its dry and hot and some uphill we were so glad we paid for the buggy there after watching others struggle in the heat cant remember how many but there are many statues in the cultural park which you are free to walk around and take photos we paid about k rupiah each for the tour so we could go up the top to the shoulders and take a look via an elevator this is optional only just completed last year its new and different however we only needed a couple of hours there and we were content
Name: Garuda Wisnu Kencana Cultural Park

Review: went here with my big family during year end season which makes it very crowded fortunately tickets purchase did not take a long time maybe many of the tourists purchase the tickets online the staffs at the ticket counter are very helpful the entrance ticket is only to enter the park if one wants to take the shuttle to the statue additional payment of idr kpax is required which makes sense since the park is fully owned  organized by private company the statue indoor area is closed by  pm  the shuttle going back lasted until pm the staffs inside the statue are also very helpful  informative there were  elderlies in our group  the park provide shuttle back to the ticket counter for elderly only   companion overall we had a good time there
Name: Garuda Wisnu Kencana Cultural Park

Review: landing or taking off at bali airport you cannot miss the huge statue to the south a continuation of a development long in the process but now upgraded a must to all visitors
Name: Garuda Wisnu Kencana Cultural Park

Review: unorganised chaos the place is in absolute shambles with bus loads of people turning up to see the grounds youd think thered be more than a couple golf buggies to take them to the attraction when you purchase a shuttle ticket dont expect to be taken to an exit thats an extra feethe best part of the experience was the gelato stand
Name: Garuda Wisnu Kencana Cultural Park

Review: we enjoyed our visit to park suggest you take shuttle to the top its quite a hike in the heat better to do in morning before it gets too hot and so you have plenty of time to visit all sections and see the performances at the amphitheater at there set times we sat right up the top in middle section and had a fantastic view and a breeze that kept us from overheating
Name: Garuda Wisnu Kencana Cultural Park

Review: visited the cultural park to see the impressive mtr statue and was very impressed by the enormous structures the people of bali have producedit really is a serious structure  mtrs in height and some mtrs widethere were other structures there that were also very impressiveas the park is reasonably new there will no doubt be countless other items added to the park in future yearswell done
Name: Garuda Wisnu Kencana Cultural Park

Review: pay to park wait in queue to catch the shuttle to ticket counter as no cars are allowed pay to catch buggy to the top pay to just enter the park and no mention whatsoever about having to pay more money on top of the entrance fee to go inside until you try enter you are then forced to wait until the next tour cannot go up in the lift without waiting for next tour your sneaky cons for more money did not get us we walked away  left the park others should do the same sheer greed plus we didnt want to wait another hour for the next tour with all the queuing we had already done pay for buggy halfway down then you are forced to walk the rest of the way through and past all the tourist shops wait for bus to go to car parkthis park is not run with any professionalism or the paying customer in mind its all totally about the quick buck they can get for every step you takethe heat up there is oppressive and there is no shelter from the heat until you are forced through the gift shop halfway down there are a lot of steps to see things and a lot of walking updown steep inclinesi became unwell on the day we were there with a bout of bali belly on and i nearly fainted from the heat on top of it they would not allow me to catch  pay for a buggy to go from the mid way to the bottom my partner ended up having to be very rm with them about how unwell i was and asked that they bring an ambulance which was parked there  was also a buggy and to that they said we need managers approvalthis is an absolute disgrace and shame on this establishment that you give zero attention or regard to someones healths needs there was no way i was able to walk any further without collapsing as i nearly fainted earlier your staff did not act on anything and had a total lack of compassion rst aid training is needed and to be understood by allworst tourist attraction we have been to in baliuse your hardearned money and go elsewhere wish we had read trip advisor before we went especially as so many people are saying the same thing and now i know its real as unfortunately we too experienced it
Name: Garuda Wisnu Kencana Cultural Park

Review: spent the whole afternoon at gwk interesting place with activities but lots more can be added to make it more happening for different age groups
Name: Garuda Wisnu Kencana Cultural Park

Review: in that area there is also the garuda statue which is right behind plaza vishnu is the garuda plaza where the statue as high as  meters garuda is placed temporarily at this time garuda plaza is the focal point of a large corridor carved with limestone that covers more than  square meters of open space namely lotus pond colossal limestone pillars and monumental lotus pond garuda sculptures make for a very exotic space with a room capacity that can accommodate up to  people lotus pond has earned a good reputation as the perfect place to hold large and international eventsthere is also a statue of vishnus hand which is part of the statue of lord vishnu this is one step closer to completing the complete garuda wisnu kencana statue this work was placed temporarily in the tirta agung areaon september   president joko widodo along with first lady iriana joko widodo attended the inauguration of the garuda wisnu kencana gwk statue
Name: Garuda Wisnu Kencana Cultural Park

Review: magnificent and majestic are the words one can think of when you visit this must visit place in balidepicting the nuances from great hindu mythology of ramayana this place is built to showcase the greatness of garuda the carrier of lord vishnuits being built at a huge space and one can see the main statue even while you are about to land in bali because of its heighta must visit place and i would recommend this to all who so ever is visiting or planning to visit bali
Name: Garuda Wisnu Kencana Cultural Park

Review: we went to see and climb up to the rd floor inside the statue to see a commanding view of the island including the airport the windows are relatively large portholes at about the level of wisnus shouldersno cameras are allowed and all are asked to cover their shoes in disposable mittens to avoid scratching some transparent glass floors from where you can see some of the steel frames belowthe statue is the worlds most complicated and the third highest and a comparison in found along the tour which are done in small groups every half hour until  pm they have age guidelines for the tour from  yrs old because the tour is mainly about the structure and construction of the statue and that there are a few glass floors on the edges of the corridors on the rd floor i personally did not find them distracting or uncomfortablethere are discounts offered for seniors  and upa large water park with many other attractions are being plannedbut as it currently stands it is definitely worth a visit for the whole family
Name: Garuda Wisnu Kencana Cultural Park

Review: garuda wisnu kencana cultural park or gwk  is a tourist destination and attraction in balithe located at south side ungasan badung on the island of balifor moro informationplease dm
Name: Garuda Wisnu Kencana Cultural Park

Review: as first timers to bali we were keen on visiting the park after seeing the enourmous statue after reading the review however we decided to see visit the park and decide upon arrivalwe were taken to the carpark which has a shuttle service to the entrance of the park it is a frequent service that lasts a few minutes at the entrance there were large groups of school students and already we were doubting our intentions to going in among the crowd as we approached the ticket counter we were told that the ticket allows us into the park which have about  areas of interest including two statues that were previously there there is an addiotional cost for a shuttle that can take us to the garuda statue but it is a oneway service only on top of this if you are interested in getting up into the statue it would be an additional cost all up it wouldve been over aud for a persongiven the crowd and the scorching heat in a place with very little shade or trees we decided it wasnt for usalthough it wouldve been good to see the statue and other attractions the cost of ticket is really offputting
Name: Garuda Wisnu Kencana Cultural Park

Review: what a waste of time in beautiful bali seriously i could not have been more disappointed upon entering we were prompted to pay for the combination package which included transportation to and from the main statue the attendant was extremely rude when i was in the process of purchasing tickets for the group it took three times for the machine to finally work and we received our tickets however when i returned home to my surprise i was charged three times i purchased a combination ticket which included transportation to and from the statue while waiting for our time slot we were free to roam around theres not much to see once our scheduled time to tour the main statue was approaching our group had split up into two separate groups after much argument and showing proof of purchase of the transport service several times one group was successful in getting into the shuttle the other group despite showing our receipts were made to purchase a separate transportation fee once our group was finished viewing the statue and waiting in line to take the transport back the transport stopped halfway back to the entrance and prompted everyone to get off and walk the remainder when i finally left i thought my nightmare of an experience was over however i was wrong the nightmare continues as i must now dispute being charged three times for this awful experience the staff here is terribly disorganized and the customer service is seriously lacking if you want to see the statue get a postcard this place is not worth the time and money
Name: Garuda Wisnu Kencana Cultural Park

Review: this is one of the biggest wastes of time and money we spent on one of our day trips you would be just as well finding a good spot outside to take photos as there is really nothing inside the park to see the cost to get into the park is around  we are a  k for an adult and this is very oddly determined by height so we had to pay full price for our  yr old that entry price wouldnt be so bad if that included everything but they then want you to pay for the shuttle bus up to the statue so we walked and had a look at the  other smaller statues on the way there is quite a nice vantage point to look back out up towards kuta once you make it up to the huge statue there is a bit of information inside but then if you want to go up inside the statue they make you pay and take a tour we said we didnt want the tour can you just go inside but no so we walked all the way back down again the whole experience took about an hour and that is because we walked up and there was a huge outdoor function on taking up a large part of the park and it was so badly sign posted that we couldnt find out how to get around it and up to the statue there seems to be huge plans for the park in the future but for the moment i wouldnt waste your money
Name: Garuda Wisnu Kencana Cultural Park

Review: entrance ticket price is rp  per pax and you should go inside by shuttle to entrance gate rp  per pax still have additional price if you wanna go to upstair museum by lift you need to pay extra rp  per pax the total cost only different rp  than borobudur which is much more worthed because unesco site
Name: Garuda Wisnu Kencana Cultural Park

Review: honestly theres some pretty views but most of bali is pretty views there isnt a whole lot here the place is huge and the giant statue is super impressive but its essentially all there is thereworth popping into if youre in the area or on your way to somewhere else but i wouldnt go out of my way to go back here againit was a bit disappointing
Name: Garuda Wisnu Kencana Cultural Park

Review: great place to gather it has balinese dance show iconic statue and you can see bali island view from the top rent for wheel to explore the area
Name: Garuda Wisnu Kencana Cultural Park

Review: one of the best attractions to visit in bali very nice park with imposing statue of garuda that can be seen from far places too the museum gives lot of insight of bali history and culture one can spend a lot of time in the place although it gets quite hot during the day
Name: Garuda Wisnu Kencana Cultural Park

Review: definitely the best place to visit in bali the sculptures are just impressive and magnificent we were in love with all that we see around  recommendedis a little bit more expensive that other attractions in bali but is what you should expect for the quality of service that you receive and the absolutely amazing art work around around  rp per person i just love this place
Name: Garuda Wisnu Kencana Cultural Park

Review: i visited this place on my first day in bali the gardens itself and surroundings are nice and is a great opportunity to take photos you can pay to take a tour inside the actual status but all youre provided with is information on the history of the construction of the statue this was very disappointing i would not recommend paying for the tour
Name: Garuda Wisnu Kencana Cultural Park

Review: it is the largest monument in bali and you can see it on the horizon when you are landing at the airport there are shuttle buses that you up the hill to the main entrance where you purchase tickets pay an extra fee for a new exhibit for viewing the homes of different indonesian ethnic groups well worth the costs bring an umbrella for sure as it is very hot and not much shades the place is not fully built according to the grand design plan not worth paying extra to go up to the monument
Name: Garuda Wisnu Kencana Cultural Park

Review: for me the most impressive thing about the muchpictured sunset at tanah lot was a tiny dot on the horizon  miles away to the south whats that i asked my guide wisnu he answered the exciting thing about the statue of vishnu astride garuda from the moment you spot it as far away as possible is to keep your eye on it as you approach it to watch it grow in detail and magnificence as you get nearer and finally to feel its overpowering presence when you stand on the plaza and it towers over you it is an awesome monument made even more so if you keep in mind how ancient this god is and how much devotion he clearly inspires in his people what i learned from this first trip to bali is that the island is full of gigantic statues to the gods and heroes of the hindu pantheon you meet one at nearly every intersection but none is so grand as this vishnu and garuda at gwk yes the place is unfinished but i think that people who visit gwk when all of its amusements and facilities will have been done and vishnu and garuda are no longer lording it over their lonely hill those people will have a less compelling experience see it now well worth your time your money your sweat little man
Name: Garuda Wisnu Kencana Cultural Park

Review: adults and one  years oldparking pay  entrance pay  shuttle pay   or you can walk up hill m under the sunyou arrive to a big branch new statue if you wanna take the lift inside guess whatpaywe literally stayed  minutes at the feet of the statue free drinks in a lost restaurant that we didnt bother to found as we was already fed upoh once you finish spending money for nothing you can walk in front of the gift shop the shuttle is one way onlynever again total waste of time energy and moneywatch the statue from far away and move one there is nothing more to see
Name: Garuda Wisnu Kencana Cultural Park

Review: never ceases to amaze me the size of these statues if you love bali temples and statues this is the place to go just stunning a nice walk around the gardens and along the pathsthe gift shop at the end had some good bits and pieces go and enjoy a couple of hours worth while the walk around great views from the lookouts as well
Name: Garuda Wisnu Kencana Cultural Park

Review: in general bali has been a nice island but this place is really brings most disappointing and fake bali experience everything is added money entrance buggy transfer statue tour and worst cant even bring camera up to the statue it also feels like a open quarry pit with unfinished building feature yet the visitor is overcharged do not bring your family here to spoil your bali experience
Name: Garuda Wisnu Kencana Cultural Park

Review: i have been waiting for this place to open and finally got to go on the th novemberbut what a rip off money money moneyafter paying rup for parking a free shuttle bus takes you up to the entrythen they want rup each to enter the park and rup each for the golf buggy to take you to the top of the hillall this i didnt mind but when we got to the statue we then get told we have to pay again to go up the statue another rup eachwell we decided we would do it as i had no intensions of ever coming backbut then they informed us the lookout is at the bottom of the statue and no cameras or phones allowed so we left disappointedthe no cameras and phones thing i do not understand as the religious part of the park you can take photo in
Name: Garuda Wisnu Kencana Cultural Park

Review: amazing view amazing work value of the hindu and legend behind feels so deep for me even im not a hindus even my yo daughter amazed with the kecak show and she ranting to me when some tourist shows no respect to the dancers or may be to the dance itself i just can give her some advice to tolerate each other
Name: Garuda Wisnu Kencana Cultural Park

Review: we were bought us here by our bali driver after having lunch from jimbaran saying this has the statue which could be seen from above when flying without having any idea we just agreed to go that statue kind of depicts some hindu god which we got no idea lot of indian tourists were there and only few from other countries could be seen we didnt go to the top as its very tiresome lot of walkingour ticket included a free juice which is somewhat ok this park is of not some historical importance just some new man made structures
Name: Garuda Wisnu Kencana Cultural Park

Review: k to park k to get in k for the shuttle to the top k to go up the statue they just keep asking for your cash and the entire place is far from finished the photos on the website are renderings of what it might look like when its done right now it looks like a quarry surrounded by rubbish with a giant statute in the middle  totally misleading every step of the way  worst place ive visited in bali would not recommend
Name: Garuda Wisnu Kencana Cultural Park

Review: the place itself is not yet finished being built the images you find online or on their brochures are just renderings of what it will look like when its finished but its far from finished it costs k to get in for an adult and then its extra k each for shuttle to the statue and then if you want to go up the statue its k each everything costs extra and not much is worth seeing once its finished being built im sure it will be much better but for now give it a miss
Name: Garuda Wisnu Kencana Cultural Park

Review: gwk statue is top highest statue which located at southern bali surrounding by beachs and amazing views
Name: Garuda Wisnu Kencana Cultural Park

Review: you can see this when landing at the airport and you wonder what the hec is it well its a huge statue of the garuda indonesian bird there is a parking fee then a entry fee to the park then a fee for the cart to take you u to the statue and other entry fee to look inside the statueall a bit much although very cheap by australian standardsthere is a temple where you wear a sarong then it gets taken off again on the other side before the big garuda it is impressive but only completed in  so no history to understand why you would need a polo shop outlet or  they are allover bali in a cultural park i dont understandonce again not very well signed and they were setting up for a festive and unlike australia no witches hats to help we walked over a temporary stage and across wiring between stage lighting laying across the groundthere is a night tour which may have been better size is impressive but thats about it and be prepared for walking this would be a once only event i think
Name: Garuda Wisnu Kencana Cultural Park

Review: gwk got several grand statue that can represent bali but it was incomplete place i think little attractions so many incomplete places expensive and what i really dont like is you cant order online transportion directly from the entrance the village peoples around there will intimidate the driver so they can monopolize the transport and charge inbelievable transport fee
Name: Garuda Wisnu Kencana Cultural Park

Review: i was furious after being dropped of there by our tour guide we were slugged a k entrance pp k pp for shuttle to hot to walk the  hour trip up there only to be taken to the entrancewhen we walked inside there is no explanation as to what it actually representsyou soon find out they want more  extra k pp to go up into the statue no phones or cameras allowed we had been ripped off  theres a big sign at the ticket counter no refunds and i can see why they have that signthe best part was after paying k for the shuttle it only takes you back half the way  i said to the driver we want to go back to where we startedguess what he wanted us to give him money complete waste of time and money  it end up costing us  aud and we still dont know what it isvery disappointing
Name: Garuda Wisnu Kencana Cultural Park

Review: is one of our bigest and hightes statue in bali it is call garuda wisnu kencana culuture park it s located in ungasan village on the way to uluwatu tampe in this place you will see the culture of bali
Name: Garuda Wisnu Kencana Cultural Park

Review: what a joke my boyfriend  i went k entrance pp k pp for shuttle to see a quarry you can see it better from our airbnb rooftop extra k pp to go into the statue no phones or cameras allowed absolute rip off dishonest at the entrance because had i known this we wouldnt have gone in at all but theyre so good at playing the idiot i dont understand card or just say yes yes yes theyve got a long way to go honestly not worth anybodys holiday time
Name: Garuda Wisnu Kencana Cultural Park

Review: dont bother completely ruined our day  we paid  idr per person just to walk through the door and there was nothing to see or do felt ripped off asked for a refund and the staff were very unhelpful and had no empathy very disappointing
Name: Garuda Wisnu Kencana Cultural Park

Review: flying into bali it is hard to miss the massvie garuda wisnu kencana statue what a cool experience to go inside so we went the taxi drops you off at a parking lot where you board a trolly like bus to the entrance at any other attraction when you buy a ticket to a land markstatuetower that means you get to go inside and up itnot here nor is that fact listed on the sales window  idr  buys access past the front gate and that is it want to see the statue you can walk up a rough dirt road up massive hill with no handicap access in the bali sun with no shade or pay another  idr  for a rough ride in a golf cart to the top when you get closer you see the statue is massive but it also has massive straight line welds  which makes it look much less impressive up close walking into the statue you notice there is no air conditioning we presented our tickets only to be told your ticket is for the entrace only to go up you can only go during the scheduled times that were not posted anywhere except inside the statue and pay another  idr  in addition you are not allowed to bring cameras or your purse or anything electronic up to the top to take photos drones are also banned so to recap what should have been clear at the entrance of  idr   idr   idr   idr per person we had enough and wanted to go back to the bottom the driver of the golf cart brought us half way down and asked us to exit to see the rest of the park  as in walk around in the hot sun and look at the rocks we declined and asked to go to the end he drove us down and we exited the park when we tried to use our  free drink tickets we were told they were only valid in a different area that you have to walk to in the sun the same went for the x voucher of  idr  that were not valid to be used unless you went into the shops past the hot sunny rocks one thing we noticed was that no one  no one was smiling and happy at the exit of the park we saw wave after wave of people entering and just felt bad for what they would soon go though and what we just escapedthis park should be a great symbol of the heritage of bali instead it is run by a businessman who has deliberatly constructed a maze of fees to extract more money from you to be more fair just put a price up front of  idr  or  idr or whatever in contrast the tokyo tower cost is  the eiffel tower is  to the observation deck this trap makes people feel they were tricked conned and we have no desire to returnsave yourself hrs of time and skip this go have ice cream instead
Name: Garuda Wisnu Kencana Cultural Park
