Review: i should say firstly that we were in two minds about visiting the park because of the mixed reviews most of which bad experiences however we enjoyed our time there yes the park isnt completed and the entry fee was expensive compared to other things to do but we thought it was worthwhile i feel that people disappointed with their experience may have gone with high expectations if you visit bali regularly or plan on doing so in the near future it might be worth holding off for a little bit as they have some great plans for this place but it looks like it will get busy with tourists with the plans they have a nice perk was that there werent many tourists and we were still able to see the main attractions of the park i will give some more details to see if you think it is worth itwe visited the park mid november  we walked to the park from a local hotel the walk from the main road to the ticket booth is quite a long way but not too challenging for those driving there are several parking areas leading up to the park entrance presumably for the expected higher capacity when the park is more complete at the entrance we received a leaflet with a map of points of interest in the park and paid k idr for our ticketentry fee included in this price was a free drink at the panoramic restaurant  min walk from the entrance and a sash with the statue on there are also hourly dance performances on at the amphitheatre considering that we paid k idr to see a trance and kecak fire dance in ubud we thought that the entry fee was very reasonable you get the most for your money if you manage to see everything at the park for those that arent interested in this and only want photos and to see the statue i can understand why this seems like an expensive ticketfrom the entrance there is a shuttle that can take you up to the wisnu kencana statue and then drops you off at another stop this service costs k idr the walk is very manageable it is uphill and may be difficult for the elderly or disabled at the moment there are no steps there from the ticket scanning area so it is accessible to wheelchairs there are also electric scooters you can rent by the hour from the festival park area cant quite remember the price personally i dont think this is worth it we saw some scooters not getting some guests all the way up the hill and it is only a  min walk from this point without stopping on the hillit is an additional price to go up into the statue we didnt do this as we didnt want to pay an extra fee these are also scheduled so you have to wait for the set time to go up to the observation areas i imagine the view is amazing though you can see some brilliant panoramic views from the statue at plaza wisnu and the jendela restaurant that offers the free drink with the entry ticketthe statue of wisnu is in a temple so you are giving a sarong at the bottom of the stairs on both entrances to this area from here we went to the amphitheatre to see a dance overall it was worthwhile and we had a great day even though the park isnt complete it was a good visit
Name: Garuda Wisnu Kencana Cultural Park

Review: it is an interesting park to visit has some great statues to see and a lot of history about them and the gods we left the scotter in the park were we paid  rupees there is a bus that takes us from the parking to the park ticket office an adult pays  rupees to enter and gain access to the gates they offer us  wipes as a gift and a welcome drink for those who want to have lunch there are numerous restaurants and cafes as well as warungs
Name: Garuda Wisnu Kencana Cultural Park

Review: reading other reviewswished that id done before the visit the ticketprices dropped in nov  to  child and  adultbut our experience is nearly the same as all other negative reviews you have to pay and pay and paythe positive twist on this moneydraintrip was the dance performance in the amfitheatrethats why  and not  rating
Name: Garuda Wisnu Kencana Cultural Park

Review: this is our first time visiting gwk i am impressed with the park the management the staff and the cleanliness of the park thumbs up the statues are amazing the entrance fee is decent the facilities are amazing a good place to go in bali which will give you different experience
Name: Garuda Wisnu Kencana Cultural Park

Review: this place is worth the drive out  beware taxi drivers telling there are no taxis returning and trying to get a return fare this place is incredible the statue itself is a wonderful achievement  the dance included is great to watch i would highly recommend this place the only thing is you are asked to pay for the ride up the hill to the entrance  seems they dont encourage you to walk  you can opt for the cart right up the hill which was worth it imo as it was so hot  it is tricky to get a gokek to come to the entrance on the return home  if you can walk half a kilometre towards the main road youll be fine for pick up there
Name: Garuda Wisnu Kencana Cultural Park

Review: out of the many places we have visited in bali this is the only one that we absolutely hated from the first minutefor starters the park is not finished there are endless closed areas construction sites and huge empty spaces everywhere not to mention the garbagethe entire attraction is designed to get as much money from all visitors as humanly possible after paying the entrance ticket idr  per person you are guided towards the shuttle service where you can pay more to be taken up to the statue we decided to walk on the way up to the statue they will try to get your money anyway half way up to the statue they will try to give you a scooter or a bike to rent or you can jump on the golf buggies for a further chargeonce you actually reach the statue they charge you idr  more to enter the building we decided not to pay it and only looked from the outsidethe park could have been nice if it was in a natural environment but they have placed it into an old quarry and poured concrete over it so it is absolutely disgraceful you pay hundreds of thousands just to look at one big and two smaller statuesbali has many amazing sights and experiences but not this one this whole park one of the darkest examples of mass tourism and money grabbing the only reason this place exists is to get as much money from you as possible while offering nothingsave yourself an afternoon and go somewhere else
Name: Garuda Wisnu Kencana Cultural Park

Review: this park has nothing good inside the same was written in online reviews however i still went ahead to be there bought tickets from klook which wa smooth to buy and redeemparking is k idrticket is around  idr on klook  on counter per person for nothing to seeonce you have redeemed ticketyou need to buy buggy ticket to go near garuda statue which is  idr sgd per person  this ticket on your way back only drop you until half way then you have to walk till shuttle stand and then go parking using shuttle busthis is total waste of money and timehowever entrance of the place till parking is long way and you would feel that you will get to see something good but its totally hopeless place all you see is statue of garuda just from the base of iti forgot to mention if you actually wanna go inside the statue you have to buy the ticket again separately which i believe is more than  sgd per person
Name: Garuda Wisnu Kencana Cultural Park

Review: still on construction everywhere except the statue nothing else to see one big disappoinment in bali
Name: Garuda Wisnu Kencana Cultural Park

Review: you get a grab or taxa to drive you therethat will be the first k to get in with a caryou get an entrance ticketthats kyou get confused as to where to go and see lots of people taking a golf car you buy tickets for that golf carthats kyou get to the statue and you want to go upthats kso far youve spend k and you are still a little confused as to why there are  statues in the middle of a construction siteif you are smart and prepared you only get to pay k and take the free view from the buddhai like things that make me feel small and the statues did the job so  stars
Name: Garuda Wisnu Kencana Cultural Park

Review: was there some years ago  not really being there as i am now and finally be able to experience it in fully i can say its all worth it some might have different opinions but i must say if you looking for party places where you can drink till you drop or do some other crazy regular tourist stuffthis place totally not for you if you are a person who appreciate culture arts or heritage this is a place to visit you can have the whole experiences in one place and not to mention it is one of the world icons
Name: Garuda Wisnu Kencana Cultural Park

Review: you have to admit that the statue stands out from afar in bali where no building is to be higher than a palm treeas soon as we arrived we have to pay rp  for parking our car rp  entrance fee for adults and rp  for children children shorter than m are freeyou can either do the  minutes walk to the statue or pay rp  for a one way ride to the statue everybody has to walk back because you have to walk pass all the shops and restaurantsweve been telling the kids since we landed in bali that were gonna go up on the statue to enjoy the scenery once we got to the statue we have to pay another rp  to go to the top and no children younger than  is allowedso why the hell is the children price at the gate and why nobody told us thisafter arguing with the person selling the tickets he finally said that were allowed to go upstairs which we denied the reason why children are not allowed in the first place is safety and security so what changed in the last  minutes while we were arguingin short dont go there its a rip off tourist trap
Name: Garuda Wisnu Kencana Cultural Park

Review: we were very excited to go and see this statue after seeing it from afar during our stay well it was a bit of a let down close up save your money and go elsewhere as this park is still under construction and everything is so far apart once up to the top you are asked to pay extra for the tour we didnt we caught the shuttle to the next statue further down for the impressive views instead dont be caught out here it is like a dubai park in the making and one day it will be worth the visit but id say hold on to your money until then
Name: Garuda Wisnu Kencana Cultural Park

Review: although this monument is vast in size and can be seen from kuta beach its actually still in the building stagewe didnt really understand what it is all about we hadnt planned going here but our driver thought we would like itits built out of an old quarry and will become a theme park but at the moment its a little bit underwhelming there will be the opportunity to go up to the viewing platform once complete and the views will be amazing the huge statues are quite impressive and do draw peoples attentionin my opinion i would suggest waiting till its complete to be able to get the full experience as currently its a little nondescript and im sure from looking at the proposed plans its going to be an amazing attraction
Name: Garuda Wisnu Kencana Cultural Park

Review: i agree with the reviews that it is expensive its very misleading what you get for the first entrance fee but in saying that we took the tour up inside the statue first to the th floor then to the rd it ended up just being the  of us on the tour the information that we were given about the statue was interesting  well presented i have no regrets paying the money to do it i enjoyed it
Name: Garuda Wisnu Kencana Cultural Park

Review: positives really big statue visible from far nice for few picturesnegatives boring and expensive its nothing there except the statue and dancing program ugly surrounding nothing to see expensive they charge you a lot for entrance then they charge you extra for a shuttle bus you dont need then they charge you extra more than for entrance for going up in the statue total is  idr or  usd for a statue nonsense
Name: Garuda Wisnu Kencana Cultural Park

Review: my friends and i visited this park since we were curious about the giant statue of vishnu very quickly we realized though that this place wasnt worth our time or money there are lots of additional fees beyond the rather large k entrance fee you want to skip a sweaty uphill walk to the statue that will be an extra fee you want the additional experience at the top of the statue that will be k extra want to ride more than halfway back down that will be extra too and youll be forced to walk by plenty of shops before you finally find the exit as well we didnt see any dances so maybe those are worthwhile but in general our experience left quite an unpleasant taste in our mouths the statue itself is cool but save your money and enjoy it from a distance for free
Name: Garuda Wisnu Kencana Cultural Park

Review: wonderful statue they have in here also kecak dance makes me proud so i decided to going with my friend also enjoy every moment in my life
Name: Garuda Wisnu Kencana Cultural Park

Review: so i had no idea what this was we just jumped in a taxi and said off to the big statueyou pay to get in the area and then walk a bit to find the gates once inside there is a traditional dance which was good and im glad i saw it there were  dances and musicians so it wasnt super fast you get to enjoy itafterwards the dancers stay and ask you to take photos all the while asking you to hurry up because its hot i get it it would be hot inside the big costumesafter that you make your way towards the statue honestly you walk through a whole lot of nothing big open hot paved areas no shadethere are electric scooters to hire here to drive up to the statue we did this and it was fun but its not far to drivewalk so not really much point once you get to the statue they want you to pay again so we jumped back on our scooters and forgot about iton the way back down the paths are super steep in fact an adult going up needs to practically walk it up as the scooters have minimum power on the way down one of our group came off and got hurt so if you have kids think twice about going up this hillback down there is a little courtyard where you can waste away the rest of you  mins hirethere is seriously no where else to take these scootersback outside again we got our free welcome drink which is like super sweet cordial and left there isnt much here at all
Name: Garuda Wisnu Kencana Cultural Park

Review: if youre wondering whats the big thing youll see on the left side of legian beach this is it theres an entrance fee for tourists once in the area you can either walk to go up or take their mini bus again for a fee there are shops and restaurants in the area nice place to take photos but the development is not yet completely finished
Name: Garuda Wisnu Kencana Cultural Park

Review: dont waste your time or your money  absolutely the worst touristy thing ever every thing costs big timethe entry to park  r eachoh you want to get up to from entry point to the statue very steep  another  r each  you are now inside the inner sanctum  toooo late to back down now baby oh yes then entry to inner part of statue another  r eachoh you want to go back down to the car park  more rupiah please it never stops and it really is just a fake massive steel framed statue covered with fibreglass seriously vileabout as exciting as watching paint dry look closely at my finger
Name: Garuda Wisnu Kencana Cultural Park

Review: i think is a must visit place with the kacak dance perfomanceat least once in lofe timei spend  hours there with the view and dance perfomance
Name: Garuda Wisnu Kencana Cultural Park

Review: i was quiet excited to see this as we drove past it on our way to uluwatu so we dedicated a morning to head back there on arrival the initial entrance was very grand and you were ushered into a car park payment from the car park you had to take a shuttle bus to the official entrance of the park here we were charged the entrance fee payment which seemed reasonable at first each in which were given a bundle of vouchers and tickets for discount at gift stores and restaurants which was a bit confusingonce we entered with our tickets we were told it was a minute uphill walk to the main statue and that it was advised to take another shuttle bus payment  as we shuttled our way up to the main statue it was immediately obvious that the park was no where near completed and looked like a large mining  construction siteas we arrived at the main statue we entered the base to be told we had to make a further payment if we wanted to go up the statue itself this seemed completely unfair and unjustwe decided to leave at that point and and made the walk back down to the entrance past pretty much rubble and vast emptinessthe site is popular for local tourists which also meant at the entrance there were stack loads of run down coaches that were chugging out constant black smoke from their exhaustsnot pleasantwe were very disappointed as we really wanted to gain a positive cultural experience here but we were very happy to leave amongst bails many unbelievably beautiful experiences this one is not ready to see
Name: Garuda Wisnu Kencana Cultural Park

Review: we thought we could just pull up for a photo stop as our driver had mentioned the importance of the place so we agreed to a visit paid  aud for the entrance then had to walk a long way to get into the entry point uphill then another steep uphill walk to get to the base for photoswe did want to go up inside the statue but didnt realise extra charge another aud to take the elevator and had to wait for the tour tired from long day at the beach we decided just to take quick photos only park map was only given to us because we asked at the base entrance and not given at entry point would have been helpful earlier over all interesting and glad we saw it great vantage point we just didnt realise a longer visit would have been good so didntmake the most of it plenty of cafe and snack spots and you can hire a buggy to drive you up instead off walking
Name: Garuda Wisnu Kencana Cultural Park

Review: beautiful place to spend a few hours walking around i do highly recommend paying the extra  for a shuttle to the top and walk back down
Name: Garuda Wisnu Kencana Cultural Park

Review: dont bother especially if you have young children you pay to get it then they tell you if you want to use the shuttle you pay extra then you arrive at garuda and they say you have to pay more to do the tour dont eat at the restaurant either it is very unappealing and also the welcome drink is disgusting not worth it at all
Name: Garuda Wisnu Kencana Cultural Park

Review: its really unfortunate but what was once a majestic statue the largest in indonesia is now something similar to a theme park there are souvenirs photos scooter rentals gift shops and even a starbucks we were so disappointed thinking we were going to see a little more culturalif you do go spend the extra few dollars to get the shuttle when you buy your tickets its quite a hike to the top and in the bali sun youll thank me
Name: Garuda Wisnu Kencana Cultural Park

Review: this gwk cultural park is built to honour the hindu god vishnu and his companion bird garuda there is a giant statue there which can be seen many kilometers away an impressive statue the cultural dance is also a nice attraction
Name: Garuda Wisnu Kencana Cultural Park

Review: its a must visit tourist place in bali the architecture is awesomethe project was planned in  i guess and completed in  i believethanks a lot to indonesian govt for constructing hindu temple
Name: Garuda Wisnu Kencana Cultural Park

Review: we visited gwc twice as we liked the dances very much and they were quite cheapfrom parking lot there is a free shuttle to centre the ticket for entrance is k for seniorswe went by a buggy to auditorium and enjoyed the beautiful dances in between we went up and saw big statue of vishnu after that we saw the big statue of garud vishnu on the hill the road was easy to walk and beautiful we had the complete dance menu from website on previous day and we chose which dances to be seen in the eveningthere is fire dance also but we saw that at the ulu watu temple you can very easily need  hrs to see and enjoy the park all park people are polite and helping
Name: Garuda Wisnu Kencana Cultural Park

Review: we ordered a gojek because there r no taxis and local people around the place tried to beat us up because of that watchout we found another couple with the same problem and we had to walk out the are followed by locals and security of the place that run after us to beat us dont go to that place if u have no motorbike
Name: Garuda Wisnu Kencana Cultural Park

Review: big place lots to explore dont forget your bottles of water and your sun hat luckily they give you a map before you enter because this place is quite large and a little bit confusing to get around i attended the balinese dancing show which was beautiful the statues are huge and you can see the main one from anywhere in kuta off in the distance
Name: Garuda Wisnu Kencana Cultural Park

Review: the third tallest statue in the world can be seen here everything in this place is on the large size its a huge complex with lots of walking and stairs but plenty of places to sit down and take a break there is a shuttle at the entrance that will take you to the main statue you can also go up inside the shoulder but it is a separate charge and no cameras are allowed a guide tells you how the statue was made we found it interesting sarongs and belts are provided for you the parking lot is spacious and a trolley takes you to and from the entrance we enjoyed our visit
Name: Garuda Wisnu Kencana Cultural Park

Review: car parking at bottom of hill  to park k each to get into parkk each to catch bus up hill to monument includes down only half way or walk for freethere are bikes and electric scooters half way to hireonce you get to the top and go inside a long hall type of room approx  meters there is another que point on left for the lift only to be told another k each person but main thing no cameras no phones no movie camreas aloud up to the next level you can only go up to the building looking floor from outside not to the top for anybody plus limited tours each hourso we went back outside few photos then left to go down on golf cart but only stop half way down then there are segways to play on but only around this area were they can see you price in photosthen out through gates into some restaurants and shops before walking around outside the function center there is small water fountain area for children to play inthen exit through the shop to get last  from your pockets once outside a small local restaurant on opposite side of center that prices are more reasonable than inside with fantastic view over the baythen walk back down past more shops just incase you had a few  left to pick up area for the bus to return you back to carparkwasnt what we were expecting so wont recommend it
Name: Garuda Wisnu Kencana Cultural Park

Review: well nothing much to dotired to walkwe see the great garuda wisnu kencana statue by shuttle bus with over passenger is not comfortable we just see the statue from the groundwe not allowed to see the statue from the inside closed not for public at that time in august we watched the dance as wellits was pretty good
Name: Garuda Wisnu Kencana Cultural Park

Review: nice temple but take your wallet i walked up to the temple but you could hire a bike or electric scootet to push up the hill i had to laugh when i walk around the corner to see all the poeple pushing the bikes and electric scooters up the hill because they were not powerful to go up the hill and when i got to the top then got told i had to pay more to go in the temple and wait and hours for the next tour to in the temple managed to lost on the trip back down with a couple of other poeple as well i i would rather view from far away with a zoom lens
Name: Garuda Wisnu Kencana Cultural Park

Review: if i could have given  stars i would you pay k per person just to be able to walk to de foot of the statue once youre there and you want to go in you need to pay an extra of k per person ask your driver to drive to a spot nearby to be able to make a nice picture dont go in its uselessone free advice if there are large signes at the counter which say no refunds it has a reason
Name: Garuda Wisnu Kencana Cultural Park

Review: as other reviewers have said this is place is expensive but on top of that its bad value thats why i rate it poorlyi dont mind expensive if the experience is amazing as my many other reviews attest gwk is not even close to amazingthe sculptures are largely cheap fibreglass facsimiles the dodgy carnival feel is added to by the weird selection of food starbucks for goodness sake and the truly horrific gift shop packed with absolutely brainless bali tat like bottle openers and mini surfboards who even wants a power adapter with gwk printed on itthe icing on the ripoff cake is saved for when you get to the main attractionfor five of us im m down to get this far and another k if you count the half day transport to get here at the base of the main statue im asked for a other k to use a lift to get up to the observation deck and gallery as if that isnt gouging enough for the privilege of this cost i am not allowed to take any sort of photographic device including my phone why well you probably guessed it because if i want pictures i have to buy theirs no thanksnot recommended if youre a student of hindu culture the cheap and gaudy treatment might amuse you for everyone else theres more culture in having a decent chat with a taxi driver
Name: Garuda Wisnu Kencana Cultural Park

Review: very disaponting its only made to rip off the tourists its not worth the money you start with paying  for the entrance but thats just the start and only for the entrance to the park to get into the building you have to pay again every step further pay again wanna drink  for a small bintang there are so much nicer things to see on bali defenetly not this theme park
Name: Garuda Wisnu Kencana Cultural Park

Review: after almost thirty years in the making the majestic garuda wisnu kencana gwk statue is finally completed and a mustvisit especially for culture and history buffsentry fee  idr k if you want to look inside the statue is about idr k
Name: Garuda Wisnu Kencana Cultural Park

Review: our day at the gwk cultural park was great so much to see lots of free shows all included in the addition price free shuttle too and from the car park the place is amazing to wander around the giant statue can be seen from all over the east of island well most of it  i was told that they are building a bridge from the smaller statue to the gwk statue the gig new one with a restaurant by the new statue should be something to see well worth a visit
Name: Garuda Wisnu Kencana Cultural Park

Review: lets start with i never thought i could get scammed seeing a statuewe paid to park the carwe paid to get in   little sign says kids under  free  when you get to the window its kids over cm pay and over cm pay as adults so scammed twice now  than the shuttle to the top you pay again   mind you unless you are a mountain climber you cant walk up   so we have finally arived and are greeted by a fountain with no water and a huge statue  than we are told if we want to go up its another ticket and more money  or  well you can walk around and look at a concrete unfinished building with a fountain with no water  so we say stuff it we are leaving  you have to pay to get a shuttle down  of we go again  but guess what they only take you half way down and not all the way so you can get scammed at all the retail along the way in short dont waste your time  bali is a great place but this is the greatest rip of ever  the place is filthy and what a waste of money and our time
Name: Garuda Wisnu Kencana Cultural Park

Review: have just spent  nights in bali and visited the gwk park it is unbelievable and well worth a visit
Name: Garuda Wisnu Kencana Cultural Park

Review: interesting place with lots of photo opportunities also worthwhile going to the cultural dance very colourful and vibrant
Name: Garuda Wisnu Kencana Cultural Park

Review: its most amazing park for me in bali i fell in love with garuda story  all architecture in a park we were walking there for hours its fantastic place to see  to feel its energy highly recommended for visiting  seeing on of the biggest statues in the world
Name: Garuda Wisnu Kencana Cultural Park

Review: worth a trip the statue is massive and there are some good views from the park it is all quite new so there are a few teething problems but it didnt spoil our visit the dance shows were enjoyable
Name: Garuda Wisnu Kencana Cultural Park

Review: garuda wisnu kencana is located in the southern badung area k per person entry fee which is high
Name: Garuda Wisnu Kencana Cultural Park

Review: bali money grab at its worstk per person entry feeonce inside they want to charge you for any and everythingthey make you stop so they take your photo before entering then want you to pay k for that photo when leavingthey want k pp if you want to go into the main statue and if youre stupid enough to do that then they insist that phones cameras and all your belongings are put into a locker wtf if you get tired from all the walking they want k pp to take you backdont bother youll be disappointed
Name: Garuda Wisnu Kencana Cultural Park

Review: this area is amazing and beautiful with huge structures it was a bit confusing where to go but once we worked out to be driven to the top of the hill and walk down and see everything as we descended a few more signs in english would be helpful but well worth a few hours spent there
Name: Garuda Wisnu Kencana Cultural Park

Review: entrance fee is a total rip off lacks proper signage no shed inside k for the entrance then additional k for the buggy and free welcome drink is powdered iced tea which is selfservice aside from the  big statue there nothing much inside the cultural show happens every hr from ampm but thats it what we see inside is way below our expectation and not worth k there are lots of tourist spots in bali where you spend less but get more than whats in there
Name: Garuda Wisnu Kencana Cultural Park

Review: flying into bali airport one is greeted by the massive presence of the gwk statue which is visible all along the beach strip from kuta legian and seminyak we couldnt wait to take a tour up to the cultural park and duly prepaid the au entrance fee there was a lot of preparation happening for a music festival that started the day after our visit so to be fair there was a lot of activity noise and the hustle and bustle we didnt seem visit during any of the cultural shows and were disappointed after trecking up the hill to the statue to find there was a further entrance fee of au  to get in then there is the photo package ranging from aus to aus food and drink memorabilia  for the golf buggy to get you down the hill why not up etc etc its almost like the balinese government has seen the venture as establishing a balinese disney world but forgot all the fun bits and skipped to fleecing of tourists so after spending up for travel and entry we ended up with photos of the statue that were no different to those we took from outside the campus with a good camera sorry but until there is some transparency in offering and price we cant recommend
Name: Garuda Wisnu Kencana Cultural Park

Review: been several times coming here and happy to revisit again since the place offer u a stunning view of massive built statuetry the ampitheater as well if u like to see cultural performance
Name: Garuda Wisnu Kencana Cultural Park

Review: not worth the trouble takes a long time to get there and a lot of walking once you have charges for parking entrance fee and also to get into the statue we ended just having lunch with our driver hotel packed it for us took a couple of photos at the entrance and left very crafty cant actually see the bg until you drive away from it and go down some side streets
Name: Garuda Wisnu Kencana Cultural Park

Review: gwk is balinese for tourist trap first they charge you  usd to get in the park then another few bucks to take the golf cart up the road then once you get up to statue its another  to go in the giant statue i didnt do the last  but im guessing once you get up there its another  for something then another  for something elsei have a more specific gripe that while i waited for my sucker friends who paid the additional  i bought ice cream for my wife and i i literally got  the ice cream she got now i get it im overweight but they didnt need to get all judgy on me and give me a tiny cone
Name: Garuda Wisnu Kencana Cultural Park

Review: we visited the gwk without homework and were disappointed to find that it was not an ancient spot besides the same time we could have invested in visiting nasa dua or other natural beautygwk is expensive idr per person needs  hours and not good on a sunny hot day there are two big statues to see the gwk has two tickets one for the entry and another for going up on gwkits a great engineering wonder for sure but i expected a natural or ancient marvel
Name: Garuda Wisnu Kencana Cultural Park

Review: staying in jimbaran the gwk statue is an imposing figure on the skylinewe thought we would pay it a visitentry fee of rph which we were aware of i really wanted to go up to see the view from inside the statuewhen you arrive to lobby inside you only then are told its another  to access the statue no thanksoverall the park was boring and still under construction in areasnot worth it in my opinion
Name: Garuda Wisnu Kencana Cultural Park

Review: they tell you this was built for tourists they cater to that and each thing you want to do is extra meaning the initial entry is one price and once youre in everything else is alacart just expect that the status is nice and its a nice walk but dont get your hopes up with the wow factor once the enormous size of the statue subsides it was nice but id probably say skip it even though its enormous and impressive when you walk up to it
Name: Garuda Wisnu Kencana Cultural Park

Review: we found it amazing definitely worth paying more to go up to the rd floor and learn how it was built totally blew us away
Name: Garuda Wisnu Kencana Cultural Park

Review: basically they charge you about  auseach to go and look at a statue then if you want to go up inside the statue it costs even more nothing else to do there and barely any information it will be nice in a couple of years time when they have finished landscaping at the moment dont bother to go there
Name: Garuda Wisnu Kencana Cultural Park

Review: from a distance this statue looks like a cultural landmark but it is a newly built statue in the middle of a tourist park which is under constructionit was a waste of money place to avoid
Name: Garuda Wisnu Kencana Cultural Park

Review: its a must visit place if you are visiting bali such a big statue of garuda wisnu kencana perform bali dance etc
Name: Garuda Wisnu Kencana Cultural Park

Review: wow this is a lovely park to visit beautiful gardens and the finished wisna statue is amazing lots to see here and lovely views
Name: Garuda Wisnu Kencana Cultural Park

Review: the park is well organized theres a shuttle bus that takes you from the parking lot to the park the ticket includes a welcome drink at a great restaurant which have a great view theres a theater where you can watch a traditional dance performance the status are really impressive
Name: Garuda Wisnu Kencana Cultural Park

Review: visited as part of a tour only had an hour or so to spend but the main statue is spectacular along with the others the scale is immense could easily spend  hours esp if you want to take in a show which we were unable to do the park itself is under construction so a little raw but overall very good
Name: Garuda Wisnu Kencana Cultural Park

Review: we first noticed this flying in a year ago so when we realised we were on the area  we had to come and visit up close lucky we had our driver with us as the process is an interesting one park in one area and get a shuttle to another area to purchase your tickets we also paid the extra for the shuttle thinking this for us up and back  it only takes you up  then you have to walk back so you can pass all of the shops and tourist sales  well played we didnt have enough time to do the  minutes tour and we were lucky the staff told us how long it would be interesting place and worth a visit
Name: Garuda Wisnu Kencana Cultural Park

Review: nice placewery well maintain and clean deffenetly worth to visit we reallr enjoy our walk there somethi g different from bali  gkw is a cultural and historic place beautifull photos and wery wery hot sunny day
Name: Garuda Wisnu Kencana Cultural Park

Review: definitely a worth tourist place fortunate enough to be here during august as the prices are half off because of their national independence month the sights and surrounding were amazing the staff were friendly
Name: Garuda Wisnu Kencana Cultural Park

Review: very special place to visit our tour gide tidy was excellent and very informative  great place to visit beautiful view from above incredible construction  memorable pictures add to your list of places to visit when in bali cheers vartkes and anoush
Name: Garuda Wisnu Kencana Cultural Park

Review: loved our visit to gwk definitely do the guided tour its so interesting how they have made this statuethe cultural dances in the ampitheatre were great the statue is breathtakingi didnt find it over priced  entry is like  aud and guided tour around the same
Name: Garuda Wisnu Kencana Cultural Park

Review: the ticket as idrkperson which is quite expensive you will get a welcome drinks after you out from the placethe place it self is massive and the statue was so coolits worth to visit only one time the place it self still lot of renovation and not done the funny part is you need to pay again to go up which is non sense
Name: Garuda Wisnu Kencana Cultural Park

Review: expensive tourist trap with no history k pp to enter and you gain access to the cultural park and then have to pay extra to enter the statuethe park is an old quarry with the gwk statue a couple more smaller statues and a balinese theatre showing balinese dances and theatre in reality you are only going for a closer look at the statue this is impressive however dont feel warrants such cost compared to other attractions nearbythere are no locals using this facility for worshipping and was seemingly only built for touristsspent a while looking for the fountains and gardens as shown in art work however this does not exist confusing and misleading
Name: Garuda Wisnu Kencana Cultural Park

Review: it was the biggest statue i have ever seen yes it is still in development but it is spectacular and i hope they will finish it the park is massive and i would suggest using the shuttle to see the statue to go up into the statue does cost more there are also cultural shows and a temple
Name: Garuda Wisnu Kencana Cultural Park

Review: garuda statue was very satisfying to watch it is really huge never seen something like that in my life and the temples there are so nice and clean i really loved going there it was worthy
Name: Garuda Wisnu Kencana Cultural Park

Review: there are a few things to do here that are included in your entry price  temples to see and performances to view on the hour you can also hire out bikes to ride around if you arent physically able you can pay a fee for the shuttle up to the main temple as there are many steps and hill to climb otherwise the temple itself is relatively new so there are a lot of plans yet to be realised however for another fee you can pay to get to the top of the large statue of garuda wisna
Name: Garuda Wisnu Kencana Cultural Park

Review: paid  rp for entrance only to realise the main statue still charges extra plus it closed early at pm before we arrived besides the statue there really isnt much else to see in the park so for the price its really not worth itvery much a tourist super trap go only if you really want to get that up close view of the statue
Name: Garuda Wisnu Kencana Cultural Park

Review: rising from gently sloping bukit peninsula an enormous statue of garuda carrying wisnu commands your attention taller than nearly every other freestanding structure the gwk is best viewed at late afternoon when the colours of the metal vary from grey to green to gold admission is an easy process buy your ticket and walk make your visit a pilgrimage to the craftsmen who raised it and the history it portrays
Name: Garuda Wisnu Kencana Cultural Park

Review: this park is newly created with th tallest statue in the world popularly known as gwk nice statue
Name: Garuda Wisnu Kencana Cultural Park

Review: cant get over how large this statue is photo do not do it justice very hot and a lot of walking
Name: Garuda Wisnu Kencana Cultural Park

Review: an amazing statue that you see from the air flying in to bali the cultural park is earmarked for major expansion and covers a big site well organised with transport to the statue on a golf buggy entry up the statue costs more as does the trip in the golf buggy but we didnt have time to do the park fully the restaurant where you obtain your complimentary drink is tranquil with amazing views took great photos of the statues all in all a great visit
Name: Garuda Wisnu Kencana Cultural Park

Review: the statue is the third largest in the world and has been beautifully carved the entire cultural park is huge and in my opinion was over expensive the charges were pax there was not much to see in this price most of the other things like the museum had a separate entry ticket the balinese dance show was good food was expensive and not included we just got a small welcome drink the buggy was pax extra and dropped us one way only we had to walk all the way backif you are on a short trip to bali you can surely skip visiting this place
Name: Garuda Wisnu Kencana Cultural Park

Review: i really enjoyed this cultural parkits warm so take some water theres a fair bit of walking to do so if your not a walker than take the shuttle busgrab an ice cream on the way out to cool downa lot of reviews have people winging about the price but its a once off thing to go and seeappreciate the time and work that went into the rd biggest statue in the world
Name: Garuda Wisnu Kencana Cultural Park

Review: set in an old quarry although call cultural park impressive statues but to go up the big one they charge more money very much aimed at getting as much money out of tourists as possible very disappointing
Name: Garuda Wisnu Kencana Cultural Park

Review: it is a must visit place if you are visiting bali such a big stature of garud vishnu bali dance performances etc very well built
Name: Garuda Wisnu Kencana Cultural Park

Review: visit this statue is a mus if you go in bali buying the ticket will guarantee you access in a really nice park and you will see one of the biggest statue in the worldi suggest the visitors to complete the tour entering inside the statue the ticket is quiet expensive but the experience will deserve you the ticket price
Name: Garuda Wisnu Kencana Cultural Park

Review: impressively huge statues and nice scenery about  entrance fees if you can walk dont pay for the shuttle bus although its very cheap we went early in the morning but it might be nice to visit during sunset either way you shouldnt spent more than  hour there
Name: Garuda Wisnu Kencana Cultural Park

Review: theres been mixed reviews about this place but i think its world class this place has the feel of both petra and teotihuacan i think its worth visiting now and again a few years down the road as they continue to populate with other buildings and attractions
Name: Garuda Wisnu Kencana Cultural Park

Review: it is an absolutely massive statue which you can view from kuta beach and elsewhereit does remind me of the big buddha statue in phuket still not finished and bit of a tourist trap
Name: Garuda Wisnu Kencana Cultural Park

Review: the gwk statue can be seen from afar and it is spectacular up close entry is rp and due to time restriction i paid the extra rp to take the shuttle golf cart up which turned out to be an excellent time saver this takes you to the base of the statue then you can walk back from the plaza half way i didnt do the statue tour due to cost but also time but still felt like i got so much out of my visit the walk back down allows you to see the rest of the grounds which for people who did not take the golf cart would have to see twice and it is fantastic it was a little confusing for people like me who took the shuttle when collecting the welcome drink included iced lemon tea as you need to exit then walk back past the entrance to the cafe getting to the original ticket counter is then a short walk down the hill a shuttle service is available tofrom the car park allow for plenty of time if you want to see the shows in the amphitheatre andor tour up the statue  my rushed visit took mins
Name: Garuda Wisnu Kencana Cultural Park

Review: interesting but expensive we only did the grounds of the area didnt pay the extra to go into the statue might be more worthwhile when its totally completed its taken  years to get this far
Name: Garuda Wisnu Kencana Cultural Park

Review: we visited with friends who really wanted to see the big statue unaware of the entry fee and shuttle price we were surprised it was so high when we entered the main attraction there were large boards showing restaurants and skywalks etc but when we enquired it was master plan not yetto get to higher floors without camera i overheard it was a further  we walked most of the rest of the park found the lotus pond empty and have never had to walk and ask directions so many times ever for a welcome drink which we consumed on our way out  quite ridiculous it not worth the cost in my opinion id wait years till the master plan is completedand to top it off we got a staff member to take a photo of of the four of us in front of the big statue and he took just us and chopped most of the statue out
Name: Garuda Wisnu Kencana Cultural Park

Review: only go here if u like coach loads of people and doing selfies nothing authentic or historical has been built since  ralph lauren starbucks and other shops if your looking for something generic and mainstream a religious theme park with some franchises chucked in
Name: Garuda Wisnu Kencana Cultural Park

Review: the statue is very big and can be seen from far off however entry and tour is very expensive need proper arrangement at site to attract tourists
Name: Garuda Wisnu Kencana Cultural Park

Review: its a nice big park with about  huge statues and other small ones there is a garden and fountains the pathway is like carved from a mountain the tickets are k rp kids and seniors are cheaper and can also be bought online for k rp near the entrance there is an amphitheater where they play a different dance show every hour or so it was very nice to watch the dancers with different costumes to get up into the big garuda statue it costs an extra k rp but we didnt care to enter it also photos are forbidden inside the statue it took us maximum  hour to walk and take photos in all the park maybe an extra half hour to watch the dance show in the theater the price seems fair considering the nice views the dance shows and also they give a complimentary drink and a gift scarf with the logo of the place overall if you are near the neighborhood then its nice maybe not worth it so much if you are far note it was a short walk total about  km so there was no need to wait or ride any shuttles unless you have seniors or kids we were there on a friday around  and  pm but the park is wide so we didnt feel any crowd also inside and outside the park there is drink and food booths if you need anything
Name: Garuda Wisnu Kencana Cultural Park

Review: the gwk statue can be seen from afar so you would want to see it up close visiting the park doesnt come cheap however the locals themselves find it very expensive your entrance fee does not cover going up the statue which they do not mention at the entrance gates and you only find out upon reaching the elevator area to go to the top the staff will also try to trick you into taking the shuttle for an additional fee per head on the notion that going to the main statue is a  minute walk in truth it is a short walk you just have to deal with the heat and maneuver a short uphill before reaching the statue you find this out because no shuttle takes you back to the entrance area you have to walk back the activity area would have been fun the cultural shows are a treat but the time between shows were too far apart
Name: Garuda Wisnu Kencana Cultural Park

Review: it looked amazing from a distance on how huge it is there was a fee to get in but a little bit extra to take the buggy to the top we took the buggy option as it was too hot to walk up when we got to the top there was an extra fee to go right up to the statue which look boring it looks better from a distance close up is not as amusing as i thought then there was a long as walk in a huge park which is still being developed the signs are not that helpful so getting out of the park was a mission its a money making scheme which is definitely not worth it just have a look from outside dont need to enter the park
Name: Garuda Wisnu Kencana Cultural Park

Review: we visited the statue park at our guidedrivers recommendation we had previously seen the vishnugaruda statue from the beach in seminyak we were curious as to how it looked close up and what else was to see in the cultural park our driver left us at the parking spot we then catched a tiny and very crowded minibus to the park entrance tickets forpark entrance was  each we had the option of paying  more for a transporter further up we chose to walk as did most others after  minutes we reached the main statue it came as a surprise that a further  would have to be paid to enter the statue building there was very little information as to what that would give us we opted out and walked down instead in retrospect the park and statutes are quite uninteresting the park is large and you should be prepared for some walking where entertainment to walking ratio is very low all in all we felt a visit to the park was not worth neither the time nor the money we spent
Name: Garuda Wisnu Kencana Cultural Park

Review: many years people waiting for garuda wisnu kencana cultural park fully open this place so huge and so amazing the big garuda wisnu kencana statue i guest on of the masterpiece in the world customize handmade by men with high skill talented craftmentship inside as a starter we can watch a tradisional magical keris dance with barong and balinese tradisional music intrument gamelan after watch this beautiful dance we can explore fhe whole area take your time and your energy to walk reaching the statue on the top of cultural parkthumbs up for this amazing place
Name: Garuda Wisnu Kencana Cultural Park

Review: we spent a few hours here enjoying the theatre and dance performances along with the very impressive statues the largest being the garuda wisnu kencana which is the fourth tallest statue in the worldthere are several plazas depicting different aspects of balinese culturewe were there during a holiday period so it was very busy but that did not spoil the outing you park in a car park and catch a shuttle bus to the centre that is where you purchase you entrance ticket there are several shops and places to purchase food and drink we had a drink at the bebek bengil restaurant which was very pleasant and had a commanding viewall in all this is a very worthwhile excursion
Name: Garuda Wisnu Kencana Cultural Park

Review: we visited here thinking that a cultural park would have more than just a bunch of really big statues but we were disappointed great photo opportunities but not really much to do this place felt very sterile the real bali is in the streets not in this overpriced tourist attraction
Name: Garuda Wisnu Kencana Cultural Park

Review: we really enjoyed looking at the various statues the main statue garuda wisnu is impressive due to its size appearance to level of detail we stayed for the dance performance which was good but dragged on too long for my liking despite  degrees at the beach it was chilly at night on the hill so take a light jacket
Name: Garuda Wisnu Kencana Cultural Park

Review: our first stop was the gwk cultural park it is the number one cultural icon in bali the garuda wisnu kencana statue is designed to be one of the worlds largest and highest monumental statue in the world
Name: Garuda Wisnu Kencana Cultural Park

Review: i still have mixed feelings about this place there was not much to see and the ticket should really include going to the top of the tower as views were not that great from most areas of the park the cultural shows were good but the entrance should be before the amphitheatre so it is easy to access once you are in the park on the way out they put on an invisible mark incase you wanted to come back in after shows the free drink is over the road a the posher restaurant check the mame on the ticket
Name: Garuda Wisnu Kencana Cultural Park

Review: we spotted the garuda from our hotel and whilst walking on jimbaran beach and decided to take a closer look as part of a privately organised tour entrance fees seemed a little high initially but after wed spent  minutes looking at the garuda the lotus garden and other statues we felt it was educational worthwhile and money well spent the balinese dance show at the amphitheater is an obvious tourist attraction but was really enjoyable and you can have your picture taken with the dancers at the end watch out for a timeshare type of scam just before you enter the attraction they offer rewards including a free holiday if you attend a presentation at a hotel
Name: Garuda Wisnu Kencana Cultural Park

Review: entrance  is not less for a cultural place where many things are still in project the theater with the traditional dances are interesting and the statue is also impressive other services are not free of charge only shuttle service is for free nice place to spend  hours included with family
Name: Garuda Wisnu Kencana Cultural Park

Review: dont expect the same kind of experience you get when visiting an ancient place large park with impressive statues and interesting corners you either walk up the entire way or take a buggy car shuttle service  recommended especially in high sessiondidnt do the gwk statue tour just walked around the area and enjoyed the surroundingsgetting to know the history was interesting as well
Name: Garuda Wisnu Kencana Cultural Park

Review: we liked this place fantastic statues and nice surroundings had a glass at a nice restaurant with a great view
Name: Garuda Wisnu Kencana Cultural Park

Review: if you have the budget and dont like uphill walking take every shuttle they offer go early  stay late even after dark to enjoy the lighting everywhere weekends are the most crowded dont be in a hurry and expect long lines but shorter than disneyland do it up right including the trip up halfway to the top  plan on spending around  each including eats go in the dry season between may and september speaking english is no problem but keep it simple do your homework online before going find out as much as you can up front  you will appreciate your time in the park all the more
Name: Garuda Wisnu Kencana Cultural Park

Review: just another one of balis way of taking advantage of the tourists the park had an expensive entrance fee you could handle if the organization and knowledge of the workers were visible we were given the wrong entrance ticket and had to argue with them to make good we spent more time getting the ticket straightened out then we were in the park you can see all the cultural highlights other places therefore not necessary to visit
Name: Garuda Wisnu Kencana Cultural Park

Review: the entrance fee is expensive the shuttle bus from parking to the entrance site is unorganised there is no official staff who manages the queue there is no clear queue barrier so people just cut in lineaside from that the garuda wisnu kencana statue is impressively beautiful
Name: Garuda Wisnu Kencana Cultural Park

Review: we visited the gwk on a short day trip it is a very beautiful site with helpful staff and well worth a visit the show in the auditorium was amazing and authentic
Name: Garuda Wisnu Kencana Cultural Park

Review: gwk cultural park id intended to educate especially the young generations about the importance of preserving and cultivating worlds cultural heritage gwk or garuda wisnu kencana is a name for vishnu hindu god who rides his mystical half man and half bird companion known as garuda gwk is a great creation of renowned balinese artist i nyoman nuarta
Name: Garuda Wisnu Kencana Cultural Park

Review: the sheer scale of gwk is impressive but the site is very touristy but still worth a visit there are a number of smaller status through the complex but there is no doubt as to what commands your attention
Name: Garuda Wisnu Kencana Cultural Park

Review: while this might have felt a bit like disneyland it was a nice experience first of all there was a short wait for the shuttle buses and there were a lot of people here however it really doesnt feel over crowded once inside if you enjoy walking this is for you i would say expect to stay at least  minutes here some really impressive statues and even watched some dancing my daughter was pulled up on stage i didnt like that they wanted an additional fee to get up to the top of the statue after paying an admission fee i bought gelato instead next to the elevators
Name: Garuda Wisnu Kencana Cultural Park

Review: visited the big garuda which is visible from most spots in baliit is worth the  aud to travel to the top of this gigantic building the history of how it was built is worth hearing amazing the only downfall is that if you are over  they wont let you travel to the top in case you get dizzy it took a lot of convincing to let us  fit over s travel to the top  no dizziness no different than being in any tall building although there are a few spots of glass flooring so that you can see the construction below because it is so dark you cant see enough to make anyone dizzy well worth a visit
Name: Garuda Wisnu Kencana Cultural Park

Review: a fascinating introduction to the history  culture of the balinese people be prepared for plenty of walking but its certainy worth it
Name: Garuda Wisnu Kencana Cultural Park

Review: this might be illegal but if you have a chance fly a drone there the view is just amazing very nice and quiet place to just relax
Name: Garuda Wisnu Kencana Cultural Park

Review: this cultural park is recommended but need more improvement please add more chairsseats for peopledrivers who are waiting for their guests at the parking area need more shuttle bus so the guests dont have to queue for long time
Name: Garuda Wisnu Kencana Cultural Park

Review: amazing monument of the ruler of the world lord vishnu who is one amongst the three iebramha vishnu mahesh three but one the creator the caretaker and the destroyereverybody present in this world be it anyone existing in this world has to go thru this cycle to end up where you came fromtherefore this tall statue of the lord reminds you that you dont have to forget the vishnu who is taking care of you while you exist in this worldan amazing statue which reminds you of the god the rulercome here to bow and thank him for making you what you are and thank the mentora must must place when you are in uluwatu
Name: Garuda Wisnu Kencana Cultural Park

Review: this is fantastic not quite finished yet but if all the projected plans are finalized it will be an amazing sight cant wait to return and see the finished product well worth a visit now and in the future
Name: Garuda Wisnu Kencana Cultural Park

Review: we visited as we were passing by with our driver so thought why not it was quite expensive considering we were probably only there for about  hour we didnt even bother walking all the way to the gwk statue didnt expect to see other statues so that made it a bit more interesting
Name: Garuda Wisnu Kencana Cultural Park

Review: i was severely disappointed with the entrance to the park was organised we wished to visit the statue before we headed for the airport for our flight and allocated sufficient time to be able to go up and see the statue and be back to avoid traffic delaysupon buying our tickets which were non refundable we had to wait  minutes or so to enter the park due to maintenance issues and was provided no indication of when this would be addressed given the time constraints we also bought one way only option tickets to the shuttle bus service to take us up faster than walking this was another disappointment as it only operated till pm which is odd given the park was open till late we still had to wait with no information on timeframes and unfortunately had to leave without entering the parkvery disappointed i did not get to see the statue it would have been much better if everything was organised especially with the shuttle bus service operating hours and informing us of the rationale behind the maintainence delays which did not allow us to enter the parkwe would not have wasted money on tickets had we known there was maintenance issues delaying entrance i find it very dishonest that the ticket counter would not inform us of this
Name: Garuda Wisnu Kencana Cultural Park

Review: this is definitely a tourist trap you arrive and are asked to pay entrance which is fine then you get to the statue and are forced to pay again to take a  min guided tour to explain the construction process etc for an additional you cannot hi up the statue on your own then the cherry on the top is youre not allowed to take photos when you go into the statue whats the point the view is supposedly breathtaking but you cannot capture it staff is also not proficient in english and the whole process is tedious not worth it
Name: Garuda Wisnu Kencana Cultural Park

Review: good place to visit and spend hrs charming garden however do not expect any decent guide or headset or even a note to share the story of the place extremely poor organization also similarly to many places in bali expect to pay extra to see or do anything especially if you want to go up the statue nothing was mentioned at the ticketing area sight
Name: Garuda Wisnu Kencana Cultural Park

Review: excellent place to visit to look at the holy place with a divine culture of bali inside the gwk cultural park
Name: Garuda Wisnu Kencana Cultural Park

Review: excellent attractions a mammoth statue which is both a spiritual attractions as well as tourist attractions
Name: Garuda Wisnu Kencana Cultural Park

Review: right from the start when the red shuttle vehicle has to queue with the exiting motor vehicles from the car park you realise this gig hasnt been well thought outwhy is there a man with a red flag directing traffic in and out of the one vehicle gate on a rough road open it up get cars movingticket in hand we got up to the base only to realise they want another  to go up we did not see anyone queuing to go up and neither of the  tour groups during our time had bothered going upmy suggestion streamline and simplify your operation  ticket which includes going up inside at a more affordable price
Name: Garuda Wisnu Kencana Cultural Park

Review: we have made many trips here from the early days when bits and pieces of the statue could be found all around the parkwe visited two weeks ago looking forward to finally seeing the finished statuethe statue is truly awesome totally dominating your view as you walk up to the basewe were tossing up whether to cough up the extra rp per person for the trip up inside the statuethe decision was made easy when we were informed of the rules people over  not allowed children under  not allowed personal cameras phones etc not allowed if you want photos taken from balis best viewing platform you pay extra the trip up in the lift was part of a  minute guided tourour family party of six had two over s and two under snone of us really felt like walking round behind a guide listening to information which is freely available elsewheremost of the groups we encountered had kids and oldies our observations suggested that about half of the visitors would be excluded from the full tour seems a very shortsighted approach by the management of the park maybe they would like us to spend our rpm on some other cultural activity  like waterbom
Name: Garuda Wisnu Kencana Cultural Park

Review: good looking and great place still under contruction for another destination free shuttle bus from parking area
Name: Garuda Wisnu Kencana Cultural Park

Review: there are not many theme parks in south bali so gwk is a nice activity you can spend half a day there mixing visits of the park and watching the various shows in the amphitheatre overall the k entrance fee is reasonable considering the shows we get to watch the statues and the venue in general are impressive i would definitely recommend the place many things are extra once you enter but they are not necessary no need to go up the statue no need to take their extra transport to the statue
Name: Garuda Wisnu Kencana Cultural Park

Review: disappointing from start to finish sad to say that this is a bad tourist trap we expected the expensive entrance fee would cover you going up to the top of the statue but to our disbelief it doesnt the first part is walking through the park of which you see a couple of other statues and then you walk up a hill and you come to the gwk it is huge but why should we pay more to go up we were there for literally half an hour before we left
Name: Garuda Wisnu Kencana Cultural Park

Review: i went to gwk park without any expectation when i stepped into the park i was totally stunned its a huge place with the mysterious garuda bird man on the top of a huge mountain many other hindu religious status are around as well highly recommended
Name: Garuda Wisnu Kencana Cultural Park

Review: cant remember if i paid for parking if yes its between idrk for bikeentrance fee is idrpax which includes a free welcome drink a souvenier which is like a thin scarf for blindfold  access to cultural show and animated film should you require the shuttle to gwk statue its additional idrpaxthere is no need to take the shuttle its really not that far of a walk  only take it if you are physcially unfit and inconvenient to walkyou have to go down the stairs to get to the ticket counter then come back up and walk towards right for the entrancebefore you scan your ticket on the right make sure you head to the restaurant on the left first because the complimentary welcome drink is at the restaurant there however we made the mistake and scan the ticket and could not come back out we did the cultural show first was about  hour its pretty interesting to see we stayed and watched the whole thing theres chance to take pictures with the cast at the end of it i didnt do thatthe park looks really huge but when you actually start walking and checking out the statues you realize you cover the areas pretty fast of course the park is filled with tourist you can also rent bicycles to ride up to gwk statue and around the bicycle area you cant ride everywhere there are stairs before you arrive at the bicycle area so i dont really see a point in renting a biketheres fooddrink trucks area we got a juice and milo its expensive bring your own bottled drink if you want to save money and the way the juice is prepared is pretty disgusting the table is in front of the truck orange not washed cut in half and immediately put on the squeezer we continued walking and arrived at the gwk statue its huge but you cannot get anywhere near it because you would need to pay an additional idrpax for a tour up the statue im not paying that much for a statue for we did not do the touri think idrpax is pretty decent to pay for the humongous statues and cultural shows you should defintely check it out at least once
Name: Garuda Wisnu Kencana Cultural Park

Review: this place has many attraction to see like a balinese dance performance souvenir soup that selling balinese handy craft and etcnot only that the biggest wisnu statue is located here garuda wisnu the complete name of the statue is one the biggest statue in the world
Name: Garuda Wisnu Kencana Cultural Park

Review: we were dropped off by our hotel on a shuttle run and that was a huge mistake you buy your ticket for  each or  if senior if you are prepared to walk up hill for twenty minutes ok if not another  to go by shuttle you reach the top where the statue is and walk into building then to find out it will cost you another  for the tour into the statue once done catch the shuttle down but only half way down you then have opportunity to look at the cultural park a lot lf nothing then a ten minute walk back to start the best way to see the statue is by taxi or tour where they will wait for you otherwise their is no other transport available we rang for bluebird taxi twice waited two hours no taxi came we would have been in serious trouble if another driver didnt offer to drop us back to a shopping centre where we got a taxi back to the hotel it is not worth the effort or the money
Name: Garuda Wisnu Kencana Cultural Park

Review: dont waste your time and money they charge you  aud to get in then they dont tell you the buggie ride to the statue is extra per person then theres an extra charge to catch the lift and do the tour it would be good if they tell you all the information up front the statue is cool but you can see it from any where
Name: Garuda Wisnu Kencana Cultural Park

Review: the cultural park itself is amazing as are the structures it would be nice if you were given a bit more information about the various structures and what they represent
Name: Garuda Wisnu Kencana Cultural Park

Review: a very impressive set upbut not for young children or those that dont walk to walk for milesapprox aud to enter theres a cinema experience to tell you the gwk story then its a huge walk through the cultural centre lots of stairs to contented with the walk from the gate to the cultural centre is about mtrs we had a yr old with us and were told shed be fineno way simply to much for her little legs but kids under mtrs are freeplenty of shops and food areasremember this is a cultural place and a place of worship so you will be required to cover up no bikinis singlets etc  there are sarongs available for free whilst touring the gwk area
Name: Garuda Wisnu Kencana Cultural Park

Review: th tallest statue in the world taken  yrs to build been watching the progress over the year expensive for what it is  not very well organised entrance fee approx  then to go to the viewing gallery another  didnt go to viewing gallery as the wait was over  hours
Name: Garuda Wisnu Kencana Cultural Park

Review: only one reason to visit is the vishnu statue its the tallest hindu statue in the world rest there is nothing much to see at k idr its a bit expensive entry fees
Name: Garuda Wisnu Kencana Cultural Park

Review: i recommend to visit this place for half day after lunch there are some shows performed hourly and the latest show is kecak dance not as good as in pura uluwatu but still a great show you can also enjoy the sunset from here the admission fee is k rupiah for adult but you need to pay again k for a ride into the statue the complex is very wide you can also walk by yourself or rent a bike for k not recommended because the road is hilly what disappointing us is we must pay another k for the lift inside the statue overall it is a good place to chill around on afternoon towards evening
Name: Garuda Wisnu Kencana Cultural Park

Review: i decided to visit gwk today and have to say the place is beautiful and a marvel in what they have built butim very disappointed in the operation in the pricing and the clarity of the pricing and information firstly you pay  per person to get in which i was expecting to be able to go up and see the temple and then walk around inside this was not the case once i had paid my park admission and went to the statue i then had to pay another  per person to be able to walk around inside this too me was crazy and was not clear from the beginning the queue lines are very disorganised as well as the busses and transport services considering how hot it is there there was  us including  small children and we paid over  to get a look basicallyi will not be going back again
Name: Garuda Wisnu Kencana Cultural Park

Review: this park have the th biggest sculpture on the world it was amazing to be so close to it the entire venue is so beautiful a sight not to be missed when you visit bali do visit this place when uou in bali we loved the play at the theatre and the restaurants had lovely food that we enjoyed after our lonh tour at this park
Name: Garuda Wisnu Kencana Cultural Park

Review: great view to take pictures with friends and family and this place has just been completed in  location near jimbaran from kuta around  minutesticket price rp  person
Name: Garuda Wisnu Kencana Cultural Park

Review: this statue is impressive however you have to pay to enter park and then pay to go up the statue it cost  rp per person to enter park and  rp per person to go up you can catch the free shuttle from car park to enterance to park you can also pay an extra  rp to catch golf cart to statue  i recommend this the walk back to shuttle pick up is easier you are best to hire driver for the day and include this in your day as it is easier to have driver waiting for you when your finished rather than trying to find taxi or grab
Name: Garuda Wisnu Kencana Cultural Park

Review: what a truely beautiful place not quite finished yet but if the displays of future plans are anything to go by it wil be wonderful the statues are enormous and can be seen from the beach in seminyak cant wait to revisit when its all done
Name: Garuda Wisnu Kencana Cultural Park

Review: ive read some of the other reviews from other visitors and as a consequence have given this a  star rating it really annoys me when people go to a developing country and rate them compared to a st world country usually where they come from  because they can afford it then whinge about how much it costs i think it was about  nz which   coffeesanyway rant overat least half a day is needed to mooch around the park which is still in progress the main centre piece is very impressive and is taller than the statue of liberty i saw it from the plane when coming in to landi was equally impressed by the massive and i mean massive earthworks that have been done to create the passageways between the  metre tall hillsthere is a fab area with a group of vw combi vans selling various snacks and food of great qualitytaste and a very reasonable priceyou can hire segways and bicycles if you fancy or just jump in a taxi a golf cart type thing i prefered to walk but its good to bear in mind if your less than fit or senior in agebe sure to get to the actual garudavishna monument before pm as if you are later it may not be possible for you to climb the huge amount of stairs to get an awesome viewi was also fortunate to catch a live dance interpretation of the story behind vishna and garuda in the amphitheatre at about pm i think  check for the time this was included in the entrance fee oh plus a free drink from the bar near the theatreexpensive my ass
Name: Garuda Wisnu Kencana Cultural Park

Review: after seeing the monument on the horizon i wanted to visit the park the work they have done on this old quarry so far is very impressive we are glad we went to have a look but would have preferred them to be open about it not being finished yet you can not go up inside it at all only inside the ground floor lobby where there are many pictures of whats to come next there is  lift wells ate the end of the lobby that are boarded up or closed there is a lot more work to be done based on their own photos within the base of the statue
Name: Garuda Wisnu Kencana Cultural Park

Review: we watched gwk being constructed over several years from our hotel so this trip we visited it is an amazing structure and a close up view is a must the cultural park provides a very educational history through dance and printed information there is plenty to see and do in the park plus a restaurant  shopping i recommend spending at least half a day here to take advantage of all the cultural park has to offer
Name: Garuda Wisnu Kencana Cultural Park

Review: a large brass sculpture that is worth seeing up close still fairy new and lacking many touristy ttractions it is worth seeing the statue just for its sixe
Name: Garuda Wisnu Kencana Cultural Park

Review: i find the entrance fee to be very expensive and overrated yes while the  structures are magnificently built but it doesnt warrant that entrance fee could have gone to better places and put money to be use still a lot of construction and beautification works to be done sad for such commercialism
Name: Garuda Wisnu Kencana Cultural Park

Review: it is a very big statue of vishnu on garuda the park is good and you have to walk so long to reach the big statue there are so many shops in between this is the statue one will be attracted from the flight during landing when we visited there are some works going on so we were not allowed to go up to the view point
Name: Garuda Wisnu Kencana Cultural Park

Review: you should visit another place in bali here very terrible only money trap very expensive for bali  australian dollar only for rubbish
Name: Garuda Wisnu Kencana Cultural Park

Review: garuda wisnu kencana cultural park is a must visit place in baliwell organized parkshuttles available from parking to entrancesmall cart available with some extra charges from entrance to main statue which is helpful for elderly people meters tall state of lord vishnu with garudath tallest statue in the world which you can see even from airport or flighttraditional balinese dance shows free insiderestaurants and shopping center available insidelarge area so some elderly may find it tiring but worth visiting
Name: Garuda Wisnu Kencana Cultural Park
