Review: this beach is located in one direction with sade village kuta beach and the beach mawun to access this beach road is narrow and winding beach is very clean white sand and natural
Name: Tanjung Aan Beach

Review: so nice being herei was with my  and  yo boys who loved this beach the sand is soft and the water is clearwe went snorkling and swimming i wasnt worry much about their safety because the beach has low tides and shallow in depth food was available here as well as toilets to clean yourself withyou can rent local boats for beach hopping since this beach is in the same area with seger and kuta beach
Name: Tanjung Aan Beach

Review: the beach is amazing but beware of the seller on the beach they can be quiet pushy south lombok is really great for beach hoping there are too many beautiful beach that are quiet and tranquil
Name: Tanjung Aan Beach

Review: i visited this place at around  pm and i found this beach is too ordinary when conpared with the other beaches at lombok i think tanjung aan doesnt have an unique or typical scenery
Name: Tanjung Aan Beach

Review: naturally it is a good reason to visit this beach if you want to visit this beach in nearest time you may well imagine the beach in bali in the s very natural with no hotels or restaurants around the beach its location is a bit far from the mataram or senggigithere is no public transportation to this beach you can rent a motorbike or rent a car to go
Name: Tanjung Aan Beach

Review: i visited tanjung aan beach on saturday  jun  with familythis beach is near to kuta beach lombokwhen we arrived with car we must pay for parking fee  rp many people visited this beach and we can see some foreign visitors passed this area with motorcyclewe can also play swing at the beachrecommended to visit and play at this beach with white sands
Name: Tanjung Aan Beach

Review: white sandy and quite beach view was very stunning and friendly waves perfect beach local kids always try to sell you some souvenir hehehe
Name: Tanjung Aan Beach

Review: years ago we love to came here and we are the only one on the beach to enjoy the serenitythe beauty of the beach landscape the sounds of the wind the nice sand pepper on your feetnowadays the place packed with tourist buses and rude local vendorwe are not able to just sit  relax and read the books anymore every minutes there is someone tried to force you buying something  even we tried to ignore them we got a rude attitude from a local vendors who screamed at us and called us poor and cheap touristactually when the beach get known by more people it is good to increase the tourism section of this island unfortunately is not prepared with a better education to locals and management from the governmentthe beach getting dirty with many trash sad so sadhopefully will get better soon
Name: Tanjung Aan Beach

Review: reached this tanjung aan in the afternoon waves so friendly and people able to swim around the white sandy beach with the blue sky and green hills around makes great color and view as you can see there are several hills surround the beach many people visit this beach especially in the afternoon because they can enjoying sunset on the hills named bukit merese and the way to reached top of the hills are quite sloping but still safe i think this beach is good when sun rises instead of sunset
Name: Tanjung Aan Beach

Review: a quite and deserted beach a bit remote to get there but once you arrived no words could express the view be prepare to be bothered by the local either children and adults the children sold bottles of white sand and could also help you out to take some pictures they will ask you or perhaps will force you to give them tip dont be too generous though
Name: Tanjung Aan Beach

Review: love love love the hillsspeechless no word can describe how beautiful the view waswe join sunset tour from novotel kuta lombokand the tour guide took us to to top of the hill to see sunset and all the amazing viewsuper duper recommended place must go in lombok
Name: Tanjung Aan Beach

Review: once you are at tanjung aan beach please please please get ourselves on top of bukit mereseyou need to climb a bit but everything went away as you reach on top of it its so superbly beautiful picturesque and mesmerizingbest time to go early morning or just before sunset get local peopleguide to bring you herethe only thing is that the earlier path going up the hill  really needs improvement for easier access
Name: Tanjung Aan Beach

Review: the beach is beautiful clean and crystal clear in order to reach this place you need to use taxi and rent car as the place quite remote it will takes about more than  hour from sengigi area to reach this placehowever it worth it
Name: Tanjung Aan Beach

Review: i visited tanjung aan in mid april  the beach is so pretty you can see batu payung island meresek hill and other kuta beachfronts when youre standing in the shore the sands are so white and the sea water is so blue this good contrast is one of the attracted things if you want to go to batu payung island people in there offer speedboatfishers boat from the beach to cross the sea and reach the isle they also rent snorkels canoes and other watersport utilities me personally enchanta the vibes
Name: Tanjung Aan Beach

Review: the best in lombok according to the guide they can make it better by having proper food court nearby kids beggars are aplenty
Name: Tanjung Aan Beach

Review: this was really a flying visit the sand is even whiter than the mawaun but is covered in seaweed there are several sections to the beach and the section we went to had a port where motorised slow boats took passengers to an umbrella island where the water has worn out the sides of a doomed land mass to make an umbrella shape there were also a swing which made for interesting photos also there was a row of stands selling jewellery scarves etc
Name: Tanjung Aan Beach

Review: this is truly and really beautiful i dont think many people know about this place it is so quiet clean but beautiful would be good for honeymoon or as a place for run away from the crowd however the location is far it was a long trip around an hour maybe from kuta lombok beach again it is worth it and recommended if you are a beach lover and look for nice and quiet place however the weakness is the facilities are poor i didnt see any public toilet no restaurants you better bring your own food and drink if you want to come here im not sure about accommodation as i didnt see any accomodation bear by the beach
Name: Tanjung Aan Beach

Review: one of the best beaches we have seen visited warung turtle for a drink nice people there and there were only a few people at the beach so its really relaxing
Name: Tanjung Aan Beach

Review: very amazing view we dont need any camera filter to get the best view we can find any photography spot everywhere
Name: Tanjung Aan Beach

Review: take a driver to tanjung aan about  minutes before sunset and join the many people to experience this breathtaking view
Name: Tanjung Aan Beach

Review: beach tends to be rocky we didnt get to swimhowever surrounding is beautifulone should make an attempt to climb one of the hillswe made it up to bukit merese the climb was great and the view up there was gorgeous you can have a peak of the setting sun from there
Name: Tanjung Aan Beach

Review: we stopped at tanjung aan on the way back to the airport from our stay in gili layarit was a beautiful beachwhite powdery sandy beach with turqoise colour oceanpicture perfect i must say
Name: Tanjung Aan Beach

Review: beautiful little beach that actually stretches over a river mouth that must flow out to the sea occasionally you can walk a long distance needs to be nearly high tide to swim you can hire a boat and snorkelling gear to get out to a reef to snorkel on i think i prefer still waters there is a lot of actual surf out the outside heads and thats where it looks like the boats go there are two swings constructed on the beach and in the water to play with we saw a herd of buffalo being guided down to the beach usual dogs and shaded seating areas and of course pay rp for parking bikes usual locals selling coconuts and hassling you to buy tshirts and sarongs etc there is turtle warung amp the beach and samasama cafe dis not go to them there were a lot of people walking and riding motocross bikes on top of the hill beside the beach worth a look and swim
Name: Tanjung Aan Beach

Review: this is one of the most famous beach in lombok located near kuta beach and novotel if you do beach hopping in lombok this is a must visit beachthe sands is white and the sea is very blue there is a small hill and hike it to see the best view of tanjung aan beach
Name: Tanjung Aan Beach

Review: cant be describe this location thats so very warm n cool scenery whitely sand mix with the greatfulls ambience u know that visitors can be back again in tanjung aan
Name: Tanjung Aan Beach

Review: easy to find if you are staying in kuta its like km easy ride by bike roads are little bit rough at aome points just take it slow and you will be fine the last thing you want being stranded under a sizzling sun with punctured tyrenormally you have to pay for every beach around here its a pocket change you may park in shade and guys will watch out for your bikelong sandy beach with warm wather will surely not leave you disappointedtheres plenty of vendors around selling refeshments and local food never mind pushy kids and women selling sarongs and braceletsgood beach but be prepared to deal with heat
Name: Tanjung Aan Beach

Review: this is probably the best beach around for swimming wide strip of white sand cristal clear waterfor an amazing sunset just climb the hill on the left the view on the beach itself and surrounding bays is breathtaking
Name: Tanjung Aan Beach

Review: the beach is quite crowded because we visit on weekend they had family day goin on that daythis beach is a must visit in lombok we hiked the hill and enjoy panoramic view suitable for photography just that it was cloudy how i wish more sunshine to get better photos capturedwe can see herd of cows and goats also enjoy their time here uphill we can spend about  hours here for relaxation everybody must come and bring your picnic mat plan a romantic beach picnic and also swimmingthere are also some locals try selling their stuffs they sometimes can be a bit pushy but thats okay we really had great time here at tanjung aantips batu payung is accessible from here with some fees but we didnt plan to go
Name: Tanjung Aan Beach

Review: we have to walk for an hour to reach this huge waterfall and there was a rainbow below the waterfall there the first time ive seen a rainbow upclose i dont know its even possible to happen the waterfall itself is beautiful but sadly we cant swim in there
Name: Sendang Gile and Tiu Kelep Waterfall

Review: awesome experience and adventure with a local guide named rival went through the jungle and ended up at the beautiful waterfall
Name: Sendang Gile and Tiu Kelep Waterfall

Review: for the picture purposes this place is unbeatable but you can not swim in it well you can if you insist but overall great experiences its hidden and have to do a long walk from the main entrance
Name: Sendang Gile and Tiu Kelep Waterfall

Review: short walk to sindeng gile with clean waterfall more interesting walk to a lava soil filled tiu kelep waterfallguide is not necessary but good to have guide for the tiu kelep waterfall to explain the area and help take photos of the grouphave seen better waterfalls though
Name: Sendang Gile and Tiu Kelep Waterfall

Review: there is no entry fee to these waterfalls however be warned that there are many locals asking for a fee to be your guide there is no need for a guide at all especially the first sendang gile waterfall there are stone steps all throughout and its fairly easy to get to it on your own there is only one direction down the steps get steep in some areas when you climb back up so if your elderly or have difficulty you can just slow it down when we arrived our driver brought us to the locals who were asking for  rupiah to take us to the  waterfalls we were shocked as we read that they were free entry they said all kinds of things such as dangerous animals will get lost etc we finally agreed for around  as they said tiu kelep is difficult to find when we went there were so many tourists and none of them had a guide sendang gile is straight down about min tiu kelep is not its about min more and you do have to go through some ankle deep water but if your experienced this will also not be anything to you the waterfalls themselves were lovely and if you like nature and hiking then you will want to visit these just dont get sucked into locals trying to make money off you
Name: Sendang Gile and Tiu Kelep Waterfall

Review: no need for a guide as long as you are healthy and relatively fit you do not need a guide to take you to explore the waterfalls smile nicely at the guides waiting at the top of the steps pay the  entrance fee but a coffee from the refreshment place and set off on your walk
Name: Sendang Gile and Tiu Kelep Waterfall

Review: great little walk needed a guide for peace of mind but could do without saw a huge lizard on the way which was awesome definitely a must do
Name: Sendang Gile and Tiu Kelep Waterfall

Review: was a bit disappointed as the guy we booked with mohammed told us it was only a  minute walk to the waterfall when in fact it was more like  minutes there is nowhere to swim in this waterfall you can stand near it and get wet from the spray but that is all also lots of steps to climb on the way out we didnt go to the second waterfall as that was another minutes further on and apparently during the earthquake rocks have fallen into the pool thus making a very small pool to swim in there are other waterfalls on lombok that you can swim in  go to those instead ps i have a bad ankle that is why the walking was an issue
Name: Sendang Gile and Tiu Kelep Waterfall

Review: sedang gile is the easiest waterfall to be reached just walk down the stairs you can see the glimpse of water keep walking down you will reach the waterfall it is so prettytiu kelep is not easy to access due to some ruins after the earthquake assisting by tour guide is recommended if you plan to visit tiu kelep due the damage path
Name: Sendang Gile and Tiu Kelep Waterfall

Review: my wife and i thought it would be nice to go see the waterfalls it took about  ish maybe a bit more by car from senggigi to get to the waterfallswe arrived at the drop off which was at a restaurant before the walk to the waterfalls the view from the restaurant was incredible very picturesque we hired a local guide to take us to the falls we like our guide it was great to have someone to ask questions to and his english was goodit took us about  mins to get to the first small waterfall it was ok a nice place to take a few pictures then we went to the other main waterfall it took us about mins to get there make sure you wear closed in shoes sneakers or something not slip on beach shoesthere was an earthquake in august  and it was quite bad the path to the falls has clearly been impacted in certain areas and be had to do a bit of climbing and balancing over rocks logs etc it was a little bit of an obstacle course in placeswe arrived at the falls it was nice but for the amount of time it took to get there we didnt feel it was worth it there has clearly been some damage made from the earthquake and the pool at the bottom of the fall in full of rocks that came downif youve never seen a waterfall before then you might like it but if you have seen some else where in the world tasmania north western australia new zealand etc etc then you might will be a bit disappointed and underwhelmedwe personally wouldnt recommended it
Name: Sendang Gile and Tiu Kelep Waterfall

Review: we visited here on a day tour with our driver who had prearranged a guide which was great as it feels great to support the local community as we they are rebuilding after the earthquake beautiful lush surrounding we seen a monkey and felt like an adventure making our way over logs and rocks recommend moderate level of fitness as there are stairs on the way back up we did the trek in jandals and totally fine
Name: Sendang Gile and Tiu Kelep Waterfall

Review: we went here in the morning at about am and had an amazing time we spent a few hours here the waterfalls are so powerful and it was incredible to get so close i am not sure what people are talking about when they say entrance fee scam we walked to these falls which is about  mins from our hotel we got to an official looking entrance which said  rupees per person there is talk of some fake entrance but im not sure what people are complaining about we were not bothered by anyone and the route was straight forward to follow we were able to enjoy everything at our own pace perhaps some people are just easily led my advise in indonesia is if people are aggressive or forceful in selling you something it is because they are just trying to make money and you just need to ignore them these falls were definitely a big highlight of our trip and should not be missed if you are in the area
Name: Sendang Gile and Tiu Kelep Waterfall

Review: the water fall is really good right to the place people do really keep an eye about their clean so its good attraction to do in lombok to see more about tropical and forest inhabitants
Name: Sendang Gile and Tiu Kelep Waterfall

Review: fantastic day trip great guide and driverthe total hike takes about  hours to and from the falls difficult terrain in some parts but relatively easy for most people the falls are spectacular and we saw both black and grey monkeys and lots of birds the only downside is there is quite a bit of plastic and rubbish around on some parts of the trail which take away from the beauty of the jungle
Name: Sendang Gile and Tiu Kelep Waterfall

Review: visited the two falls good hike just under km there and back different terrain to walk on big drop off side enjoyed it
Name: Sendang Gile and Tiu Kelep Waterfall

Review: we took a day trip from sengiggi and had read of scams on arrival so were well preparedour driver seemed nice on the  hr drive but then parked at a restaurant and told us when we got out that we must pay a guide to go to the fallsthere was a local man standing there and we told him we prepared to go on our own  then thn both got really angry and said we must paywe had no idea where to go so just walked away up the hill only to find an entrance and path about  metres on the left where you enterwe brushed aside more guides wanting money to escort us and went to the ticket windowto be fair we were told it was k to enter but the path was dangerous to the nd waterfall and we needed a guide we just paid the k and told him we would only go to  waterfallafter viewing that which was down a lot of steps and not very impressive we decided to take the path on the left on the way back up where everyone and their guides seemed to be going upwe spoke to several people coming back from the fall who also didnt have guides who said it was  mins up the riveryou can just follow the river until the end which is the fall but you have to go in it and climb rocks and logs its not hard tbh and a nice walk and scramblethe fall is well worth it much better than the first oneyou can follow the river or tag along behind other people with their guideyou dont need a guide but others have said to support the local peole who lost all their homes in the earthquake so if you feel generous get a guidewe didnt like the way the driver set us up as we had paid him a lot of money for the waterfall trip and resented paying more  he should of paid the guide imhoid say aound k for a guide is about right  not sure why it is per person as entrance is k eachmake your own choice but dont pay more than that
Name: Sendang Gile and Tiu Kelep Waterfall

Review: the afternoon before the trekking i went to see these two waterfalls with a guide it took less than  hours for both the water falls down strongly so you can enjoy the fresh bathing at the first waterfall for me the second one is more impressive the rainbow under is very very awesome
Name: Sendang Gile and Tiu Kelep Waterfall

Review: a nice short walk to both waterfalls m to the first and m to the second but would recommend a guide instead of venturing alone heading alone is fine as well but there are some parts of the path which could use some local guidance simply for safety reasons
Name: Sendang Gile and Tiu Kelep Waterfall

Review: first we passed the right entrance and came a little further on a parking lot where a guy tried to rip us off he said that the entrance was destroyed by the earthquake but the path was still intact he had no tickets but asked for money of course unfortunately other tourists believed him and paid him we were suspicious and searched for the entrance we missed the right entrance is the one with tickets and you dont have to pay for a parking ticket scooter hit the button if you find this useful thanks and enjoy
Name: Sendang Gile and Tiu Kelep Waterfall

Review: i went there with my husband and  yr old kid we had nice indonesian lunch just at a warung near the ticket counter the cost if ticket is  idr per person we took diding as our guide he was not only superb but offered to carry our baby throughout the treacherous terrain i paid  for three of usmore than what i promised simply because diding made us to the top with our toddler wear sturdy shoes waterproof back pack as you may get wet in the mist of the tiu kelep fall the hike is no doubt very much engaging amongst the volcanic rocks and water streams you will get great natural scenic views we also happened to see the  in the waterfall awesome nearly  hours ride in the car from sengiggi along a picturesque views of mountains meeting the oceanevery bit worth your time
Name: Sendang Gile and Tiu Kelep Waterfall

Review: these waterfalls are impressive and well worth a visit when entering we met local people offering to take us down to the waterfalls for  idr which were clearly a ripoff both are quite easy to access on your own just follow the signs from the main road and walk downwards to reach the smaller waterfall
Name: Sendang Gile and Tiu Kelep Waterfall

Review: do not eat at warung galang ijo it is located on the right side of the main road before the entrancegot ripped off menu on the wall do not have pricelist we ordered lalapan ayam bakso urapurap and  coconut water single portion each bill was pricey k idrguide quoted us k idr per person finally agreed on k idr for  of uswe did tiu kelep first challenging path through stream boulders from the last earthquake were everywhere waterfall was breathtakingsendang gile was next smaller but still interesting
Name: Sendang Gile and Tiu Kelep Waterfall

Review: this waterfalls are one of the best ive ever seen in my life you can check it out if you search for waterfall in lombok
Name: Sendang Gile and Tiu Kelep Waterfall

Review: we visited the sendang gile waterfall one day before climbing to mount rinjani this waterfall is truly amazing
Name: Sendang Gile and Tiu Kelep Waterfall

Review: went here after hike is the best you can chill here and take a bath on sendang gile but you can only see tiu kelep from afar btw i went to hike mtrinjani with rinjani foundation if you wondering
Name: Sendang Gile and Tiu Kelep Waterfall

Review: this is  to  minute walk away from the road you walk on a narrow path on the edge of a mountain then walk down about a hundred steps to the waterfall your efforts will be greatly rewarded a real must do the place was tranquil and picturesque it is safe for normally mobile people i would only take children who are obedient and can walk in a straight line as the track in areas is only a meter wide with a descent drop beyond the grass and shrubs
Name: Sendang Gile and Tiu Kelep Waterfall

Review: a decent drive from senggigi but definitely worth it we paid k for  people for the  hour drive there and back plus stopping at some sights on the wayyou dont need a guide but it helps the track to tiu kelep is damaged in a few spots and completely covered by landslides in some others id suggest sensible shoes but i saw people doing it in thongs just be aware some of the rocks are slippery and you will get wet if you get closea must do if youre visiting lombokpics show the landslides where the path used to be
Name: Sendang Gile and Tiu Kelep Waterfall

Review: this is by far the best waterfall ive ever seen in my entire life its so huge and its so raw just wow
Name: Sendang Gile and Tiu Kelep Waterfall

Review: it was beyond my expectation freakin love it i was so majestic you can see small rainbow there below the waterfall
Name: Sendang Gile and Tiu Kelep Waterfall

Review: we travelled from senggigi to check this outa little nervous after some of the recent post earthquake reviewsbased on advice we got a local guide and bartered down to k per personthe hike to the first waterfall is an easy  minute stroll down some stepssendang gile is nice you can take a shower in one of the many additional flows and get some nice photos theres a food stand toilets and seating and plenty of monkeys lacking in fear a little rubbish around as always seems to be the casea lot of reviews wildly exaggerate the additional walk to tiu kelep is  to  minutes at best not an hour if involves some shallow wading and scrambling over rocks and logs but is easy and low impact children can do it as could our guide in flip flopsthe waterfall is impressive but has been affected by the recent quake with no pool to swim in remaining i dont think youd want to either as low level rock falls still appear to happen with large rocks littering the path that would be bad news if they landed in your headour guide was friendly and engaging and i would recommend one just because the quickest and safest route to tiu kelep since the quake is unclear and not signposted the old route blocked by landslidesthe price is reasonable and i was more than happy to pay and leave an additional tip especially after hearing how the guides house was destroyed by the quake and he has been living in a tent and trying to rebuild his house whilst doing these tours to scrape by enough to live and eat the impact is particularly evident when you see the state of senaru which is like a ghost town with hotels reduced to rubble deserted trekking shops and abandoned restaurantsdont be put off be generous and support the area to get back on its feet while getting some moderate exercise and appreciating nature win win
Name: Sendang Gile and Tiu Kelep Waterfall

Review: tiu kelep is a powerful and raw waterfall you will definitely feel the true life of nature no food stands no trash at the waterfall it truly is one i will remember for a long time this one is less travelled than sendang gile which is also nice
Name: Sendang Gile and Tiu Kelep Waterfall

Review: sendang gile is really great one but continue to the tiu kelep its even more amazing this picture is from tiu kelep
Name: Sendang Gile and Tiu Kelep Waterfall

Review: we took a tour to these waterfalls and since the earthquake last year there is visible damage as trees have been uprooted and the path is a nice little hike the structure of the tiu kelep waterfall has changed as there is no longer a pool to bathe in at the bottom however it was absolutely amazing and i am glad that i had the chance to see it and i am assuming that we were the only ones there due to the fear of another earthquake i am glad that i had the opportunity to do it now because im the event of another earthquake who knows what will be left of this magnificent structure
Name: Sendang Gile and Tiu Kelep Waterfall

Review: we were told that the waterfalls and especially tio keleb are not recommended at the moment because of the damages the recent earthquake has caused but for some unexplainable reason we decided to go there anyway met a nice couple at our hotel who also wanted to go so we took their recommended local guide and went all together i would say especially now after the earthquake a guide is definitely needed the hike was ok and manageable even with a decent fitness level as mine it took a total of  hours for both waterfalls tiu keleb is my favorite so beautiful and graceful and yet very powerful our guides had told us that we really could just look at it and turn right back around which we did their uneasiness made us a bit nervous too in my opinion you should never underestimate the power and unpredictability of mother nature but if the waterfall is a bucket list item for you like it was for us its gonna be worth the nervousness and the subtle fear especially at the spot where the malaysian tourists and their guide were killed it literally turned my stomach around thats why we decided not to pose for any pix but just take the beauty of the nature in and got out as quickly as possible the entire trip was free but we decided to tip our guide well since he made it happen
Name: Sendang Gile and Tiu Kelep Waterfall

Review: our local guide has led us to the waterfall eddie  not far from the rice terraces quiet place
Name: Sendang Gile and Tiu Kelep Waterfall

Review: i only managed to visit one waterfalls but its a hell of a trip thanks rinjanifoundation well service
Name: Sendang Gile and Tiu Kelep Waterfall

Review: amazing waterfall ever in lombok this so great to visit as a soft fun trekkinglove itdo not forget to bring action cam
Name: Sendang Gile and Tiu Kelep Waterfall

Review: went there with a trekking company guide my jaw dropped after seeing tiu kelep waterfall very recommended
Name: Sendang Gile and Tiu Kelep Waterfall

Review: took a  hour car ride to reach the entrance of the waterfall in the national park we were greeted by a young guide who helped us with our towels it was a quick  easy walk down to sedang gile we walked all the way down to the pool below the waterfall the water was nice  refreshing continued with a mins track to tiu kelep the track was more challenging but still doable my  year old girl   year old mum did it with a little help from our guide all of us did not regret the effort taken to reach the fall the sight was majestic
Name: Sendang Gile and Tiu Kelep Waterfall

Review: the first waterfall is an easy short trek on the main path and is beautiful downside is the rubbish found on the trail tiu kelep the second waterfall requires you to go on a bit of an adventure crossing streams and over logs its fun our  year old had a ball and its well worth the effort tiu kelep and the surrounding jungle is breathtakingly beautiful she is powerful and majestic definitely one of the most amazing waterfalls we have ever seenin regards to the locals trying to scam you to pay to get in and for a guide it is out of control and needs policing you do not require a guide if you are fit and able however if you have young children i would recommend paying for one to help with the trek they are really good at taking care of the children ours did but bargain hard walking away normally gets them lowering there price quicklyi certainly dont mind paying to enter the national park or for a guide if i know the money wasnt a rip off and that some of the fee went back into education awareness and preservation of this natural wonder
Name: Sendang Gile and Tiu Kelep Waterfall

Review: it is good to combine these with a trek to rinjaniplease make sure you bring good shoes the first waterfall can be reached easily the second one you have to go through deep water and it is quite an adventurous hike if you do not expect it from the first to the second waterfall it is more than  minutes hiking
Name: Sendang Gile and Tiu Kelep Waterfall

Review: our trip from mangsit at the resort where we were staying to the waterfalls and back took the whole daywhen we got to the national park entrance we stopped at the neighboring restaurant for lunch and had a nice meal with a beautiful view of some rice terraces in the distance as well as a mountain ridge with some waterfalls across the wayafter lunch we met our guide our driver introduced us and his friend they were very friendly and made our experience of the waterfalls much more enjoyable the reviewers saying you dont need a guide may have originally been correct but since the earthquakes in august  the way to the second waterfall tiu kelep is a lot trickier to navigate and involves climbing over fallen trees crossing the stream and up and down a few steep hills created by landslides it made getting to the waterfall that much more satisfying and it was beautiful with the pool of water at the base of the waterfall being quite nice to swim in we did not end up swimming that day and headed back after taking some pictures tiu kelep is well worth the effort but definitely requires a guide if youre timing is good you could follow another group with a guide but this is a little bit dishonest whether or not a guide is mandatory as some have claimed i believe it is nice to support the local community the guides dont charge much anyway and after you see the devastation the earthquake has caused on the drive up how could you not want to do something however small to help the area recoverits uncertain when they will be able to fix the path to the second waterfall but until then you have to be in decent enough shape for the obstacles in the way the guides will assist by helping you carry your things and hold your hand while jumping down from rocks or crossing the moving stream which is yet another reason to have them therein all with driving guide and entrance fee the experience cost us about k ruppiah for  people well worth it and i look forward to coming back one day i wish lombok a speedy recovery in the meantime
Name: Sendang Gile and Tiu Kelep Waterfall

Review: a small hike leads you to these two lovely waterfalls scenic place probably good for a picnic if you have enough time
Name: Sendang Gile and Tiu Kelep Waterfall

Review: so youve gotten dropped off at lomboks new international airport and you want a place to stay so you decide to go to central sengiggi there are many things that lombok boasts from lovely clear beaches to mountainous terrain there is one place that you should go and that is the waterfalls at the base of rinjani lomboks volcano in the northern part of lombokthere are two waterfalls that are accessible from a gangway at the entry costing around  aud for  tickets sendang gile  tiu are easy to get to walk through the self guided paths built against the mountain and follow it youll come to a junction one way left goes to sendang gile and the other right goes to tiusendang is easy to access as the main path leads to the first waterfall at the end of the path youll find small stalls selling food and a little walk off if you want to take a shower sendang is a moderately sized waterfall falling onto a natural pebbleised floor the mist is light and the waterfall falls pretty heavilytiu is harder to get to as the path is not concreted like sendang youll go through paths usually dirt that naturally direct you to a waterway climb the steep steps follow the paths through the river and youll eventually get to tiu make sure to wear decently ridged shoes youll get to tiu and youll have to place whatever you have in open space because there is no designated bag area because it hasnt been touched by construction ever the area is a deeper lake with a massive over  foot waterfall its nice and secluded and cleani suggest this to be one of your bucket list adventures
Name: Sendang Gile and Tiu Kelep Waterfall

Review: its really cool walking distance around min   hour from senaru homestay nearbycome before the dusk at least  hour before so you can enjoy waterfall showervillagers may accompany you to get there so give some tips to them
Name: Sendang Gile and Tiu Kelep Waterfall

Review: if you are even going to senaru to go to mount rinjani either before or after take some time to go to this amazing waterfall it is really worth it one of the most beautiful i have even seen
Name: Sendang Gile and Tiu Kelep Waterfall

Review: we went on a day trip from sengiggi to the waterfalls and it did not disappoint we walked to both waterfalls the second being the most spectacular being so strong that their was a constant mist we could not help ourselves and made our way to the edge of the waterfall the fall of the water is from very high and the water stings but we had lots of fun and their are smaller water falls to sit under it was just majestic and beautiful please people visiting this beautiful place pick up your rubbish and take it back with you these places are not rubbish dumps and will be ruined this is the only disappointment with lombok so much trash
Name: Sendang Gile and Tiu Kelep Waterfall

Review: they will tell you that you need to get a guide and if you dont get it they will still or break your motorbikethe waterfall themselves are amazing much more beautiful that anything else you will see in baligood luck
Name: Sendang Gile and Tiu Kelep Waterfall

Review: on july   lombok encountered a  earthquake the epicenter was approximately  miles km away from these waterfalls the hiking trail is rugged and follows primarily a manmade aqueduct part of the tour that guides often take you through is an aqueduct tunnel built into the hillside i would highly advise against utilizing this tunnel due to the instability of the area and potential for landslides as well as the unsupported nature of the tunnel you are also required to hike across the aqueduct bridge which may have sustained seismic damage i saw the falls  hours before the earthquake and it was incredible however i have no idea about the condition of the trails currentlyit was confirmed via a facebook post that the road leading to the trailhead had been damaged significantly enough to prevent traffic from entering so please be mindful that this area may no longer be accessible or open
Name: Sendang Gile and Tiu Kelep Waterfall

Review: i am happy to support the local economy here but i refuse to support liars and scammers the waterfalls are beautiful but everything leading up to to it is stressful its almost like all the locals team up here to try to force you to get a guide you dont need a guide and the entrance ticket is k there are so many people here its impossible to get lost you can also follow google maps or mapsme to find the waterfall if needed there should have police here to stop the harassment from the locals
Name: Sendang Gile and Tiu Kelep Waterfall

Review: really beautiful waterfalls the trip going through the jungle and crossing rivers is definetly worth it breathtaking beauty
Name: Sendang Gile and Tiu Kelep Waterfall

Review: insanely beautiful short trek to some amazing scenery bring bathing suit and towel downside is the trash found on this trail and surroundings be aware that there is a charge for viewing and that the monkeys are watching for every opportunity to snatch your belongings there is an old aqueduct that brings drinking water from the falls to the town the open aqueduct travels across another stream and into the side of the ridge interesting engineering work
Name: Sendang Gile and Tiu Kelep Waterfall

Review: this could be a wonderful place to embrace the beauty of the nature that lombok offers unfortunately as in many other places on the island obviously many people dont hesitate to throw their trash disrespectfully in this forest this is a very sad fact and even worse considering this place a geopark where awareness and education should happen in order to conserve the fragile nature i also witnessed people crossing another limit and feeding wild monkeys what should have been forbidden by the present tour guide that was in charge of this group wild animals should not get too close to the visitors in order to respect their nature and to prevent possible attacksthe entrance fee should include as well a tour guide that has been educated on the importance of nature conservation and instruct the visitors accordingly and strictly
Name: Sendang Gile and Tiu Kelep Waterfall

Review: we booked the waterfall tour and have been told that the entry fee would be  irp each and we will not need a local guide to walk the paths throu the forrest if we wish to have one it would be max  irp guide  entry feeas we got to the park office we got offered a package with local guide for  irp and we had to take a local guide as we would get lost throu the jungle after negotiating and discussing we were almost about to leave they took our offer of  irp incl entry fee for  pax and local guide off we wentthe guide was always walking  m in front of us and barely watching us talked  sentences in almost  hours the walk throu the jungle is a one way in same way out trip which is super easy to do on your ownwe only give  stars each for one waterfall as they are very pretty and the whole landscape in the park is really amazingbeautiful landscape would have been easy to do on your own what u r willing to pay is clearly what u get just be aware of that
Name: Sendang Gile and Tiu Kelep Waterfall

Review: we arranged a driver to take us to the waterfalls at the bottom of mt rinjani just walked to first waterfall which was worth it you do not need a local guide for this part  be wary of locals trying to tell you this if you go to the second or third ones you do
Name: Sendang Gile and Tiu Kelep Waterfall

Review: keep in mind the falls are so violent that you and your everything else will get wet if you plan on getting close up can swim at the bottom bring some change as adorable kids will help you cross the rocky streams and lead you through a tunnel fun afternoon monkeys all around use the first entrance as you go up the mountain it has the proper walkway
Name: Sendang Gile and Tiu Kelep Waterfall

Review: if you have a couple of hours spare when in senaru before or after your rinjani trekking take a walk to the waterfall you really dont need a guide easy enough to walk by yourself you cant get lost pass the first one as there are a lot of people and go to the second one nice hike where you ll wade through a shallow river to get there wear sandals not hiking shoes easier to step on the stones with sandals than bare footed once there you can have a nice refreshing swim in the base of the waterfall you might want to take a waterproof bag not the most impressive waterfalls i have seen but nevertheless beautiful and especially refreshing
Name: Sendang Gile and Tiu Kelep Waterfall

Review: approximately  minutes hike down from the entrance and here you go the stunning and gorgeous waterfall
Name: Sendang Gile and Tiu Kelep Waterfall

Review: about min hike down from entrance point near senaru cottage need to pay minimal feesthe waterfall is gorgeous
Name: Sendang Gile and Tiu Kelep Waterfall

Review: biked up there with my girlfriend on our scooter random guy comes out saying this is national park and you have to pay park fee of  per person to enter and pay   for a guide i almost laughed out loud this is a waterfall thats absolutely nuts national parks in the united states arent even that much after we said no he had the balls to say we would have to pay  to park our bike but we could walk around tried taking our helmets and everything we laughed and drove away wish i would have read more about the scams before we headed up there sad that indonesia is so full of scammers after a month here its started to sour the experience quite a bit
Name: Sendang Gile and Tiu Kelep Waterfall

Review: wonderful waterfall in senaru area  hours away from mataram or kuta its worth it to go here as you can get  waterfall within the same location you only have to do  mins trekkingadmission fee k  if you need local guide the price is kthe waterfall is wonderful and you can swim around but not directly under the fall as its dangerous you can go back through the water tunnel but be careful its dark and you can even waterslide under the bridge  let the water drives you forward its safety and funrecommended to gofollow me for pics and videos on instagram jkinoshitasugiono
Name: Sendang Gile and Tiu Kelep Waterfall

Review: a must visit waterfalls in lombok either before hike or after rinjanis hike  of the waterfalls are impressive and offers their own beauty and distinctivenessentrance fee is idr  per pax and they do expect some small amount of tips at the end of the tour if you engaged a local guide it is nice to have someone to help us cross and guide us which way to go in the waterfall so it is still worthwhile the tip as we left the waterfall in the late evening they even standby the torchlight to lighten our way out the waterfallbring swimsuit and expect to get wet when you go near to the waterfall do have a dip in the chill water that enough to get the chill run down your spine
Name: Sendang Gile and Tiu Kelep Waterfall

Review: i have visited so many waterfalls in my life and sendang gile and especially tiu kelep is out of this world so beautiful so majestic and so refreshingit is one of the best waterfalls that i have ever encountered this is something that you would not want to miss if you are here touring lombok i am so glad that i made it the trekking is not very arduous and indeed it can be considered a good workout for the nature lovers highly recommended
Name: Sendang Gile and Tiu Kelep Waterfall

Review: after a  hour drive from our hotel it was a welcome relief to step out and stretch our legsit is not a gruelling hike by any means but needs a mindful approach especially the shallow water crossings and damp rocksbut well worth itset in pristine nature the waterfall cascade through verdant overgrowth spilling their pure lifegiving water onto the rocks belowon the down side which as a nature lover and staunch environmentalist it was disappointing to find patches of rubbish idly discarded by the nearby stall holders trying to eke out a livingour guide mentioned that they were trying to encourage better waste management but it still has a way to gooverall though a fabulous experience
Name: Sendang Gile and Tiu Kelep Waterfall

Review: before we trekking to rinjani we are going to visit sendang gile and tiu kelep waterfall our tour guide suggest us to visit this place for warming up lol the ticket price to get in is five thousand rupiah you can play water in here and also take a photo sendang gile waterfall is not really big but the tiu kelep waterfall is recomended for who loves play with water nice place and nature if you have plan to visit lombok come and visit this place
Name: Sendang Gile and Tiu Kelep Waterfall

Review: we did the trekking with our  years old son an it was perfectly doablewe used a guide an easy help for a low price not really necessary but helpful and relaxed because they know some alternative routesfirst waterfall was nice and small the larger one great views and exciting because you have to pass the stream a few timesgreat place
Name: Sendang Gile and Tiu Kelep Waterfall

Review: we have young toddlers but we went to lombok without the kids in retrospect the walk into the nd waterfall of tiu kelep is not recommended for young children or toddlersbut very beautiful waterfall especially the nd waterfall which is a walk further down in from the st waterfall you set your eyes on if in the senaru area this is a good place to visitwe went around pm that afternoon as we took a morning flight into lombok and could only do it in the last  hours before sunset that day from the number of people coming out on our way in we can only imagine it would get pretty crowded from the hours of am  pm peak period so if you wish to get a good photograph with nice background of the waterfall without people littering the background of your photo either go very early or much later towards evening timegood idea to go with sea shoes pls definitely do not go with slippers unless you wish to trek the journey back barefooted
Name: Sendang Gile and Tiu Kelep Waterfall

Review: it was a really unique waterfall an epic wall of vines hides multiple cascades that flow quietly down the wall ive never seen anything like it and felt like i was in a scene from a movie a few locals played in the manmade pools at the bottom of the falls and we helped them practice their english for a while before making the sprint back during a break in the rain
Name: Sendang Gile and Tiu Kelep Waterfall

Review: lets join us here for explore lombokwaterfall toursasak tourcity tourtypical culinary of lombok islandsnorkling triptrekking rinjani mounth
Name: Sendang Gile and Tiu Kelep Waterfall

Review: first waterfall is just about  minutes from the ticket counters its so amazingsecond waterfall needed some up and down trek but its not tough to get there about  minutes from first waterfall nd waterfall seems more attractive and there were many tourists get a soak and swim here overall we enjoyed very much with this  natural beautiful waterfalls its must visit spots to all the lombok tourists
Name: Sendang Gile and Tiu Kelep Waterfall

Review: we had time to visit senaru waterfall with syam trekker guide when we arrived in senaru we have enough time and it is included in our trekking packagethe path down to the waterfall and ride back is great for warming up before tomorrow we have to climb to rinjani besides you can enjoy bathing in the cold the waterfall
Name: Sendang Gile and Tiu Kelep Waterfall

Review: you know i often read these reviews with interest and listen to words like rip off and gouging please spare me ok you drama queens we were a family travelling with a baby and i would thoroughly recommend you get a guide not only to help you with your stuff share their culture and history but also support the local economy they are charging peanuts we paid to get a motorbike down to the falls and then walked from there our guide helped us with the baby all the way technically the way is clear and chances of getting lost are minimal but the terrain is rough and very rocky having someone to help you over the rocks and through the river is so needed support the local economy people you leave more in tips and parking fares in uk europe and other first world countriesso to sum up waterfall is super beautiful make the effort and go to the second one which is really the show stopper take some watee or fruit with you and if you can get the motorbikes down it will save your knees and legs a bit
Name: Sendang Gile and Tiu Kelep Waterfall

Review: the place itself is beautiful but you dont need any guide they will try to force you and maybe show you some fake paper saying you must but you dont have to dont support this gouging and enjoy this easy  mins track count with the fact you must cross the river  times
Name: Sendang Gile and Tiu Kelep Waterfall

Review: it was challenging but well worth it lovely waterfalls splashes of water plus if you are lucky youll get rainbows at both areas
Name: Sendang Gile and Tiu Kelep Waterfall

Review: sendang gile waterfall is located in the village of senaru its spring comes from the foot of rinjani mountain the water is clear still very natural cool and cool very suitable for you who want to adventure tour what a great place to visit
Name: Sendang Gile and Tiu Kelep Waterfall

Review: totally worth the jungle trek the first waterfall you see is sendang gile which is stunning after a bit more trekking through the jungle you cut across the river  but be careful of your shoes as my husband managed to lose his sandal but not to worry coz the local kids rockhopped down the river to retrieve it for him for a tip of course you finally come to tiu kelep waterfall which left me speechless it was incredible the water was cold and so fresh and it was pristine despite all the people you must exercise caution though as the sheer volume of water falling causes a whirlpool effect which can suck you under and you shouldnt go under the waterfall as the pressure is immense
Name: Sendang Gile and Tiu Kelep Waterfall

Review: i had a chance to visit sendang gila and tiu kelepyou dont really need a guide but for a little tip i gave to the owner of my homestay he accompanied me to the waterfalls it was worth it cause he shared a lot of information on the fauna and flora of the region talked about traditions and culture we had a lot of fun he helped crossing that river that was the tricky part i like to help the local people as long as they are not too pushy there was litterally no one it was very nice walk in the forest sound of water you can have a back massage from the sendang gila waterfall and swim in tiu kelep just beware not to swim close to the fall of the water cause it is extremely powerful and u can get dragged in a swirl as long as you stay on the right hand side you can swim easily so to sum up it was worth it and another little tip if you want to have an amazing view of tiu kelep from up you can walk up towards the traditionnal village before entering turn left there is a path for about min walk up and look for the welcome to coffee plantation sign when you pass that sign there is a hidden viewpoint thats worth the trek
Name: Sendang Gile and Tiu Kelep Waterfall

Review: this is a most enjoyable walk through the forest with a spectacular endingyou must however get here early before the crowds arrive we met lots of people on the return and it deserves an early start to make is special
Name: Sendang Gile and Tiu Kelep Waterfall

Review: enterance fee is kperson for all tourists first stop is sendang gile which im not interested at all you can go to tiu kelep on right path before sendang gile follow the path and youll trekking on the river twice which was my favorite part make sure you wear swimsuit because its gonna be all wet remember that you can go by yourself a lot of local tour guide will offer you their services from the parking lot and inside it was kinda annoying they will follow you everywhere
Name: Sendang Gile and Tiu Kelep Waterfall

Review: both waterfalls are amazing and the second one is more they are in senaru village the way getting there is easy there are two main entrance which we may start from but the most popular is in parking area as the head the tickets are only k
Name: Sendang Gile and Tiu Kelep Waterfall

Review: i rode from senggi on a scooter with my friend on the back for two or so hours to get to this waterfall we stopped for lunch at a nice restaurant it began to rain and would not let up we were seriously considering to just leave and head back to the hotela couple at the restaurant said they saw the waterfall in the morning and it was also raining they said that we must gowe went small entrance fee first waterfall is nice nothing crazy afterwards we paid a kid  for him to guide us to the second waterfall realistically you can do this yourself but it was not much money and it was nice when crossing the river a couple of times to have someone who could help us to cross and show us the best waythe second waterfall is incredible i am soo glad that we took the time to drive all the way to this place from the first waterfall it was probably somewhere around  minutes to get to the secondthis is really a great place check it out
Name: Sendang Gile and Tiu Kelep Waterfall

Review: this two waterfalls is great tiu kelep is the best one with great viewyou just need to be there and feel the falls view superbbut to reach there u need abit effort to walk down the jungle and rivers which i really dont recommend for kids below  years and baby cause when raining its really hard and slippery all the walkways
Name: Sendang Gile and Tiu Kelep Waterfall

Review: we paid k from senggigi and that was over  hours because we went to the monkey forest on the way and that was a simple stop in the side of the road could have done without it we went on a monday best choice and we were in february so low season its k at the gate my tip you dont need a guide its a waste of money its a well worn oath with steps and railings so easy to find they want k for a guide who does nothing  we both wore things flip flops i broke a strap because i was wearing in the water  for best experience you need to wear something on your feet in the water i chose things its an easy walk to both falls first one just for looking you cant swim here the second further on you need to cross the stream pretty easy but slippery in placed we took a towel and change of cloths as we swam and there is such a huge back spray you get soaked anyway the way back it was  hr well worth the trip the insane driving keeps you awake in the car we had a nasi goreng at one of the few restaurants very cheap k
Name: Sendang Gile and Tiu Kelep Waterfall

Review: an amazing experience the waterfalls are beautiful and well worth the trip from gili trawanganill break this down into two parts first how i got there and how much and second what you see or experience at the waterfallsi paid ir  just under this includeda return boat from gili trawangan to lombok a driver in lombok for the day it is about mins from the harbour to the waterfallsentrance fee to sendang gile and tiu kelep waterfallsand a guidenow im not saying that this was cheapest option but how much are you trying to cut from i could have done it all on my own and it would have probably been cheaper but then i would have had more hassle and this would have taken up my timeso the waterfallsthere are pathways leading to the waterfalls so you can do it without the guide but it would still take a bit longer because its not like they are signposted also having a guide is good if you have any questions about the waterfalls or the area he will also help you in tricky parts if you need it there are two streams you need to walk through and some slippery rocks if youre under  you should be fine the guide will also take photos for you and look after your belongingsbe prepared for a lot of walking and steps i would recommend that you wear sea shoes your feet are going to be in water and you need grip hiking boots will take too long to dry and seeing people walking on rocks in flip flops is amusing to see there will be people selling rain jackets this is also amusing dont go to a waterfalls if youre not prepared to get wet also youll get so hot youll feel like youre in a greenhouse just bring a bottle of water there are stalls at the first waterfall if you forget you can also swim in the second waterfallto summarise the waterfalls were amazing worth every penny and the trip from gili trawangan just be prepared to work your calf muscles i tipped the driver  ir and the guide  ir not much just a gesture of goodwilljust to address the negatives people have postedrubbish  i have noticed plastic rubbish is a general problem in indonesia they need some topdown infrastructure to clean up what is a beautiful country however i didnt notice rubbish at the waterfallsscam  getting scammed is someone clearing your bank account paying for something like accommodation that doesnt exist or turning up and no one is there it is not paying a couple of pound for a guide to walk with you or ahead of you as they respect your privacy i never understand westerners im from london that dont want to support locals when they would spend more on a coffee in starbucks back at home
Name: Sendang Gile and Tiu Kelep Waterfall

Review: something in lombok that you should not miss visiting the waterfalls are so beautiful and majestic that you will automatically fall in love withthere are two trails and possible request for the trail the locals are maintaining it easy and flat trail then the other onepreferably have a guide to assistgood luck and enjoy the nature
Name: Sendang Gile and Tiu Kelep Waterfall

Review: its nice even on that rainy day a best place to combine with a rinjani trek  much better visiting during the morning less crowds that makes worth it
Name: Sendang Gile and Tiu Kelep Waterfall

Review: we went with our three year old on rented bikeshad a great time going to three waterfalls awesome experiance
Name: Sendang Gile and Tiu Kelep Waterfall

Review: pretty place to see in lombok the second waterfall is a must do the first one isnt that impressive at all the way to the waterfall is like walking in a jungle so its already fun itself the route is pretty easy couple river crossings would recommend to wear flip flops etc shoes with a rubber base it can be really slippery we drove here with a scooter from senggigi it was a long trip  hours maybe with couple of stops but worth it they tried to fool us by saying that its obligatory to take a local guide but we didnt just paid for the entrance fee and parking when we got down we didnt know which way to get to the second waterfall but there were these little kids who said theyll take us there if we pay k not sure which they ment but paid more since they were so great the boys were really cute and helpful they saved my flip flop when it got to the flow of the river without them it wouldve been gone if theyre there i really recommend to take these real life junglebook mouglis as your guide  but you can do it on your own too when you get down the stairs there goes a route to the right which will take you to the waterfall
Name: Sendang Gile and Tiu Kelep Waterfall

Review: we did the hike with my  and  year old children easy hike but a few river crossings waterfalls were beautiful definitely go to both not just the first one
Name: Sendang Gile and Tiu Kelep Waterfall

Review: the waterfalls were good with the second one being much better than the first  well worth the walk we swam in the waterfall although it was a bit coldbe careful about being ripped off our driver initially didnt drop us off at the waterfall entrance but at a tour company that wanted to charge us   rupiah for two people to see both waterfalls we had seen some reviews on here so that was way more than expected we left and asked to be dropped directly at the entrance where we met a local guide who charged us   rupiah this included the entrance feea guide is not completely necessary as you could probably manage ourselves but we appreciated having one as he took photos for us and helped us carry some of our thingswe wore flip flops and were fine although some nonslip water shoes might be useful if you are planning on swimming in the waterfall
Name: Sendang Gile and Tiu Kelep Waterfall

Review: i and my daughter visited this place in january  the way to sendang gile is quite easy because the road is made of cemented stone with stairs when we continue to the second waterfall tiu kelep i need helper to help me pass the river its slippery and the stone at the bottom of the river are unstable be careful not to fall into the river better wear plastic or rubber shoes that can walk in water once you arrive tiu kelep you can take a swim
Name: Sendang Gile and Tiu Kelep Waterfall

Review: the falls are only a short way from senaru and are easily reached by a mostly paved path you do have to pay a small admission fee you dont need a guide for the first set but generally do for the second set the route down passes some beautiful views and part of the amazing irrigation system that snakes its way around senaru the falls themselves are beautiful and not too busy when i visited  apart from a group of teenagers who seemed to be skipping school and delighted in dragging me under the falls to take selfies i got utterly drenched but i havent laughed that much in a long time if youre in the area and fancy a gentle mostly shaded walk then definitely do this
Name: Sendang Gile and Tiu Kelep Waterfall

Review: my friends and i went here hoping to see both of the waterfalls the walk to sendang gile was quite easy just stairs and a cement path there were lots of locals hanging out and bathing in the water lots of garbage and dirty diapers around but still a beautiful waterfall we were hoping to make it to tiu kelep also but it took us so long to find the path that the park would be closing before we even made it back definitely not worth it to drive all the way to senaru just for this but if you are already in the area seems like a good way to pass a few hours
Name: Sendang Gile and Tiu Kelep Waterfall

Review: me and my girlfriend didnt have time in lombok to do a rinjani trek  but we came up to senaru for one night before heading to kuta lombok just to see these waterfalls it was worth itmy main tip is to go early if you can we got to the entrance at about am i didnt want to use a guide and was mentally preparing myself for an awkward argument if they got as pushyrude as some reviews suggest but we were lucky in that there was no one at all by the gate asking to be our guidehowever there was a man in the entrance booth to pay the very cheap  idr per person entrance fee to this to me proves that a guide is not required  no matter what they try tell you otherwise why were we allowed to enter onewith this in mind my view for what its worth is that unless you want a guide which will have its advantages if youre interested in the wildlife and flora etc you should refuse some say you should do it just to give people a living but in my view tricking and pressuring tourists into paying for a guide by saying they are mandatory when they are clearly not should not be encouraged  as explained below the way there is mostly a marked path anywayonce we were in we skipped sendang gile first and walked straight to tiu kelep waterfall to get pictures before any crowds came  as we had read this was the more impressive of the two we decided to look at sendang gile on the way backthe walk was pretty easy another advantage of getting there early  not as hot i would suggest to do it in flip flops because there is a bit where you must wade through the the river to continue on the path which i found pretty fun better to have flip flops to just take on and off easily than proper shoes imo the rest of the way is just a normal path and stepstiu kelep was magnificent although id read good reviews beforehand it was still more impressive than i thought it would be in person the water falls from such a height you feel the spray from pretty far awaywe were at the waterfall itself for about  minutes and had it to ourselves the whole time we took photos and had a swim it was very cold but really refreshing bear in mind my visit was in january   which is wet season and also low season for tourism generally in balilombok it may not be as impressivequiet in the drypeak seasonwe went to sendang gile waterfall on the way back  nowhere near as impressive its still pretty high but this one seems more popular with locals as there are quite a lot of stalls here selling snacks etc  there is nothing like this at tiu kelep other than a small toilet block sadly this also means there is a lot more garbage around which has been a recurring theme for a lot of my travels through indonesiatiu kelep especially is well worth a visit if you are around this area but to avoid the dodgy guide problem and get the best out of it get there very early if you can
Name: Sendang Gile and Tiu Kelep Waterfall

Review: the waterfalls are stunning as is the hike through the jungle to get to them i recommend going early to miss the crowds
Name: Sendang Gile and Tiu Kelep Waterfall

Review: the first waterfall is simply not worth a visit its small and completely overrun with people that have no idea how to preserve nature it is full of litter everywhere with even local people seemingly not caring about all the rubbish scattered around their forest its incredibly disappointingthe second fall is far better and just about worth the short trek its larger and more impressive with fewer people and less rubbishthere is nothing difficult with the trek clear path and not challenging to walk we did it in flip flops you certainly dont need a guideoverall if youve got nothing to do then its worth a visit but might be disappointing
Name: Sendang Gile and Tiu Kelep Waterfall

Review: must visit and its really amazingthis was my third time in lombok and first visit to this waterfallyes i paid idr for the entrance and guide for me this was not a scam and its more like helping them earning something the guide did a good job helping me with my things carrying the drinks and snacks and bags with towel and clothes before the entrance please buy some drinks along the way the guide gave some explanation about the surrounding areasi skipped the first waterfall sendeng gila and went straight to the second one tiu kelep its really breath taking and amazing views not hard trekking at all make sure you take your photos here its can be a long wait because many people will take photos here
Name: Sendang Gile and Tiu Kelep Waterfall

Review: just amazing make sure to take the turn off and walk out to tiu kelep on the same trip you see air terjunswimming at tiu kelep
Name: Sendang Gile and Tiu Kelep Waterfall

Review: i drove a motorbike for about  hours from senggigi the trek to the first waterfall took  minutes quite steep from there it takes  minuets to reach the other one i did not go with a guide i found the second one much bettermy tips wear footwear that can walk in water put away small items such as glasses beware of monkeys snatching your belongings and food walk along the river and stream from the second waterfall to enjoy tranquil atmosphere away from the crowd
Name: Sendang Gile and Tiu Kelep Waterfall

Review: went to the  waterfalls which are really beautiful and worth a visit if you have time and want to go to mount rinjani anyway be aware of guide and entrance fee scam i got totally ripped off by the guide who i paid  idr for the tour unfortunately i didnt read the reviews on trip advisor first so i hope you do
Name: Sendang Gile and Tiu Kelep Waterfall

Review: a few months ago when i visited the crazy spring waterfall and tiu keep i think this is a bet one in north lomboktake only hours from inn to tiu kelepvery beautiful very high recommend it if you come to lombok do not be afraidmake sure you are fit enough to travel
Name: Sendang Gile and Tiu Kelep Waterfall

Review: first things first  from what ive read it is not actually necessary to get a guide to go to the  waterfalls rp per person all in if you get a guide however from what i can see the guides are mostly local to the area and it is their sole source of income so fellow travelers why not part with a few dollars and help put something back into the communitywe are a couple of friends in our s who are admittedly not very fit we were met by our guide mowgli a small spritely guy near the entrance from there he told us it would be about  minutes to get to the first waterfall sendeng gile then a further  minutes to get to tiu kelep  minutes if we take it slowgetting to the st waterfall was easy you only had to walk down some steps there were a few local families having a picnic at the first waterfall spent a few minutes there taking pictures then off we went to the second one trek was not so easy this time it was uphill through some dense forest at times and we had to climb quite a few rocks along the way make sure to wear comfortable non slip shoes although our guide only wore rubber slippers advantage of having a guide here is he knows the trek like the back of his hands ensuring your safety and always lending a hand to keep you steady another advantage is that he will tell you the history of the place and show you all the interesting flora and fauna he spotted a rare silvered leaf monkey also known as black monkey or lutung way high up in the trees which we wouldnt have noticed on our own this endangered species is local to the area and not easy to spottrek left us quite breathless but the sight of tiu kelep was well worth the trek  it was majestic and its powerful icy mist cooled us right off after the hot hike we sat on the stones and took our time soaking in the icy water while admiring the beauty of the waterfallthe trek down was much easier and the guide used a different route through a dark water tunnel where you had to use a flashlight which was a novel experienceall in it was a pleasant day out and i would recommend this place to visitors
Name: Sendang Gile and Tiu Kelep Waterfall

Review: firstly may i say that anyone that complains about entry fee or paying a guide  come on its a few dollars in total and you are contributing toward not only the maintenance of the track etc but you are helping the local communityit is disappointing to see large amounts of rubbish near the falls themselves the walk itself is straight forward and anyone with basic level of fitness could do it suitable footwear required due to slippery and undulating terrain and some slippery creek crossings which for us were easy to crosssecond waterfall definitely the better of the  be very careful if swimming here as the waterfall generates a very powerful current in this pool as i discovered and i am a strong swimmerour local guide took us through tunnel on way back and whilst a bit novel it was something different be aware that there area a few holes along the way where concrete has eroded leaving exposed steel reinforcement mesh so be careful with your feetwe saw a few monkeys on way outoverall well worth it but litter and toilets near each waterfall detracts from the experience part with a few dollars people and get a guide put something back into the local community
Name: Sendang Gile and Tiu Kelep Waterfall

Review: being a retired couple we werent up for the arduous trek up mt rinjani so the walk to these  waterfalls ticked our boxes a challenging  hour walk up and down a rough path with the fantastic reward of stunning waterfalls you pay a token fee to enter the national park the first waterfall is only  minutes away down many flights of rough steps and you have the cheat option to grab a lift on the back of a local motorbike there were local families enjoying a splash in the chilly waters in the rocky pools at the base of the waterfall but we decided to push ourselves by walking another  mins to the next waterfall which was an enjoyable but more strenuous trek through dense forest there are small stalls set up along the path selling water drinks and snacks and enterprising young men who offer their services as guides with the option of taking you through tunnels used for water irrigation using headlamps we wanted to do our own thing but ended up paying rp about au to a young boy for the last  min stretch which took us over  shallow but fast running rivers it was worth the money to be shown the best stepping points through the water and slippy rocks we could hear the boom of the water crashing down into a pool at the base of the falls way before we could see it and as we got closer the air was filled with fine mist from the water it was spectacular many visitors chose to clamber over large rocks further towards the base of the waterfall to swim and feel the spray of the water but the pressure from the falls was very strong and you couldnt get too close suggest you wear comfortable shoes for clambering over rough terrain rocks and through water and it was very hot work so we were glad of the water we brought along to drink
Name: Sendang Gile and Tiu Kelep Waterfall

Review: the amazing waterfall that i found in senaru villageit is easy to visit it only runs less than an hourto get to the second waterfalltiu kelepthe sir is very fresh cause it is left surrounded by trees that are still green
Name: Sendang Gile and Tiu Kelep Waterfall

Review: when we do trek few months agoon arrival day our trek organizer bring us to this waterfullvery nice to go here before trekking
Name: Sendang Gile and Tiu Kelep Waterfall

Review: most beautiful falls in lomboktrek to the st fallsendang gile was abt mins and additional  for the next falltiu kelepcold and abit of river crossing need to be a little physically fit
Name: Sendang Gile and Tiu Kelep Waterfall

Review: waterfall itself was great but unfortunately we were ripped off a bit we were told to use guide that it is not possible without the guide to do the waterfall this is a lie entrance ticket is   idr actually and thats all you need the guide company charged us   each additionally to ticket its just for tourists who dont know that no guide is actually needed
Name: Sendang Gile and Tiu Kelep Waterfall

Review: about a  minute walk from the main road through a stream at one point tiu kelep is one of the niceest waterfalls ive ever seen and youre allowed to dive right in
Name: Sendang Gile and Tiu Kelep Waterfall

Review: you can swim in tiu kelep but not sendang gile both falls are pretty impressive and the walk there isnt too onerous  you should do it in flipflops because there is some wading through water to access the waterfalls nice little afternoon trip
Name: Sendang Gile and Tiu Kelep Waterfall

Review: min walk through the jungle and some watercreeks pay attention to your footwear youll find this beauty can be a disappointment during dry season but if not it is amazingtip you do not need a guide to find this waterfall you can easy do it yourself or just follow the other visitors
Name: Sendang Gile and Tiu Kelep Waterfall

Review: pending from where you have to start eg from senggigi it took us with taxi about  hours getting there you walk down to first waterfall  steps between rain forestonce down it is quite cool and windy from huge quatity of water which is falling down from heightsapprox  min walk to next waterfall  also quite impressiveand you can swim in basin belowon way back at late afternoon we even met wild monkeys
Name: Sendang Gile and Tiu Kelep Waterfall

Review: it takes about  hours to visit both falls it can be done on flip flops the first one is easy accesible for everyone you can stand underneath for a massage for the second one you have to walk through the water refreshing and not cold the best thing to do is to put out your shoes and put them back on when you are out the rocks are slippery especially the smooth and soft big rocks so keep away from them its a nice footmassage it can be dangerous when you go in the water at the second falls just keep in front on the right side a guide is nice but not absolutely necessary but the boys are cheap and make a living out of it
Name: Sendang Gile and Tiu Kelep Waterfall

Review: the trip was definitely worth it really liked the easy to medium hike to both waterfalls with fantastic pictures and beautiful naturebest part was swimming in the second waterfall stones are very slippery so better be carefulone thing that was a bit strange was the way how we got into the area the driver that we ordered did let us out before the official entry to the park and we were told that we would have to take a guide after bargaining we at least got a good price but still seems like drivers and guides know each other and share the money the get from confused tourists like us the guide was a very helpful and friendly teenager and walked us into the park from a side entry avoiding the entry fee we would to this tour again but next time insist that they let us out at the official entry and doing the trip ourselves without a guide
Name: Sendang Gile and Tiu Kelep Waterfall

Review: these falls are a good day trip whilst in lombok you will need to climb over some rocks to get to the second and go swimming flip flips are better than trainers as i found out the water is freezing but still worth it definitely worth the trip whilst on the island you can easily do this yourself without a guide its a well trodden path and you can follow the locals if youre not sure
Name: Sendang Gile and Tiu Kelep Waterfall
