Review: the temple can be seen from the beach but you cannot enter if you are not going to pray the temple is very small and it is worth seeing if you are nearby otherwise dont make any detour for it
Name: Batu Bolong Temple

Review: the pura is quite small there not a lot of activity we can do there just about  minute to see all the pura
Name: Batu Bolong Temple

Review: if you are not already templed out from bali it is a nice quick stop batu bolong means rock with hole so it is just a small temple on the top of a rock with a hole carved out by pounding waves
Name: Batu Bolong Temple

Review: the temple itself is tiny and youd complete it in  minutes but the walk from batu bolong beach to senggigi was lovely
Name: Batu Bolong Temple

Review: very important temple for hindus in lombokthe view is niceyou can see the sea hereit is a temple close to the seayou just paid some donations then you can visit this temple leisurely
Name: Batu Bolong Temple

Review: i decide to morning run from senggigi to pura batu bolong only km and takes  minutes this place is good many hindus pray and stay for overnight the beaches was good a best place to pray peacefull
Name: Batu Bolong Temple

Review: had a visit to batu bolong beach excellent place to view the sunset which is golden black sand sprawling and you can see uluwatu there few nice cafeless busy place to have a great view of the sunset
Name: Batu Bolong Temple

Review: we went with sunset it was a nice view though it was cloudy we liked the atmosphere people preparing to pray some tourists taking pictures worth a visit
Name: Batu Bolong Temple

Review: perfect ideal location to capture the calmness  serenity of lombok watching the waves hitting the shore is very captivating
Name: Batu Bolong Temple

Review: this is a functioning religious site we happened on it as a ceremony was taking place which of course is always interesting not really meant for tourists but the location is spectacular on a cliff facing bali if youre in the area its worth a stop for the cultural context and setting
Name: Batu Bolong Temple

Review: worshippers come to this temple mainly to spent night or called mekemit because the ambience of being in the beach wtih open sky and sea breeze is calmingthe sunset view is good too not as good as malimbu hill but still good
Name: Batu Bolong Temple

Review: we went here because its just  minutes taxi ride from where we stayed even thou there is no entrance fees required but the local will asked you to make some donation without specify any amount before let you in there are no other tourists besides us when we visitedthe temple is small and not well maintained compare to the temples in bali island eg uluwatutanah lotif this temple is not convenient from where you stay please reconsider again if you decided to visit
Name: Batu Bolong Temple

Review: the temple was located near my hotel in senggigi area while it may not be grand at the first glance the temple was indeed very beautiful in its own way i visited it by the sunset and i think its the best time to be there it may not be as grand and wellmaintained as the temples you visited in bali but it was actually felt like a little more personally enchanting to me this temple is you only had to pay a donation no tickets needed i think the temple is simple smaller in size but at the same time it was beautiful in its originalitydont expect grandeur when you visit this place but respect is as a temple with beautiful naturemade surrounding i do think its more real than the ones i saw in balips i spotted few seats beside the entrance of this temple i was told you could sit there and enjoy the scenery for free and boy it was a scenery not to be missed sunset in senggigi
Name: Batu Bolong Temple

Review: interesting places  narmada water park sukarare village air kelambu waterfall ask the locals if there is nyongkolan parade
Name: Batu Bolong Temple

Review: on the day we visited there was a special prayer happening so we got to see their rituals and beautiful culture it wouldnt be fair to compare the pura with those in bali bear in mind lombok is an islamic island whilst bali is hindu so visit with an open mind respect their religion and culture there is also a story behind the temple apparently it was also bombed during ww not the temple but the ledge which then created the little cave below the temple as for the donation this is normal even in baliwhich tourist trap does not have that but really you wont be expected to give a lot so i dont see why one should complain about this so with lombok wellknown as the island with a thousand mosque this pura is pretty quaint and lovely really
Name: Batu Bolong Temple

Review: i saw many internet reviews about batu bolong not worth going because theres nothing to seei gave it a tryits  trueso i feel like i have the responsibility to warn othersyou have to pay a donation and rent short walking distance to see all the view insideand you cant go up to the top cause theres a sign indicates that you cant go up unless its for prayingso lastly my personal piece of advice stay at senggigi beach you have the same view
Name: Batu Bolong Temple

Review: poor the sand color not nice but beach is cleanwater color not greatbetter to go to gilli all islands spend more time there
Name: Batu Bolong Temple

Review: enjoyed here while i watched surfers ride or fall off the waves there was only a handful of people present and very few vendors peddling whatever stuffs a cold coconut juice or ice cold bintang would be perfect while just relaxing by the beach
Name: Batu Bolong Temple

Review: unlike pura in bali theres so much to see this one is small and theres nothing much no view whatsoever unless youre going there to pray
Name: Batu Bolong Temple

Review: pura batu bolong literally means temple rock holei always enjoy visiting temples throughout se asia and while this one may not be as spectacular as many temples found elsewhere in asia it is still worth a visitit sits on the edge of a rocky outcrop overlooking the bali sea with views of the eastern edge of the island of bali it is a hindu temple with some local superstition surrounding it our local guide said that visitors if not pure of heart will ascend the stairs to the upper level of this temple and literally see evil on one occasion a friend of his saw snakes for examplethis temple is unique in that beneath the main temple there is a rock opening that you can walk through thus the namethis temple is definitely worth a visit and as my guide instructed it is especially nice to visit at sunset
Name: Batu Bolong Temple

Review: we walked through sandy beach from the kila senggigi beach resort and took  mins it was nice that we can took pictures and enjoy the beach
Name: Batu Bolong Temple

Review: its a cute little temple on the rocks above the sea but its very small and a follower wants money rp to give you a sash to wear bali has much bigger better and cheaper temples to visit
Name: Batu Bolong Temple

Review: beautiful coastal scenery combined with the temple which is at the top of the rock with a big hole on it
Name: Batu Bolong Temple

Review: this is a small hindu temple on one end of the beach it is a nice place to watch sun set with mt agung bali in the background when we were there there were tourists who were noisy and did not heed the notices around the temple areas reserved for those going there to pray were not observed as they wanted to take photos
Name: Batu Bolong Temple

Review: dressed to the nines for their offerings the locals certainly placed this high on their priority when it comes to praying for peace of mindlook out for the cactus growing out of the rocks forming the wall of the shrinedefinitely the right place for sunset viewing
Name: Batu Bolong Temple

Review: visited on december   its located along senggigi beach no entrance fee is required however were approached by a young local girl with a record book asking for donation before we enter the temple visitors are not required to rent a sarong a cloth that wraps around the abdomen and covers the legs even if wearing shorts when entering the temple ground pura batu bolong is a hindu sacred site and also a tourist site but it lacks proper maintenance and is in the state of neglect lots of waste on the beach best time to visit  one hour before sunset to half an hour after sunset beautiful sunset from the top of the temple
Name: Batu Bolong Temple

Review: entering the place is troublesome with people demanding you pay a lot of money it has a nice beach view but thats all we could do
Name: Batu Bolong Temple

Review: stayed in senggigi for the night after arriving from gili air that morning and saw that this was one of the main attractions its worth a look if youre in the area but i wouldnt go out of my way to visit
Name: Batu Bolong Temple

Review: nothing much you are only allowed to stay at the bottom there is no entrance fee require but there will be people asking for donation to the temple
Name: Batu Bolong Temple

Review: pura batu bolong this pura name is intriguing and makes you curious batu bolong means holey rocksthey named it because the pura was located on top of the coral cliff that have a huge hole caused the waves eroded itthe pura area itself is not very large and at that time we cannot up to the pura because there was a ceremony but the sight you can see is pretty amazing it was ocean side with gunung agung  as a background i attach the photonote for people who doesnt have interest in culture or landscape view it can be boring
Name: Batu Bolong Temple

Review: was worth seeing although quite small compared to other temples right on the beach point with a hole in the rocks you can walk through you can only go into the sanctury if you are of the faith and need to go to prayer
Name: Batu Bolong Temple

Review: just magical is all i can say  stunning great guides and fantastic scenery good for all the family my  year old daughter really enjoy it also
Name: Batu Bolong Temple

Review: loved the distance between the town and the resort just right a taxi costs around one doller for return but shuttle bus from resort will take you there for free
Name: Batu Bolong Temple

Review: we had a couple of hours before we got to the airport so we decided to see the cultural side of lombok pura meru and this one were on the list if you have a few hours to spare then this might be a good stop enroute from senggigi to the airport the views of the sea and waves breaking on to the rocks are great would be better to go around sunset but nothing much exists of the temple there is a small donation you are expected to pay at the entrance you get a a cloth belt to tie around the waist in return you can pay as much as you like we paid rp for  adults and  kids
Name: Batu Bolong Temple

Review: as we stop outside the temple a girl came to us and put a red belt around us with the excuse of writing our names in a visit book she was keeping she asked us for a donation she was very unhappy and rude as we didnt let any money as everybody else we check it before she is not responsible for the temple she is just doing this to earn money for herself the temple is deserted and dirty the government should do something about it or they will put keepers to guard and maintain the temples or they should remove those who try to earn money from the unsuspected tourists actually there is no fee to enter the templemost of the temples are at this situation in lombok exactly the opposite from bali so same
Name: Batu Bolong Temple

Review: we had a private guide and asked to be taken to some interesting sites and beaches we came here  it was unusual and ver photogenic but there is not a lot else to see
Name: Batu Bolong Temple

Review: really there isnt much here and i doubt tourists would come at all if it werent for the seafront location
Name: Batu Bolong Temple

Review: this is one of the best hinduism temple at lombok it was built on a rock called batu bolong the best way visiting this temple by using taxi approx  or idr  from mataram this temple is close to sengigi beach and sunset point
Name: Batu Bolong Temple

Review: located on the beach we were there during festive and very interesting to us since it is new to usthe place are clean and well maintained the view are spectacular especially during sunsetworth a visit
Name: Batu Bolong Temple

Review: before visiting here we had read a number of rave reviews if this hindu temple its situation is great on a rocky outcrop by the sae with a picturesque rocky arch underneath but it is also very small i can only assume that those who think it is so wonderful have not visited some of the other quite magnificent hindu temples elsewhereif you are in the area then obviously it is worth a brief visit but not worth going there specially
Name: Batu Bolong Temple

Review: batu bolong temple located  minutes walk from senggigi central great place to enjoy sunset donation are needed for the temple
Name: Batu Bolong Temple

Review: quite small quick visit but great photos cheap entrance fee free from sellers better not to go alone unless you are brave enough maybe its just us has to be accessed by car no public transportation
Name: Batu Bolong Temple

Review: nice balines temple at the road side between ampenan and senggigi the sunsets from there are usually great and due to the absence of crowds and horrible shops much more enjoyable than in tanah lotbali
Name: Batu Bolong Temple

Review: a hindu temple on the edge of a small cliff a bit scared as pack of dogs outside with fighting wounds small statues
Name: Batu Bolong Temple

Review: we had just been to bali so to be fair had been spoilt for choice for beautiful temples this one wasnt that special other than that it was on the beach and pleasant to take a few photos at sunset you are kind of required to donate  rupiah which while not a lot of money and of course they need to preserve these things did seem a bit strange as no other temples id come across had required you to donate sign in the book and wear a coloured sash around your waist
Name: Batu Bolong Temple

Review: if the people of pura batu bolong want to increase tourism they are going the wrong way about itover my many years of travelling to indonesia i have visited hundreds of temples most of temples are either free or else they have a donation box outside of the temple usually in that case ill put in a  notebut at pura batu bolong the moment we stepped off the beach and onto the steps near the temple we were hassled by a temple guard to pay up his manner was not at all deferential or remotely religious he just hell bent on getting into our wallets i fully appreciate that we are rich bules and they are poor but ive never experienced such an overt money grubbing attitude like this guard he really turned us offthe temple is really nice and interesting  stars for the temple but the temple guards manner was absolutly disgusting smarten up lombok if you want tourists to come
Name: Batu Bolong Temple

Review: quite temple in lombok a must visit for photosyou would have to wear a sort of scarf around the waist to enter this temple it is worth the while as you can take some nice photos
Name: Batu Bolong Temple

Review: nice balines temple at the road side between ampenan and senggigi the sunsets from there are usually great and due to the absence of crowds and horrible shops much more enjoyable than in tanah lotbali
Name: Batu Bolong Temple

Review: this is my second visit i still amaze what the people here kept their tradition in this modern era beautiful place with beautiful traditional houses too here you find most women weaving to make traditional clothes you can purchase the clothes with fair price
Name: Sade Traditional Weaving Village

Review: as we travel only with our small backbag we didnt want to buy stuff they sell although everything was very beautiful because of that our guide politely showed our way out from the village so if you want to go and get to know more about their culture prepare yourself to buy
Name: Sade Traditional Weaving Village

Review: the village is ok like a big marketopen air museum you should not pay anything besides a donation we were approached by a guy who claimed that the price is  idr per person  optional tip for the guide he sounded so confident and humble that we were stupid enough to
Name: Sade Traditional Weaving Village

Review: we had our holiday there we met our guide and he was friendly he told us about all the story about sade village about the life style and also when they marriage they still follow their culture kain songket tenun was amazing i buy because i will graduated on  i had
Name: Sade Traditional Weaving Village

Review: people there they only see you like an atm  as soon as we stepped off our scooter we were approached by a local that said if we wanted to walk around the village we would need a guide  he insists even after we offer him a donation
Name: Sade Traditional Weaving Village

Review: we were driving by so stopped to have a look one of the local residents was our guide we asked for cost  were told a donation at our discretion would be ok interesting place steeped in history we got to look inside a traditional home how they make cotton to make the
Name: Sade Traditional Weaving Village

Review: it is our first visit to this place there are  families wirh  residents according to the village head the ladies cannot go out of the village and most of the them marry to the village people if the man likes the woman he will bring her runaway this is a actual
Name: Sade Traditional Weaving Village

Review: went there to experience sasak culture the village its self is extraordinario and definetely worth a visit a guide well speaking english will show you around the big but there are plenty of women selling weaving beautiful products but the prices they start with are
Name: Sade Traditional Weaving Village

Review: i would have given this village a much higher rating if it wasnt for the face that i feel deceived by our village guide the village itself was interesting although felt a bit staged and there was no demarcation between what textiles were produced in the village and what was
Name: Sade Traditional Weaving Village

Review: a very touristy arrangement where the guides take you around explain a little bit about the village but also show you shop after shop where you are encouraged to buy traditional weaving batik and other things i didnt buy anything and of course there was disappointment
Name: Sade Traditional Weaving Village

Review: i stopped by this village to find souvenirs what impressed me was that as i got off the car there was a guy came to me and welcome me then we went to the village as he told me about the village history and presence life he did not ask for anything until i left he walked me to the car insteadthen we went around like an hour while i also bought some traditional necklace which was very cheapthe tip is go deeper inside the village to get cheaper price those were in the front were more expensivethe village itself was like any other traditional village which was preservedi hope i have a chance to explore more about this village some other time
Name: Sade Traditional Weaving Village

Review: maybe because i am indonesianthe placed to me is to commercialcouldnt really feel like in the villagethe house turned into souvenir and traditional stallthe guide assigned will explain the story of the  old village how they built the house and how they married to each othermake sure if you really wanna buy their items bargain to half the pricethey will offer high price
Name: Sade Traditional Weaving Village

Review: we were greeted by a guide from the village the second we stepped out of our taxi he seemed pleasant at the entrance he explained that sade is a living village pointing to some babies that were being weighed a monthly ritual he explainedhe also made it clear that there was a compulsory contribution of rp if we are to proceed with the walkabout we were with two kids so we asked if he meant rp per person he nodded we were not aware there was a fee but proceeded as he said contributions goes to the community you can tip me additionally if you are happy with the walkabouti believe some of villagers do live there but i have my doubts over some factsactual numbers i figured if  live there there should be a lot more belongings washing cooking going on there were the symbolic looms but no one was actually dying or weaving you will be asked to look at the souvenirs as you walk round even if the village was sustained with the help of tourism dollars the insights and stories into the sasak way of live is in my opinion interestinghowever i am giving this three stars because i now read that entrance is somewhat free with a voluntary contribution some websites indicate rpk per pax even if i had misunderstood our guide earlier and handed him rp rp x  pax he made no attempt to highlightreturncorrect the amount that is excluding the additional rp  tip we gave him so in total for  adults and our two kids we paid rp  rp tipour sasak guide quickly slipped the rpk into his pocket no receipt of course as our taxi reversed we could see him fiddling with the mobile phone that he pulled out of his pocketi am happy to contribute but if there is a mandatory entrance fee i would like a clear sign indicating what that amount is if contributions are voluntary then it should be exactly that voluntary
Name: Sade Traditional Weaving Village

Review: nice traditional sasak village a few miles south from praya international airport in lombok guided tours from local young people and many opportunities to see people working on skates batiks and other handcrafts pushy sales but high quality crafts always affordable after a good bargain we read a few negative reviews but had a good time there and felt welcome
Name: Sade Traditional Weaving Village

Review: nice experience visited sade village there are a lot of tenun khas lombok that you can buy in there you can bargain and get special price if you are smart at bargain the tenun is soft and comfortable to use i got  tenun bracelete in  thousand rupiah definitly will be back soon lombok
Name: Sade Traditional Weaving Village

Review: i was recommended by our driver on this village apparently the villa is the only original village that lombok has it was an old villa of course they have explained about the interesting of the people there when they would like to get married they need to kidnap the lady i heard about it before the house in the village itself it was claimed that people live in the house but i doubt that they do as i saw there was only few things at the house to look like the people lives there maybe they do but i am not that sure they cook by using wood but i did not see where they keep the wood they just had a couple of wood i think the government just want to have an attraction that helps local the pricing of the items inside the village is above pricing outside of the village with the same items we also should pay for the guide who took us around it was not compulsory to give tips but still we should pay i think i will not recommend my friend to go there and visit the place it is not worth it it becomes a commercial place instead of the traditional place
Name: Sade Traditional Weaving Village

Review: fortunately when we got there theres music  dance show ongoing people said its a rare opportunitythe guide is fluent in english  have so much to tell about this village sasak people culture  philosophythe buildings are of many varieties truly traditional from the making to maintenance but clean and not smelly the alleys are also clean personally i think cleanliness and freshness is a much much added value for this attractionwe can also see people making cotton threads from cotton weaving traditional fabric from the cotton threads making coffee powder from coffee beans traditionallygot so much for a very small village
Name: Sade Traditional Weaving Village

Review: its not traditional as my expectationlocal people try to sell all the times and price is very very expensivethere are many shops and does not look traditional place at all like a shopping place and local people always try to sell all the time and again overprice
Name: Sade Traditional Weaving Village

Review: they rlly have a unique tradition and i love visiting this village our guide was also friendly everyone were really friendly and ppl here sell many things just buy what they sell bcs its relatively cheaper than the other placethey have good quality things and its cheaper than the other place really worth the visit
Name: Sade Traditional Weaving Village

Review: the village shows the indigenous people of sasak and their ways of life nice to learn the story about it the downside is that you at least need a guide to enter the village submission fee is voluntary donation if you visit it by motorbike i can recommend you to park it in front of alfamart next to the village
Name: Sade Traditional Weaving Village

Review: indigenous tribes of lombok who lived in this village they sell traditional fabric called songket and some accessories when you came here a guide will reflect come to you and guiding you around this village at the last you have to give some tips for him overall this is an interesting experience surrounding this village
Name: Sade Traditional Weaving Village

Review: the whole history of the sasak community was really eye opening apart from that it was so commercialized with all the souvenirs and so called woven cloth etc and its bloody expensive one piece at k rupiah at the airport u can purchase it at only k and they so call claim to have the bargaining scheme until both parties come to an agreement bullcrap worst is that they start selling grandmother stories like i have a family of  takes ages to weave this i mean come on really playing the pity me card wont recommend to come here
Name: Sade Traditional Weaving Village

Review: this place is supposed to be authentically showing the local ethnic of lombok village but i think it was no more genuine it was too commercial now there are too many vendors selling souvenirs and most of them not best quality i found something similar much better in quality and in price at the airport i would suggest to visit museum national in mataram instead to see and learn more of this stuff the admission fee is not clear in amount and they tend to ask more for budget traveler like me it was annoying they seem to charge things overpriced for tourists
Name: Sade Traditional Weaving Village

Review: i went to this village in midfebruary  i was at first aiming for the woven cloth they sell woven cloth in interesting patterns and cheaper price than other traditional villages woven cloth in eastern part of indonesia suddenly i heard this noise a gamelanlike sound playing traditional music in entrance area there was a peresean going on peresean is a term for a war between two men who compete for something they decided to fight each other with rattan shield and a whip to determine the winner and the loser will get a humiliation this was a traditional fight to avoid further conflicti definitely love my trip there thought it was too short although it was raining for  minutes the people are friendly and you can ask questions to the guide some houses are okay to be entered with local companion
Name: Sade Traditional Weaving Village

Review: vintage mood on authentic sade village so eye catchy and warm trip about  hour from mataram city due to traffic condition roadway was good youll never find any trouble entrance fee is free but have some tour guide tips and charity for the villagers i bought some kain tenun k with good design
Name: Sade Traditional Weaving Village

Review: first of all  i dont like when i am forced to buy stuff i dont need or i dont like in this case that i dont need this village gives me the impression that it is to lure people to think that all those products are made there but i strongly doubt sothe guides all say the same thing you can hear them talk like a script they know by heart they will brief you first under the main social house as i call it then take you straight to a shop forcing you to buy stuff believe me all those pieces of clothes are not unique all the shops their have the same ones so think thrice before buyingi am also under the impression that those people do not really live there but i might be wrongnot impressed by the setting at all true you can see one or  things that you havent seen before but i would not say that it is extraordinaryyou can see some weaving tools around but i do not think they are being usedat the end we gave a tip to the guide for his time i looked back and saw that he gave the money to someone else it is an organized business in my point of view
Name: Sade Traditional Weaving Village

Review: stopped here on our way to kuta we got assigned a tour guide but he did not seem all that interested in really showing us the village he ran us through really quick and speaking really fast i think the whole experience was no more than  minutes as everywhere you go you get pressured into buying things could have just skipped itwished i had a better experience to tell
Name: Sade Traditional Weaving Village

Review: unless you really enjoy paying a lot of money for weavings that you can find anywhere else in indonesia this is a place you can skipthe exact same original handwoven scarf we bought there was presented to us later that evening by a street vendor in front of our mataram hoteltour is very poor focused on getting you to buy stuff
Name: Sade Traditional Weaving Village

Review: this is akin to a bazaar selling the local products at an inflated price the sellers are pushy and there are people on the street demanding vehemently for parking fees there is also a donation station to be given for the development of the village and even though the tour can be educational these money hustlers are definitely scaring away tourists like myself something has to be done to curb these uncivilized actions from the people around this village
Name: Sade Traditional Weaving Village

Review: no admission fee yet appreciate if we give some development donation small village so we pnly need to spare  or  hour in this village many villagers sell their handcrafts and hand woven fabric bargaining is ok in this village free guide is available tips is appreciate
Name: Sade Traditional Weaving Village

Review: suku sasak is the original tribe which live in lombok from long time agoits really great to experience the way suku sasak live in dusun sadelearning their culture knowing their home learning how they woven their songket  fabric and so onthough its intresting place itll be better if the government also put effort to maintain the site so its more pleasant for us to visitand for the local guide dont be affraid yes they expect for some allowance for their time but they are polite and always happy how much money that you give them as their tips
Name: Sade Traditional Weaving Village

Review: unfortunately there is nothing about culture just about rippingoff tourists at the parking space you are caught by a guide after that he explained just a few things about the village which was nothing but a tourist market with totally overpriced low quality products which are definitely not handmade you are lied to and ripped off fortunately there is a atm close and after all the guide even asked for a tipp we totally dont recommend going there
Name: Sade Traditional Weaving Village

Review: this is a traditional village where you will find the typical houses sasak people live in the local mosque is impressive even though local people are traditionally farmers growing rice this village will not give you an insight on the rice cultivation but it will present you their second traditional livelihood which is hand weaving therefore nowadays you will find in every house women of different age selling traditional products these products are usually the same and you feel sorry for not buying from everyone from this point of view visiting this village can be also sad i recommend to find a house where is one woman selling paintings they are very impressive and it is not something you find on every corner
Name: Sade Traditional Weaving Village

Review: the place has been upgraded for tourism purposes however you can still see the traditional houses and local people living in that village it was a good experience when the guide allowed us to step in one of the houses and look at the interior insidelocal people were very kind  friendly they were also selling the local  handmade souvenirs such as tshirt accessories keychain magnet etc you are allowed to bargain as they surely give you the best priceit is advisable to wear proper shoes as some of the area was slippery you can also bring hand fan  hat as the weather is quite hot if you go during sunny day
Name: Sade Traditional Weaving Village

Review: we had hired a driver to take us around to other areas of lombok this stop wasnt part of our itinerary it seemed that this was a money making thing and we were here just to spend money having said that it was interesting to see peoples way of living and experiencing their kind hospitality it was fun trying on their traditional outfits
Name: Sade Traditional Weaving Village

Review: it was my third visit there and nothings changed many people tried to sell their tenun to all visitors it was little bit annoying but so far it was interesting way to shop tenun there xoxo
Name: Sade Traditional Weaving Village

Review: i have visited this place twice this time i visited with my wife  wordnothing change a bit it was a good place to learn the sade traditional culture and arts there were some tourist trap though but see the good side they just wanted to earn moneywhen you arrived some guy will approach you and guide you through the village when entered the village you had to fill the guest book and donate feel free to donate its okay the guide would explain everything in this village took you to their houses took you to souvenirs seller you dont have to buy it if you want to buy it try to bargain it as low as possible because i think it was overpriced at the end of the journey through the village it took about  mins the guy would escort you to the exit and say thank you for visiting this is a sign for you to give the tip to the guide feel free to give no matter how much he will say thank you so much with a big smile to you
Name: Sade Traditional Weaving Village

Review: the whole thing appeared bogus to me with the sole objective being commercial and they seem to insist on a guide a waste of time
Name: Sade Traditional Weaving Village

Review: its a good way to understand the traditional ways of the local village  basically a guide will meet you  show you around the village  explain the traditional lombok way of life  the historic values of the houses  although a tourist trap its a great way to support the local people  community as they are still very poor compared to australia
Name: Sade Traditional Weaving Village

Review: when we arrived a youngman approached us and started to explain about this village and its custominitially we were a bit suspiciousbut later on the guy seemed honest and helpful he turned out to be the native to the villagehe took us around the village and even showed us the inside of one of the houses he helped us bargain with the shop owner assisted to take pictures and told several fun fact about the people including the unique way to clean the house and elope is the custom for marriages hereby the end of the tour this guy did not ask for anything we gave him tip to show our gratitude and he accepted it big smile and thank you
Name: Sade Traditional Weaving Village

Review: once you arrived in this place there will be a guide to accompany you the guide was helpful informative and very friendly souvenirs are soo cheap here and good quality interesting place to visit recommended
Name: Sade Traditional Weaving Village

Review: this sasak village is a real one and still being occupied by many families after a few hundred yearsthe guide will tell you about the history how the house is made and show you around  we can even enter the house and take pictures the flooe apparently is made of special mix between clay and cowbuffalo dungsin the villages we can also see how they make the famous kain songket which is made by hand with the help of simple machine one big nice songket can take one to two months to makeit is an interesting and must thing to see  visit if you are in lombok
Name: Sade Traditional Weaving Village

Review: very interesting way of understanding the local culture i am so interested in the traditional architecture of the houses during our visit a guide met us at the back entrance and showed us around the village we also got the chance to enter one of the houses while the guide explained to us on the interior you could give the guide any token as you wish but i think he makes money by directed us to any stall selling hand woven sarong table runner etc the prices however are much higher here compared to other places selling souvenirs
Name: Sade Traditional Weaving Village

Review: this sade village represents to a local life of the lombok tribes living with the styles of their traditional houses the way how local people dress up and home weaving industries which they make for living even though it is now open for tourists and they sell services as well as products but this is also a worth visit local people offer for a service to explain about this sade village and you can just give him a donation if you take his service good to have an explanation from the local people weaving clothing are beautiful and good to purchase a scarf or clothing for a souvenir
Name: Sade Traditional Weaving Village

Review: find out and learn about sasak culture this spot is should be on your list unique place with a lot of local structure house
Name: Sade Traditional Weaving Village

Review: a local person helped me go around he told me their daily lives and culture i entered one of the traditional house and took a photo there half of the local people sold clothes etc to support their finance the guide directed me to go to one of the stalls they couldnt depend on the harvest of farming tourists visit to their village supports their lives
Name: Sade Traditional Weaving Village

Review: a guide took us around the village to see how the locals live and how they weave on a hand made loom sitting prone most of the day this was a casual tour compared to another village we toured then we went to village shop were all woven items are for sale they were over priced but it does support the local villagers
Name: Sade Traditional Weaving Village

Review: great ambience with the traditional village the guide explain how the people live there with local wisdom
Name: Sade Traditional Weaving Village

Review: expecting the traditional and authentic sasak village just like badui dalam village where experiencing how and where sasak people real life without too much commercialized ad busy to sold the kain tenun as traditional sarong but nice people indeed very open and familiar even we enjoy free hot lombok coffee brew by the mother and they even pack me a pretty amount of lombok coffee for my sade village memory love it
Name: Sade Traditional Weaving Village

Review: not authentic disappointing i was expecting a traditional village but saw a village that has been transformed to meet tourist needs and profit from tourist i had mix feelings during the tour where villagers are forced to live in poverty and very minimal living conditions albeit under their own choice
Name: Sade Traditional Weaving Village

Review: honestly im little bit late on writing this review i visited lombok island in december  christmas for a holiday reasonsade village have a very unique culture that very welcoming on outsider tourists not just because it was a destination for just entertainment the sade people called sasak tribe are very kind at the basedi learn so much thing in there about their house about their ways of life about how they thinks and of course about how the can survive in a modern culturein sade village you can found a lot of things that would teach you about how society can be build up and about how weird and awesome they arei highly recommends you guys that who have an interest on social culture and historical catcher to visit this placei dont know if this would help you or not but for some advice you can hire a local guide to accompanying you to exploring not just sade village but the whole lombok and youll understand how beautiful lombok island
Name: Sade Traditional Weaving Village

Review: a visit to a traditional sasak village is a necessary part of your trip to lombokthey will tell you their life story from childhood to adulthood  the most interesting part is when a single men wanted to marry a girl of their choice  single men had kidnapped them in advance before they get married better for you to visit the place and see how they live
Name: Sade Traditional Weaving Village

Review: no other word besides its amazing place  culture must remain on guard and preserved  ive been proud and observing and practicing immediately made of woven fabricsbig big love for desa sade
Name: Sade Traditional Weaving Village

Review: its a great choice if you want to learn about lomboks ancient tradition such as their ways of living and how they get married in this village you can feel a new whole experienceas soon as you walk into the villages gate a local guide will welcome and offer you a tour of the village along the tour you can see many locals that sell handmade souvenir like handwoven fabric tshirt bracelet keychain etc you can also learn how to weave with their traditional way the local guide also invites you into one of the locals house so you can see their bedrooms and kitchendont forget to fill the guest book and leave some donation the donation helps the village preservation and kids tuition fee
Name: Sade Traditional Weaving Village

Review: nice place to learn about lombok traditional village you can buy their local handmade tenun here pretty and colorful
Name: Sade Traditional Weaving Village

Review: if you are someone who likes history and culture this is a place to go here you can find historical house complete with the peoples who are still living in sasak tradition you can also learn how to weave tenun and how to spin thread from pure cotton
Name: Sade Traditional Weaving Village

Review: visiting this village is a wake up call for me as an indonesian that we have so many interesting culture that we have to preserve and i am grateful that these people still preserve their tradition and the indigenousness of their cultural heritage the people are very nice and they offer the story of their village by supplying guides to escort us through their small traditional houses they sell their handicrafts and especially the weaving fabrics such as sarong made of cotton and some with golden or silver yarns even the prices of the fabrics might be more expensive than those we can buy on the beaches from the lady sellers it is just woth to pay for the price since they can use the money to preserve their cultural heritage nice thing also that they dont push you hard to buy the products
Name: Sade Traditional Weaving Village

Review: we didnt expect doing much in lombok we were just having a relaxing driving around holiday to see a different part of indonesia what we wanted was to stay away from the christmas crowdthen we came upon this indigenous village but of course commercialized somewhat now as everywhere else in this country and we were in for a pleasant surprisewe had an english speaking guide who told us about his village how they lived for  generations and how they only obtained electricity  years it was educational and we didnt find the commercial part of the package one bit as no one pushed us to buy productsour teenage son said this was highlight of the trip the boy was bored to death till we cane here he was listening to the guide closely g their religion and culture this is a must visit place if you are interested in people geography and historya fee and a guide was required for every entry
Name: Sade Traditional Weaving Village

Review: first time going to see this village and tried to weave lombok traditional fabric gave some money to the lady who taught me how to weave the fabric there is a big fabric store and since its dedicated for tourist so the price was kinda pricey you can bargain of course but still pricey and you can try on lombok traditional outfit but of course you have to give some money as a tip theres a guy whos going to help you with the outfit my husband and i tried the outfit on and i gave idr  about  and he seemed okay with that lolbut it was fun i guess to visit this place to see some traditional stuff
Name: Sade Traditional Weaving Village

Review: me and my friend went here by renting a car  driver it took around  hour from mataram city and half hours from new lombok airport sade is a hamlet in the village rembitan pujut central lombok sade village still presents a genuine native lombok village atmospheretheir houses are still traditional the roof made from alangalang and the wall made from combinations of clay and cow feces have many functions for their live such as for cleaning the floor washing bathing etc the people in sade village especially the man must sleep outside the house why they have a traditions if they have a daughter they have to protect their daughter from kidnapped in lombok island if a young man want to get married with a young girl he must kidnapped the girl a girl in the sade village must learn to weave from early age so that one day she will weave a traditional woven for herself her husband and her motherinlaw this is also a tradition that a girl must make the woven with a traditional way one woven can take  or  months to get ready for sale sade traditional woven have a unique design the price are around us to us interestingly the villagers had a peculiar habit that is mopping the floor with buffalo dung antiquity when no cement plaster sade sasak people applying buffalo dung at the base of the house that said by way of sostorey houses believed to be warmer and shunned mosquitoes just imagine the dirt was not mixed anything except a little water but when i entered the house no odor wafted former ah for me the sasak sade is a genius
Name: Sade Traditional Weaving Village

Review: wow we have visited most se asia countries and lombok claims top tourist trap spot in region we arrived and a local guy basically grabs you and says he will show you around takes you to a sign in sheet and they ask for donation and write down hi much you give and if not what they want basically tell you to give more we gave  idr for  people and were looked as if we didnt give enough we paid  per person in senaru for  of the most beautiful waterfalls so thought this was more than enough they walk you through the village and show you their house and family at the house tries to sell sovenigerns  we asked if they made and they said no but they get them from a village in lombok geez why do i want to buy something you not make after they start to walk out and say the village is a big family and they only marry in the village at the end the guide then asks for tour money waned another k for less than  hour showing us around save your time and money visit any where else
Name: Sade Traditional Weaving Village

Review: meant to get money from you they show you how sarongs scarves etc are woven and then they dress you up in traditional king and queen clothing so you can take pictures following that they pressure you to buy overpriced woven items from their cooperationfun tour but definitely a tourist trap
Name: Sade Traditional Weaving Village

Review: we were informed by the guide that only  of the lombok people now live in the sasak house made of clay and cow dung yes cow dung that is supposedly keeping away the mosquitoes the guide might have been joking around about the mosquito repellant ability we were welcomed by a few traditional dances one of which interestingly was a fight with what seemed to be real wood hitting till one of them was hurt blood proof here you may purchase hand woven cloths directly from the sasak people no middle men they were very persistent in a sweet kind of way be generous with your purchases  if you have spare space in your luggage the materials may not take up your purse but they do take up space you may even venture inside the cool house to feel what it is like  the upper loft was meant for the unmarried daughters listen to what is meant by being kidnapped by ones husband  its the culture there practiced by the potential groom from a welltodo family if he isnt one he has to officially ask the brides parents for her hand
Name: Sade Traditional Weaving Village

Review: we probably were lucky about the guide helped us with the tour because he was so nicehe explained everything about the life of the people of the village he shew us the house from the inside let us entering and take picturesnobody never stopped us trying to force us to buy their product
Name: Sade Traditional Weaving Village

Review: our guide brought us here while on a private tour of lombok because my spouse and i enjoy learning about the culture and people of the places we visita local guide met us at the gateway and after being paid in advance hustled us through the village which is comprised of about  houses by that i mean we were taken at a rapid pace with barely enough time to ask questions or to snap photos of the traditional houses which are built in rows and throughout our fastpaced tour we were also hustled by the women wanting to sell their weavings learn to say nowhile this village is picturesque and we enjoyed briefly seeing and learning about the rice barns lumbung we learned very little about the sasak or their way of life we would have liked the tour to have lasted longer than the  minutes allotted usthe sasak of sade definitely are entrepreneurs who seem more eager to take your money than to share information about themselves and their village
Name: Sade Traditional Weaving Village

Review: fell bored with beach mountain and shopping center you can go to sade in lombok you can see the girl make a thread and weaving so clever and also we can learn there to make weaving we also can buy the weaving its reasonable and cheap there than we buy in shopping center we also can see a traditional house of sade
Name: Sade Traditional Weaving Village

Review: pleas come here if only u wish to buy the lombok traditional art clothesthe design are all unique and its beautiful but the price is quite high depends on the qualityi didnt buy anything from here just took some photos
Name: Sade Traditional Weaving Village

Review: its a nice way of introducing culture to the visitors however i do not think this is an actual village womenfolk are planted there to showcase the weaving and looming culturethere were entirely no smiles from them while i was there for the hour or so there is no way for us tourists to know how our purchases will actually benefit them or someones business venturesouvenirs sold at the shop behind are also way too expensive while the handicraft was of good quality they were totally too overpriced buy if youre feeling rich
Name: Sade Traditional Weaving Village

Review: be prepared to say no many times to many people as you make your way through the village unless you wish to purchase multiples of the same items as most houses in the village sell the same itemsthe tour was interesting though and do ask to be shown the insides of a house  the kitchen area the sleeping area for the parents and sons their village wells toilets etconly go if you have nothing else to do
Name: Sade Traditional Weaving Village

Review: on the way to sade village we were greeted with a hurricane with heavy rainat sade arrived it was clear that it was muddy yet still made a visitwas nice to see how the village is built but had become already touristic understandable
Name: Sade Traditional Weaving Village

Review: this is a tourist spot its a traditional village of the original lombok inhabitants and one can see their housing and their lifestyles as well as get to talk with a local guide and find out about their lives for that reason its interesting but its also a commercial enterprise as it has to be i guess the village is on the side of a hill so a small bit of climbing involved its hard to think how the villagers actually manage to live on the site with tourists lurking around every corner you are asked for a donation on entering and then there is the guide fee
Name: Sade Traditional Weaving Village

Review: we took a long drive to get to the traditional weaving village after being in the car for  hours with a driver that spoke no english we were just excited to get out and stretch our legs upon arriving a man who spoke very good english greeted us and strapped me in to one of the weaving looms this was very cool as they allowed me to work on their traditional patterns it was pretty cool the man then tried to sell us many goods which we did end up buying we were there for about  minutes total it was cool to see them weaving and making the goods but it was a long hike and maybe no worth the drive if you are near there its worth stopping by
Name: Sade Traditional Weaving Village

Review: this enclosed village is full of traditional huts some for living while others are for economic activities like weaving cloths and selling them the villagers are friendly and you get a glimpse of the village lifestyle if youre fortunate you may get the opportunity to witness village activities ie cooking slaughter of cowbull for feaston the other hand it is also a tourist trap there are many huts selling cloths weaved by the locals you will get many of the locals coming to you trying to sell the cloths and souvenirsother than that it is an excellent visit
Name: Sade Traditional Weaving Village

Review: looks like a partially reclaimed rubbish dump trash everywhere and not much to see or do its a shame these heritage sites in lombok have no maintenance or structure around how they are run
Name: Pura Agung Narmada

Review: we went here after seeing photos and reading the reviews after getting a taxi to the garden we were quite underwhelmed once you see the large pond in the middle youve seen it allif youre passing then pop in as its only idr to get in but i wouldnt go out of your way
Name: Pura Agung Narmada

Review: this temple is really beautiful and clean the environment looks clean and neat here there are also several fish ponds and even beside them there are swimming pools that are open to the public you need to go up and down the stairs a little if you want to explore the entire temple area however you will also be amazed by the surrounding environment
Name: Pura Agung Narmada

Review: at first i would think i would see a beautiful garden in the area i was not the entrance fee was really cheap and the area was quite clean at the front when you got in we could feel that the area was tired the fond was not manage the swimming pool was dirty there are number of filthy shops in the area were really distrust the view the government does not manage the potential area like this well not so many places that we could visit in lombok narmada garden has lots of potential they should do something about it improve the service and the facilities of the area the only thing that interest me was the small temple where you can drink water that make you always look young believe it or not i think the local government need seriously to ensure the place need to be improved a big time
Name: Pura Agung Narmada

Review: beautiful park for relaxing and escape from city life great place for retreat and family friendly fresh air green views absolutely stunning
Name: Pura Agung Narmada

Review: ive been there on pmvery nice weather so we can enjoy the beautiful scenery thereand i try air suci or holy water that makes you look  year youngerhahahaenjoy the routine there
Name: Pura Agung Narmada

Review: its  of the spot to visit in lombok the entrance fee is  for adult and  for kids you dont need to join a tour to visit this place they also offer you a guide someone who has position called mangku i dont know how much they charged since we decided not to use any the place has some historical spot to check out  they also have swimming pool  and a big pond that they believe there was a legend story behind it giant eel story that people feed with coins in order trying to make it show up
Name: Pura Agung Narmada

Review: the gardens are quite beautiful and shadyif you in lombok direction to the benang kelambu waterfall then you will pass this narmada park a time to stop off to enjoy this park inside there is a swimming pool and there is water that supposedly can make younger this park is quite shady and beautiful and almost like a sari garden in jogja
Name: Pura Agung Narmada

Review: it is a small park with a small temple attached ok for a five minute walk the lombok guide days it will cost you  rp to enter in fact they will try and charge you in exceess of x that give it a miss
Name: Pura Agung Narmada

Review: enjoyed the tranquil setting for this beautiful place dont miss a visit here and spend time just sitting and relaxingalso great fruit sellers and a western toilet
Name: Pura Agung Narmada

Review: the palace and gardens are very well maintained and brings you a peace of rest when you enter the main gate just wal around for an hour and take your time to make some very nice picturesonly suitable for people who can climb a few stairs
Name: Pura Agung Narmada

Review: when i went there not many people were there it was calm and refreshing sate bulayak is okay too
Name: Pura Agung Narmada

Review: although we just had short visit to taman narmada on our way back to airport it made us realise that the habit of kings long long time ago were just similar they had plenty of women instead of one queen they had place to watch those women bathing and choose one of them afterward pura agung narmada is famous with its spring water which told could make people younger and healthier by drink and wash their face with it you should pray and say your wishes before do it well believe it or not youd better just do it
Name: Pura Agung Narmada

Review: nice big space but could be so much more if better maintained it has tried to recreate gunung rinjanni i would go there when its dry season pretty messy going there in the rain
Name: Pura Agung Narmada

Review: the area was really huge and it has small lake in the center they have a small temple to get the holly watee but the entrance fee was too expensive so we cancelled it
Name: Pura Agung Narmada

Review: the park is located in the middle of mataram city the park is beautiful green and the scenery is shootingthe park is the story of hindu king there are the room for st empress and nd empress the pool is for king bath the main pool is for fairy bathin the middle of the park there are temple and water springs in it the water springs is believed affected on everlasting beauty and stay youngbeside temple there are church and mosque in the parkinside the park there are lombok authentic cuisine sate bulayak meat or chicken skewers completed with rice wrapped by lontar leavesoutside the park there are little marketits worth place to visit
Name: Pura Agung Narmada

Review: i cant believe why this complex is not as famous as any other tourist sites in indonesiaits basically a royal park complex with a small hindu shrine on top of the hill a small lake and probably a bathing pool in the centre theres a swimming pool also thats barely enjoyable hold your swimming desire there is another interesting uncommon site near this park where you can enjoy a relaxing small cold mountain water called suranadi pool  kolam suranadithe park complex was said to copy the geographical landscape of lombok the old king could not mount the mt rinjani to perform his ritual obligation so he made this park to mimic the geographical landscape so he could perform the ritual in this park instead of climbing that very high mountaincaution the heat in this area like most part of lombok can be scorching hotthe complex is not a fully developed tourist site theres no decent food stall  resto here so be prepared with your drinking water if neededi think people are too concentrated on the beaches in lombok and forget other interesting sites that holds meaningful cultural and historical valuesentry fee us  personcar parking fee us  carestimated visiting time    minutes
Name: Pura Agung Narmada

Review: must visit this place is giant garden  a lot of thing to learn  you can visit this place any time during the day take some videos and pic wouuld be nice
Name: Pura Agung Narmada

Review: there are a few pools here but nothing special about the pools there are a few stalls at the exit selling the souvenir at very good price
Name: Pura Agung Narmada

Review: narmada park is one of the largest and historical park in lombok it was built by raja anak agung ngurah karangasem in  the park was designed to resemble mount rinjani the park houses pura kalasa a hindu temple once a year people come here to perform pujawali ritual giving thanks to the gods for the harvest visitors can also visit balai petirtaan and wash their face or drink from what is believed to be fountain of youth
Name: Pura Agung Narmada

Review: place is not maintained well less visitors less welcomed people and actually nothing much to see it is an overrated place indeed probably better to see waterfall around kuta lombok
Name: Pura Agung Narmada

Review: looks like a parc in the middle of the city incl pond swimming pool  hindu temple closed during our visit nice to do a walk and escape the rush of the citytipsparking irrentrance irr per person
Name: Pura Agung Narmada

Review: narmada hindu temple with pool and park its very relaxing with a lot of trees the constructed the volcano and the lake here in miniature instead
Name: Pura Agung Narmada

Review: this site was apparenly built partly because the king became to old to make a pilgrimage to rinjani so he constructed the volcano and the lake here in miniature instead the grounds are fairly extensive and there is also a swimming pool i didnt try it but the water from the springs is cold no other tourists when i was there just a few local children
Name: Pura Agung Narmada

Review: this place has hindu temples pools parks  green trees its very quiet here and there are pools for visitors but soap or any other body or hair cleaners are not allowed the area used to be the residence of king there are lots of structures with different purposes each of which is explained by a standing wooden board overall this place is good to see and a good alternative of killing time in mataram
Name: Pura Agung Narmada

Review: very good scene the water too cold staff talkable good for religion purpose happy the tour guide
Name: Pura Agung Narmada

Review: had a chance to pray here and was a great experience tranquil yet peaceful place had a chance to wash face at the famous pool too area is very clean good place to go for having a peaceful mind
Name: Pura Agung Narmada

Review: the garden was built by the king in bali on th centuries to replicate the rinjani mountain wellaccording to the story the king used to climb rinjani but at his old age he was not capable to do that and build this gardenthe garden was opened for public by former indonesia president suharto on sthere are many indonesian government people has visited this placei cant tell you much since we only spent  minutes before the heavy rain fallbut again you should go and try the spring water
Name: Pura Agung Narmada

Review: it was filled with local naked kids playing in the fountain water for some reasonvery crowded place and nothing much to seedisappointing
Name: Pura Agung Narmada

Review: as a king playground it is one of the place need to be visited to know the history behind was built as a miniature of the great rinjani mountain and show how the king was use to do during his time
Name: Pura Agung Narmada

Review: we are was traveling around this place have a nice energy for observe inside couple people around and close from hindu village
Name: Pura Agung Narmada

Review: ultimately quite small and not a great deal of information but probably the best we saw in lombokactual ticket price as apposed to a donation  inr and generally hassle free it is picturesquethere is a swimming pool and zip slide amongst the site thar i assume are separate businesses
Name: Pura Agung Narmada

Review: we went in the late afternoon just before closing time as a rain shower was finishing which made for a great temperature and a lovely coolish evening walkthe area was well maintained and the various pools and temples interesting to see there is not much information availablehaving read other reviews  we wanted to get a guide unfortunately there were no guides available i think we would have gotten a lot more from the visit if we had a guide however the visit was still very good and a worthwhile thing to see when in lombokwe liked the friendly local dogs who were around the compoundi would avoid going to it during the heat of the daya highlight was the small museum where my daughters could try the local musical instruments by the way dont trust google maps for the location it will send you about km further down the road than you need to be
Name: Pura Agung Narmada

Review: pura narmada is the miniature of ritual place in rinjani mountaini visited the place with my friend in mid sep when we arrived there the weather is quite cloudy and after  minutes the rain fallwhen entered the pura narmadai sat on view point in the terracei could see all part of the place from thereafter that i visited bale petirtanlocal believe water from the spring that flows in there can give youthfull to the one drink and wash their face using the waterthere are also  more spot in pura narmada the pura iyself praying place for hindu and swimming poolsince the rain fall harder i didnt visit the pura and the pool
Name: Pura Agung Narmada

Review: this pura is truly amazingly traditional and beautiful really makes my day and also romantic place
Name: Pura Agung Narmada

Review: a pretty park close to mataram it was built to imitate rinjani when the king was no more able to climb the mountain easy to reach by public transportthe park is huge enough that you will need more than  hour to explore this is where you can also try local culinary satay beulayak as the place is built on such a hilly place it is not recomended for elderly except that they will just look around in the upper part the place sells souvenirs on the way out bargains before buying oh there is a flying fox as well however i am not sure whether the flying fox is offered everyday you can also swim here the water is free of chlorine there is also huge pond down below the pool where people can hire bebek air tips this is the place where you can mingle with localsthe pura is still in function and if you are lucky you can see them perform their ritualthe area is popular for their rambutan manggo steen and durian the famous tong medaye classified as one of indonesian best durian grow in the area near by
Name: Pura Agung Narmada

Review: like most temples and places of historical significance its best to use a guidewe paid the nominal entrance fee and were greeted by a well spoken local guide his knowledge of the history was very goodwe took our time and strolled around this relatively small park and learnt about the life and times of the last bali king on lombok fascinating to say the least i wont spoil the story heremy partner partook of a religious ceremony to get access to holy waterwe left happy and a bit wiser for the experience with two litres of pure holy water from mt rinjaniwell worth a visit
Name: Pura Agung Narmada

Review: nice place for small walk and in last there is also pretty big swimming pooldidnt look clean entrance for kto be honest i wouldnt go there if i would know what is there except small walk its waste of time in lombok are better places to spend time
Name: Pura Agung Narmada

Review: not many attraction here after a few minutes we go out but it so clean and green you can walk around or just relax here
Name: Pura Agung Narmada

Review: if i did not go there with my relatives who are local people i would not go to this place it is far from everywhere so quiet such a place you can stop by for only  hours it is beautiful actually but not really well managed i like the atmosphere so refreshing around here
Name: Pura Agung Narmada

Review: we visited taman narmada on sunday  jun many people came to the taman narmada and enjoyed the park and its facilitiesinside the park there is also swimming pool and purawe can also see the long and big water pipe under the groundpeople can sit on the hill and look down to the lake while ordering and eating the satay some people are also played flying fox and we can watched them also from the hillrecommended to visit this park
Name: Pura Agung Narmada

Review: near with pura lingsar it has a big land here is located the fountain of youth from three springs which is comes from rinjani mountain such as lingsar springs narmada water eyes and suranadi springs it believes if u drink this water you will stay young
Name: Pura Agung Narmada

Review: not to be missed its simply gorgeouslanscape is stunningdoes have stairs but you can still enjoy the view even if you dont want to climb
Name: Pura Agung Narmada

Review: the green scenery was welcoming us you should hire a tour guide to have the story behind pura agung narmada dont forget to try the water spring that people said can make you forever look young
Name: Pura Agung Narmada

Review: the temple didnt leave a deep impression on me but the rojaksavoury fruit salad in peanut sauce sure did look out for the push cart near the entrance pass the good man k rupiah and you are in for a treat freshly grounded nuts paste and chili fused with an assortment of freshly sliced fruits savoury crunchy and rich
Name: Pura Agung Narmada

Review: this is a pretty cool place go during the week to avoid the crowds there are some very ornate painted wooden pavilions and a fabulously decorated door the pools are clean and inviting the gardens wellmaintained good place for a half day excursion
Name: Pura Agung Narmada

Review: it is good to go on a weekday when it isnt very busy it was a bit cold but it was great to swim in i went on a flying fox across the park and it was great a great place to relax
Name: Pura Agung Narmada

Review: we only spent  minutes there because not much to seeif we want to come to the holy water we must pay idr kthere was a flying fox but very expensiveactually this place is potential if staff can maintain it better
Name: Pura Agung Narmada

Review: it is said to give you eternal youth andor buy a can of spring water and take it to your bath room  its all a matter of trust and dont forget to ask the priest for his blessing
Name: Pura Agung Narmada

Review: since it was a monday there werent many people its a nice place to relax and enjoy the scenery  greens water and temple to enter the temple and water source supposed to be antiageing youll need to donate we hired a guide unfortunately the information shared wasnt much more than whats written on the info board if you can read indonesian  it left me asking is that it the place could also be better maintained for those who enjoy some action there are two flying fox lines that cuts across one of the pools  the shorter one costs rp and the longer one costs rp you will return via a motorbike theres also a public pool and some shops that sell tidbits and souvenirs
Name: Pura Agung Narmada

Review: though its a bit out of the way from mataram or senggigi its a really nice place to visit and see a proper water palace not the joke that is the taman sari in jogjawell laid out gardens lots of water and a very nice balinese temple make this is a delightful place to spend a few hours in do what the locals do and bring some food drinks and make a nice picnic out of it under the many trees here
Name: Pura Agung Narmada

Review: the complex has an interesting history with the king staying here when he was too weak to climb mount rinjani it was his spot where local girls were asked to entertain himit would be great if there was more on the history of this place available throughout the complexthe grounds are relaxing and quiet full of water holes and greenery the big water tank is used by local man to fish standing mostly submerged in the water the place is frequented by locals which makes it a nice getaway from the busy senggigi and mataram full of touristsit also has a swimming pool used by local kids having said that much can be done to fix the state of the full complex repair the remaining buildings and constructions it gives a sense of untidiness and abandonment
Name: Pura Agung Narmada

Review: nice place to interact with locals its a garden with a pool and lake with fountain was build by king when he was too old to go up to mt rinjani its nice to see if u have some time
Name: Pura Agung Narmada

Review: its a nice place for a walk or swim the park is quite big compared to the rest of lombok i think this is one of the more cleaner places to visit
Name: Pura Agung Narmada

Review: what a beautiful place the gardens flowers trees all stunning the layout was so special we saw the harem and where the king lived the information the guide gave was very informative he waits by the front entrance very reasonable price to pay for a very tourthe lake was designed after the shape of the lake on mount rinjani there is also an olympic sized pool open to the public with water from a spring brilliant visit please go
Name: Pura Agung Narmada

Review: the park is very nice it is convenient just to sit and watch the pool from upstairsi love reading history of the park so it would be more interesting if there is a hall for keeping the history of the kingdomidkjust an idea
Name: Pura Agung Narmada

Review: nice to visit in the afternoon i just sat and watched local children swimming in the pool no market and it was quiet silent
Name: Pura Agung Narmada

Review: this was a beautiful  sad experience simply because though the place is one big beautiful serene  peaceful park it seems to hold a lot of sad  painful stories the king frequented this place every year when he became to weak to climb mr rinjani his annual ritual  during his stay here every here young girls were forced to entertain him  those who refused were held captives in the dark rooms beneath the royal house where the king stays exactly opposite the lake  facing the lake i could only imagine the pain these girls would have gone through hundreds of year agoall said it is still a place worth going for the park itself is a beautiful  serene place with greenery everywhere
Name: Pura Agung Narmada

Review: the temple is sure quiet i did not know whether there was a religious ceremony or what make sure to bring your umbrella or wear sunscreen because the sun can be quite unpleasant you can take the stairs to the very top level and relaxing in a wooden gazebo but overall there is nothing special about this temple
Name: Pura Agung Narmada

Review: narmada temple was amazing place historical temple from anak agung karang asem with amazing architecture unique and holy place to explore whole of the temple local guide is needed only idr   idr
Name: Pura Agung Narmada

Review: we went on a sunday in the middle of the afternoon and it was packed lots of people go there for swimming in the pool or just taking pictures some families have arranged picnics there also so it was not as quiet as i predicted the view is very nice but other than that there isnt much to do dont forget to cool yourself down with es kelapa and rujak very recommended
Name: Pura Agung Narmada

Review: good temple big size of pool surrounded by the hill very nice view very green you could spend many hours here with your family must watch place in lombok
Name: Pura Agung Narmada

Review: foreigners have to pay rppax for the entrance feetoo much compared to the other temples locals entrance fee only rp we did not used their guide just strolling and took photos the park is clean and well maintance but nothing much to see however the public toilets are horrible and disgusting exiting the park there are few shops selling souvenirs clothes foods and drinks we were there for only  minutes
Name: Pura Agung Narmada

Review: expensive entrance for what it is but its a calm park if you dont want to pay you can make the tour of the park and you will find  free entrance that the local use the main entrance is for tourist
Name: Pura Agung Narmada

Review: i was surprised to see people doing flying fox in the puri you get to glide across the pool to the far end if you can keep good control over the few seconds it is a novel way to enjoy the serene nature of the placeother than that i think other reviews here cover the sight well that i will not repeatfor me i will always remember this place as one that i used the ladies due to the fact the gents was under renovation
Name: Pura Agung Narmada

Review: this puri was a garden for a royal family of selaparang kingdom to have a regreshing timethe puri itself is a miniaturization of rinjani mountain landscapethey have water tunnel wich is have water source directly from rinjani mountain that located at east lombok and we can used the water here at puri narmada at west lombok and the tunnel was builded more than  years agoand also people believe the water can make us ageless if we drink and wash our face and now its become a famous thing of puri agung narmadamost of people come only to find this waterdont forget if u need younger look come and drink the water and donate for this puris too
Name: Pura Agung Narmada

Review: narmada offer many features such as green scenery old architecture human interest there are pools that crowded with local people every weekend historical site and the lomboks fountain of youthi believe those features would be good alternative while visiting lombok that most of the holiday contain of sunny beachespersonally i went here to pray and once to swin in the pool of natural water without chlorin so fresh and cold too
Name: Pura Agung Narmada

Review: interesting place and worth a visit a few steps to navigate around this pretty park with lots of water features it is the exroyal compound we were very lucky as on the day we went there was a hindu holy day so the temple at the top of the park and the spring with the holy water were both particualrly interesing spots the guide is seemingly obligatory but its only a few usd and well worth it we spent an hour so so there but had it not been a hindu holy day then  mins would have been enough i expect
Name: Pura Agung Narmada

Review: the temple was built by king anak agung gede ngurah karang asem in  ad in the park there is artificial lagoon which resembles the segara anak lake of mt rinjanisnap back caps which are on sale there are very cheap rp each
Name: Pura Agung Narmada

Review: covers quite an area and there is a bit of climbing to do here but it is well worth the effort to visit the guide was multilingual and extremely knowledgeable a good heritage site however the poor management will disappoint many visitors
Name: Pura Agung Narmada
